Short: Dies ist eine private Instanz. Nur folgen, nicht anfassen.

Description:
Users

Mostly people from or close to Paranoidlabs with some exceptions.
Should you want an account on this instance drop me an email and introduce yourself, I usually don't bite ^^

Fediblocks

As maintaining blocklists is a lot of work, this servers blocklist will probably not be up to date or complete. Should you have complaints about the blocklist (missing block, unjustified block, ...) please let me know and we can figure out a solution.

Scraping

DO NOT scrape data from users of this instance without their explicit permission!
Short: Semi-private Mastodon instance for Chaosfield, Paranoidlabs and friends. Mastodon is a decentralized social network without ads or a single corporation you have to trust with your data. Want an account here without e-mail address of the aforementioned domains? Just write me a short mail. I don't bite :P

Date de crÃ©ation de l'instance

L'instance a Ã©tÃ© crÃ©Ã©e dans la nuit du 6 avril 2017. Le premier compte non admin a Ã©tÃ© crÃ©Ã© le 7 avril 2017.

ğŸ–¼ï¸ ThÃ¨me par dÃ©faut

Le thÃ¨me par dÃ©faut de l'instance est Tangerine UI, par @nileane@nileane.fr

https://github.com/nileane/TangerineUI-for-Mastodon

Instances bloquÃ©es

La politique gÃ©nÃ©rale de l'instance Ã©tait de ne pas bloquer les autres instances (et laisser aux personnes membres sur cette instance de dÃ©cider qui bloquer), les Ã©volutions politiques imposent malheureusement des changements au niveau de cette rÃ¨gle.

En plus des relais de spam, crypto ; les instances gÃ©rÃ©es par la sociÃ©tÃ© Meta, plus connue sous les noms Facebook, Instagram, Threads (anciennement Project 92), WhatsAppâ€¦, sont et seront bloquÃ©es par dÃ©faut.

--

La liste de ces instances bloquÃ©es, accompagnÃ©e de la raison, est disponible au bas de cette page.

Dans la liste des serveurs modÃ©rÃ©s, il y a [silencer] (masquer) ou [suspendre] (bloquer). La signification est la suivante :

  • [silencer] : rendra les messages des comptes concernÃ©s invisibles Ã  ceux qui ne les suivent pas ;
  • [suspendre] : bloque l'instance distante, et supprimera tout le contenu mis en cache sur l'instance locale social.nah.re
ğŸš® Liste Fediblock

Aucune liste Fediblock n'est utilisÃ©e sur cette instance.

Si vous ne voyez pas du tout de messages provenant de cette instance, il y ait de fortes chances que votre instance utilise une liste "Fediblock".

Demandez plus de dÃ©tails Ã  l'admin de votre instance.

Cette instance est prÃ©sente dans des liste Fediblock, sans raison valable, sans justification, et sans contestation possible.

ğŸ¤¬ Signalement de contenu illicite

Pour signaler un contenu illicite :

  • Sur Mastodon/Fediverse : utiliser le bouton Â« Signaler Â», dans le menu â€œâ€¦â€ sous les messages ;
  • Sur PeerTube : utiliser le bouton Â« Signalement Â», dans le menu â€œâ€¦â€ sous les vidÃ©os ;
  • Sur Pixelfed : utiliser le bouton Â« Signaler Â», dans le menu â€œâ€¦â€ en haut Ã  droite des images ;
  • Par courrielğŸ“¨, sur l'adresse social (a) nah [point] re ou abuse (a) nah [point] re
ğŸ’¶ CoÃ»t et financement

L'accÃ¨s aux services est gratuit. Les ~530â‚¬ annuels, comprenant les noms de domaine et la location des deux serveurs dÃ©diÃ©s sont sur mes fonds propres.
Cela couvre non seulement Mastodon, mais Ã©galement PeerTube, les sites et services que j'hÃ©berge, les miens et ceux des copains.
Sur Internet, il y a toujours quelqu'un qui paie.

Code of Conduct Â¶

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.


(These best practices were inspired by the rules of chaos.social. Thank you!)

Description:
Server Rules:

- This server is invite-only; for the time being, registrations will not be made public, and invite requests are reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

Code of Conduct:

These are informal guidelines, and not a legal document. Interpretation is up to the scalie.club administrators. These guidelines are here to give you a general idea of what content is or is not allowed on this instance.

- Treat others with respect, and be respectful in kind. Know where the boundaries are for those you interact with. If you accidentally cross them, retreat and apologize.
- Harassment is not tolerated. Harassment campaigns may not be spread here; this includes doxxing and dogpiling. If you must call someone out, do it elsewhere and link it here.
- The Mastodon software has no quote feature for a reason: on other social networks it's often used just to show off how horrible someone else is (boosting their bigoted words into your timeline for others to reject), or to draw followers into an argument that should be one-on-one. Attempts to circumvent this through screencaps are prohibited.
- Sexism, ableism, racism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, and other forms of systemic abuse are not tolerated.
- When it comes to defining what constitutes "systemic abuse", the opinions of the marginalized are given priority at all times.
- This also applies to microaggressions (like intentional misgendering), "ironic" use of racist language, and other dogwhistles.
- Holocaust denial or support for the National Socialist party will result in an immediate ban.
- Sexually explicit images are allowed (encouraged, even!), but they must be behind content warnings and properly tagged. The same goes for discussions of sex.
- All sexually explicit images must exclusively involve consent-capable adults. ("Consent-capable": If asked whether they'd like to pose for an adult photo, they would be capable of responding "yes", and that "yes" would be able to stand up in a United States court of law. That definition leaves room for interpretation, but here's one that doesn't: any porn of a character that's under 18 is strictly prohibited.)
- All other potentially upsetting content must be properly tagged and put behind warnings: this includes discussions of politics, violence, rape, and bigotry. (No faces of famous politicians, please.)
- It's also customary to put selfies and photos of food behind CWs (for the sake of followers with scopophobia and/or eating disorders, respectively), but there is no scalie.club rule enforcing this.
- Bad-faith interpretations of any of the above rules will not be tolerated.

The administration of this website reserves the right to revoke any user's access without warning, for any reason, except as limited by law.

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

This instance uses Ylimegirl's vectors of the Homestuck Extended Zodiac as a custom emote set.

Code of Conduct

There will eventually be a new proper CoC here. Until then, the basic rundown of the instance rules is no untagged porn, no fash, no bigotry, and absolutely no harassment (no, not even if you think they *really* deserve it). Instance administration reserves the right to take down any content for any reason; this includes blocking remote content, users, or servers.

Blocklist scraping policy

Any users/instances found to be scraping our blocklist for any sort of shared blocklist project will be named, shamed, and blocked. We don't want to play any part in that after what happened with Randi Harper's blocktogether list on Twitter.

Description:
ğŸ¦‘â˜•ï¸

This is currently a bare-bones instance. I'm working to add things as I go along. As long as you're okay with some occasional down-time here at the beginning, you'll be good.

I'm not your parent, so act like a decent human being. To that... Everyone deserves freedom, but not harassment. Do the latter and you lose the former.

  • Code of Conduct
    • Content Warnings
    • Enforcement
  • Support
  • To do list
  • Donate
Please note: This is subject to change. If you have suggestions on how to make this better, please contact me.

Code of Conduct Guidelines

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of squid.cafe; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising (mutual aid != advertising)
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged pornography and sexually explicit content
    4. Untagged gore and graphic violence
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
    4. Discrimination against any minority and/or religion
    5. Promotion of suicide or self-harm.
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Depictions of graphic violence against women
    3. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    4. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
    5. Specific threats of violence to an individual or group of people
    6. Sending unwanted sexual content, objectifying others in a sexually explicit manner, or otherwise engaging in sexual misconduct
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviours:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
↑

Content Warnings

CW: On public statuses (not unlisted, private, or direct), content warnings are required for any kind of (explicit enough) violence (with or without pics, including gore, *phobia, abuse, sexual or not) and referring to it; sexual content (pics must already be tagged as NSFW, use a CW if you have text or want to warn about specific content). This is not about what is culturally or religiously accepted, but about common sources of trauma that deeply hurt people for very real reasons. Consider yourself lucky if you don't need any of it, but it's not always about you. This is not a rule to be used by white folks to berate Black people, People of Colour, or other marginalized group to protect your feelings about your own behaviour

They are also appreciated but not mandatory on: politics, spoilers, anything depressing, etc. Use them in a thoughtful, opportunistic way.

↑

Enforcement

On this instance, a status that doesn't follow these rules may be deleted. On repeated offences or if disturbing public timelines, the account may get silenced (only their followers will see statuses). If silencing is not enough, the account may get completely suspended.

If the account is on another instance, it may get silenced and suspended from here, and I will not hesitate to share reports with other instance admins.

I'll always try to solve problems in the most rational and safe way possible for users, and try to discuss any issue with the people concerned if I think it's worth it. If you at least try to be good and comprehensive, so will I. I understand and accept mistakes, but not being bad on purpose.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

↑

Support

  • Get support

Miscellaneous

  • My To-do List
↑

Want to help keep this going?

Donations will help keep this instance alive. Funds from here will go directly to the hosting bill.

  • Patreon (monthly)
  • Buy me a coffee.
  • Cash.me (1-time)
  • PayPal.me (1-time)

Route66.Social Code of Conduct




Our Pledge

In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, we as route66.social administrator(hereafter referred to as admins) pledge to make participation in our server and our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

Our Standards
Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment include:

  • Using welcoming and inclusive language
  • Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
  • Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
  • Focusing on what is best for the community
  • Showing empathy towards other community members


Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include:

  • The use of sexualized language or imagery and unwelcome sexual attention or advances
  • Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
  • Public or private harassment
  • Publishing othersâ€™ private information, such as a physical or electronic address, without explicit permission
  • Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting



Our Responsibilities
Admins are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable behavior and are expected to take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any instances of unacceptable behavior.
Admins have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, posts, media, links and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, or to ban temporarily or permanently any user for other behaviors that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.
Scope


This Code of Conduct applies within all route66.social interactions, and it also applies when an individual is representing route66.social or its community in public spaces. Representation of a project may be further defined and clarified by project maintainers.
Enforcement


Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported by contacting the project team at https://route66.social/web/@admin. All complaints will be reviewed and investigated and will result in a response that is deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. The route66.social team is obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident.
Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately. Administrators who do not follow or enforce the Code of Conduct in good faith may face temporary or permanent repercussions as determined by other members of the route66.social's leadership.


Attribution This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 1.4, available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4/code-of-conduct.html For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq
Short: Route66.social is my own little piece of the fediverse.  Mainly people I know (and 1 tech support dude who helped me sort some stuff out).  At this point we're just a jump off point to the fediverse.

This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

I, Alex Daily, do not give anyone permission to archive any part of the domain beepboop.one, with the exception of the /about and /about/more pages.

You can get in touch with me in the following places:

  • On Mastodon: @Alexis@beepboop.one
  • On Twitter: @heyalexdaily

Accounts on Beep Boop One include:
  • @Alexis - Site Administrator, personal account.
  • @emojistation - Promoting my custom emojis for use by others.
  • Three other accounts exist for private or as yet mysterious reasons.


This is a private instance. I reserve the right to proactively block, silence, or fully suspend any user or instance at my own discretion, but the following things are things I will always block, silence, or suspend:
  • Instances that actively support or encourage material that is illegal in Europe, specifically the Netherlands or Portugal, which are where I live and where this instance is hosted, respectively.
  • Instances that actively support or encourage harassment.
  • Instances that actively support or encourage behaviour in line with the ideologies of white supremacy, white nationalism, Nazism, or similar ideologies.
  • Instances or users that I find personally annoying.

In addition, the following individual behaviour will never be tolerated:
  • Racism
  • Sexism
  • Homophobia
  • Transphobia
  • Miscellaneous harassment.
  • Any kind of Nazi shit.

Please understand that this list is not comprehensive or complete, and that this, again, my own, private instance: if you shit on my floor, you're not gonna do it a second time.

I will not list instances I have blocked or suspended, because I refuse to give them free advertising. If you're an innocent person caught in my comprehensive blocks and want to follow me, get in touch, we'll see if we can work something out.

    • Custom emojis are imported freely and without credit, just as all of mine are free to be imported without credit.

Rules

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate harrassment, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate racism, sexism, verbal abuse, discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or the advocation of any of these.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • Do not contact people who made clear they want no contact. This includes dogpiling/brigading.
  • Posts with sexual content or gore have to be tagged.
  • Advertisements have to be tagged, and must not be excessive or automated.
  • Automated posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • If you need to post with a high frequency, please set your posts to be unlisted to keep the local timeline readable.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to, and try to avoid irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language â€“ they typically don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

Description:
Full Code of Conduct

Computerfox.xyz is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

This code of conduct applies to all Computerfox.xyz spaces, including Mastodon and any organizational spaces defined by Computerfox.xyz staff, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the Computerfox.xyz administrators and moderation team.

Some Computerfox.xyz spaces may have additional rules in place, which will be made clearly available to participants. Participants are responsible for knowing and abiding by these rules.


Definitions of Harassment

Harassment includes:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, age, race, or religion.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a personâ€™s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of â€˜deadâ€™ or rejected names.
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where theyâ€™re not appropriate.
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or "backrub") without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence.
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • Deliberate intimidation.
  • Stalking or following.
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes.
  • Sustained disruption of discussion.
  • Unwelcome sexual attention.
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease.
  • Deliberate â€œoutingâ€ of any aspect of a personâ€™s identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse.
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication.

Computerfox.xyz prioritizes marginalized peopleâ€™s safety over privileged peopleâ€™s comfort. Computerfox.xyz administrators and moderation team reserves the right not to act on complaints regarding:

  • â€˜Reverseâ€™ -isms, including â€˜reverse racism,â€™ â€˜reverse sexism,â€™ and â€˜cisphobiaâ€™
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as â€œleave me alone,â€ â€œgo away,â€ or â€œIâ€™m not discussing this with you.â€
  • Communicating in a â€˜toneâ€™ you donâ€™t find congenial
  • Criticizing racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Content Warnings and Sensitive Images

Content Warnings (CWs) are a feature of Mastodon that enable you to hide the body of a â€œtootâ€ (post) behind a line of text. The intended use of this feature is to provide a way to discuss sensitive and/or potentially harmful topics without causing duress or harm to anyone who might stumble upon it, though it may be used for many other things.

Images can be marked as sensitive; this is a feature which hides an image until a warning banner is clicked. Images may be marked as sensitive separately from Content Warnings, though using a Content Warning automatically marks the tootâ€™s images as sensitive.

Clearly communicated and accurately labeled content warnings and sensitive image settings are required when having public conversations involving any of the following topics or content:

  • Sexual or Adult content
  • Detailed descriptions of harassment as outlined above in the definitions of harassment
  • Political Commentary of any kind
  • Drugs or Drug Use
  • Advertisements for Corporations
  • â€œRageâ€ toots and Toots using exclusively capital letters
  • Excessively Long Toots (longer than ~15-20 lines)

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a member of Computerfox.xyz, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact the Computerfox.xyz administrators and moderation team using the Report User/Toot feature. If the person who is harassing you is on the team, they will recuse themselves from handling your incident. We will respond as promptly as we can.

This code of conduct applies to Computerfox.xyz spaces, but if you are being harassed by a member of Computerfox.xyz outside our spaces, we still want to know about it. We will take all good-faith reports of harassment by Computerfox.xyz members, especially Computerfox.xyzâ€™s administrators and moderation team, seriously. This includes harassment outside our spaces and harassment that took place at any point in time. The abuse team reserves the right to exclude people from Computerfox.xyz based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Computerfox.xyz spaces and behavior towards people who are not in Computerfox.xyz.

In order to protect volunteers from abuse and burnout, we reserve the right to reject any report we believe to have been made in bad faith. Reports intended to silence legitimate criticism may be deleted without response.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom weâ€™ve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them, if we believe that doing so will increase the safety of Computerfox.xyz members or the general public. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.


Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, Computerfox.xyz administrators and moderation team may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Computerfox.xyz spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Computerfox.xyz members or the general public.

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Finally, Computerfox.xyz will suspend any instance launched, acquired or funded by Alphabet, Facebook, Twitter, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, or Elsevier.


PS: only under limited circumstances are any posts teasing deme to be deleted.

Description:
What is toot.sh?

Toot.sh is a mastodon instance, we welcome all content within our rules and policies but do not require a specific focus. We are generally a group of professionals in the tech industry, so if that's you and you're looking for a mastodon home, you're very welcome here.

How we moderate

Moderation is carried out inline with our server rules. If you are being harassed or otherwise see content that is breaking our rules, please report the user. Click the "..." button and then "Report". For urgent concerns please DM Elliot.

In the future if/as this instance grows we will look at a way to bring in a more transparent moderation process and team. Currently while the instance is both tiny and those here are content with it moderation is be carried out by the server administrators listed on the about page.

Privacy policy

We will not do anything with your data aside from using it to run this mastadon instance. No advertising, no algorithms, no aggregating data.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests if it comes to that. Simiarly, users and third parties are forbidden from scraping content from the instance's web interface or API; you are required to respect robots.txt files.

Some additional privacy measures we take on toot.sh are:

  • HTTPS is used across the entire site.
  • There are no adveritsments or trackers.
  • We do not alter URLs to add additional tracking (although users may use tracking links from services like bit.ly of their own choice).

In addition to the above it is worth noting that this instance is run by Elliot plus additional volunteers. Anyone with access to the server for maintenance purposes could potentially have access to your data, including direct messages (DMs). There is no End-to-End Encryption (E2EE) on Mastodon. For anything you wish to be turely private, you should use a service like Signal.
Short: Toot.sh is a small network of professionals in the tech industry, all are welcome and general use is encouraged as long as you follow our rules.

Description: A Pleroma instance, an alternative fediverse server

Who we are

We're a small general purpose server just looking for a quiet life.

Most of us here are friends who have been here for years and at present we're not open to taking on new users.

Basic rules

Content we do not allow that will lead to limiting of accounts or suspension includes but is not limited to:

  • Harassment, block evasion, continuing to contact people after they've asked you to stop.
  • Hate speech and bigotry (queerphobia, racism, colourism, antisemitism, xenophobia, sexism, ableism).
  • Cryptocurrency, NFTs, or other financial scams.
  • Advertising, spam. We also prohibit direct asks for aid or unsolicited demands to boost posts or links.
  • Federation and other mass follow bots, archiving bots.
  • Malicious links and phishing.
  • Untagged NSFW and violent content.
  • Crossposting boosts and replies to Twitter without user consent.
  • Being a dick to sex workers

Moderation is at our discretion. Even if you haven't gone against any of the stated rules, we may still limit accounts or servers that are acting in bad faith, spreading harmful content, or otherwise causing problems.

Federation policy

We block instances that

  • Have no active prohibition against hate speech and bigotry.
  • Carry content illegal in the UK or Germany

We will also defederate with servers with users who continually go against our core rules. Like the basic rules, moderation of federation is also at our discretion and may occur for any reason.

Description:
New members

If you want an account at transmom.love Iâ€™ll make one for you if:

  1. I (@elilla) know who you are personally, and
  2. You feel like 'trans mom' applies to you in any way (not necessarily as a literal childcarer).

Benefits of using a masto account here:

  • generous limits for toot length/profile fields/etc.
  • will add emojos upon request, just DM me (large blobcat curation already)
  • will block on sight, just DM me (large blocklist already)
  • glitch-soc features (https://glitch-soc.github.io/docs/ )
  • blazing fast thanks to my loving benefactress<3
  • admin is hot
  • Email forwards and Matrix chat @transmom.love available upon request

Drawbacks:

  • mostly empty "Local" timeline
  • limited federation as of now
  • software may be unstable
  • no themes but default ones as of now
  • CW common triggers and uncomfortable subjects, including politics.
  • CW all animal products including nonvegan food, leather, wool, honey etc.
  • CW lewds.
  • CW text posts too, not just images.
  • Caption all images and media, even if with two or three words.
  • No ableism, no body shaming, including insults when punching up. This includes any depreciative terms about a personâ€™s appearance, physical or mental health, and so-called â€˜intelligenceâ€™, even about bad people.
  • Donâ€™t question the self-reported experiences of marginalised people.

Goes without saying but zero tolerance for: fash, terfism, transmedicalism, white fragility, islamomisia, anti-semitism, swerfism/any kind of sex worker erasure, racism including racist pseudoscience, sexualisation of children, cop apologetics, and centrist/â€˜free speechâ€™ enabling of any of the former.

Description:
This is a social movement about sneakers, sneaker art, sneaker style, sneaker fashion, and sneaker happiness. #sneakerwave #sneakers #ã‚¹ãƒ‹ãƒ¼ã‚«ãƒ¼ #ìš´ë™í™” #ootd

Welcome! If you decide to create an account, please post something within 3 days. If your posts looks spammy, your account may be "Limited" (hidden from other users). The reason is that this is an experimental and relatively tiny Mastodon instance, and we don't want the Local Timeline to be overwhelmed.

Guidelines

How about some post ideas?

  • New sneaker cop, haul, or unboxing.
  • Just wearing your favorite pair of sneakers.
  • Your sneaker collection.
  • Dance moves.
  • Show off sneakers in the gym.
  • Visiting your favorite coffee shop.
  • Tour around your hometown or other places.
  • Goofing around and be silly.
  • Custom designs, paint jobs, sole swaps.

Privacy Advices

Be careful what you share.

  • Use a pseudonym if you don't want to use your real name.
  • Post travel pictures only after you've returned home safely.
  • Meet people with a friend, or meet at a public safe place where you can leave safely if you don't feel comfortable. Arrange for your own rides.

Code of Conduct

This code of conduct applies to all interactions, including post, media, and boosts.

For everyone

  • Be nice and respectful. We want to bring people together through mutual appreciation, not to divide by fighting wars.
  • No destruction of sneakers.
  • No pornography or depiction of sexual acts. This includes text and hashtags in a post. (Have you considered OnlyFans instead?)
  • Artistic nudity of adults requires NSFW tagging. No display of genitals.
  • Sexual content involving minors is strictly forbidden.
  • No depiction or promotion of tobacco, vape, marijuana or drug use.

Messy and a little kinky is fine. Do not post about something that would get you arrested in the public.

For businesses and commercial activities

This is not a marketplace to sell sneakers, but we want to feature unique custom designs. If you decide to post product images, make sure you put some creative thought into making it interesting.

Definitely no fakes or replicas. Do not repost. No sale or discount offers.
Short: This is a social movement about sneakers, sneaker art, sneaker style, sneaker fashion, and sneaker happiness. #sneakerwave #sneakers #ã‚¹ãƒ‹ãƒ¼ã‚«ãƒ¼ #ìš´ë™í™” #ootd #ì˜¤ì˜¤í‹°ë”” #çƒé‹ç©¿æ­

Impressum

Michael Pfister

CH-3177 Laupen
E-Mail: michael (at) main-angler.de

Verhaltensregeln

Da "Geht gut miteinander um" einfacher gesagt als getan ist, haben wir eine (nicht vollstÃ¤ndige) Liste von Verhaltensweisen aufgestellt, die zu einer LÃ¶schung von TrÃ¶ts(Nachrichten) und zu einer Blockierung von Accounts fÃ¼hren kÃ¶nnen, wenn die Probleme fortbestehen. Insbesondere tolerieren wir nicht: BelÃ¤stigung, Stalking, Doxxing Rassismus, Sexismus, Beschimpfungen oder deren BefÃ¼rwortung Diskriminierung von Geschlechtern und sexuellen Minderheiten oder deren BefÃ¼rwortung Nationalistische Propaganda, Nazi-Symbolismus oder FÃ¶rderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus Leute kontaktieren, die klar gemacht haben, dass sie keinen Kontakt wollen.

Dogpiling

Nicht markierter sexueller Inhalt und/oder Gewaltdarstellungen Werbung, die nicht als Werbung getaggt, automatisiert, oder auch Ã¼bermÃ¤ÃŸige erfolgt. Bots, die ohne ihre expliziten Anfragen, ob es gewÃ¼nscht ist, mit Nutzern interagieren Bots, die nicht als Bot (in den Einstellungen) markiert sind. Bitte melden Sie Verhalten, das Sie stÃ¶rt. Das schlieÃŸt Verhalten von anderen Instanzen mit ein - wir sind sehr gerne bereit, mit Instanzen die Verbindung zu unterbrechen, die sich negativ verhalten. Basierend auf dem "About" von chaos.social verfÃ¼gbar in deren Github-Repository.

Relaying

Wir nutzen im Moment alle die unter
  1. ap-relay-ger.650thz.de
  2. relay.libranet.de
  3. federation.stream
  4. mastodon-relay.thedoodleproject.net
  5. relay.mp-development.de
gelistet sind.

Was bedeutet Relaying?

Alle Nachrichten (Toots), die Ã¶ffentlich markiert sind und auf der lokalen Zeitleiste erscheinen, werden zusÃ¤tzlich auf den o.g. Relay Ã¼bergeben und somit zusÃ¤tzlich in den lokalen Zeitleiste auf den teilnehmenden anderen Instanzen eingeblendet. Dies fÃ¶rdert kleinere Instanzen um mehr Inhalte in der lokalen Zeitleiste angezeigt zu bekommen. Ihr mÃ¼sst hierzu selbst nichts machen, dies geschieht automatisch.

Threads

Im Moment wird Threads nicht von uns blockiert, was sich aber noch Ã¤ndern kann. Es ist aber natÃ¼rlich jedem Benutzer freigestellt, Threads von sich aus zu blockieren,
Short: Hier geht es um das schÃ¶nste Hobby der Welt - angeln. Zeigt eure FÃ¤nge, teilt eure Erfolge und Niederlagen, gebt Tipps -  was immer ihr wollt.

Description:
VRParty.social ğŸ¥½

VRParty is a VR-focused Mastodon instance, Mastodon is an open-source federated micro-blogging platform with a similar feel to Twitter. Learn more about Mastodon on their official website joinmastodon.org.

The instance is focused on VR but non-vr related content is allowed.

You can follow @Reno, the owner, for instance updates and information.

You can visit our website here for more detailed information: Link

Covenant

VRParty follows the Mastodon Server Covenant, in the event of a shutdown, users will be alerted 3 months ahead of time in order to migrate their accounts off of vrparty.social.

Staff

At the moment I, @Reno am the only staff member.

Learning Mastodon / Mobile apps

  • What is Mastodon (Video): Link

  • How to use Mastodon (Video): Link

  • How to move to another Mastodon instance (video): Link

  • Mastodon mobile apps: If you are looking for other ways to access Mastodon this page should help you: Link

  • Mastodon on GitHub: Link

Theme

VRParty uses Birld-like UI as its theme, more info can be found here: Github

DMCA Takedown Requests

Only content posted by users with "@vrparty.social" in their username is managed by this server. If you find infringing material from a user on our server, make sure it is not covered by Fair Use, then send your takedown request to this instance's admin email ([hello] @ [vrparty.social]).

Some more info

This instance is hosted by masto.host.

  • Daily backups on all services / bi-weekly off-site backups off of masto.host

  • Media CDN

Social.Rights.Ninja is a small Mastodon instance for those looking for a quiet home-base from which to explore the fediverse.

All participants of this instance are governed by our Code of Conduct.

Description:
[English below]

Deze instance is alleen voor familie en vrienden. De infrastructuur is niet geschikt voor grote hoeveelheden gebruikers. Mocht je denken dat je onder familie of vrienden valt, maak dan vooral een account aan, maar heb wel even het geduld om te wachten tot ik 'm kan goedkeuren.

Omdat het dus voor een klein groepje is en de server toch wel draait, is een financiÃ«le bijdrage niet nodig. Mocht je toch willen bijdragen, dan kun je persoonlijk contact met mij opnemen.

[English]

This is a private instance for friends and family. If you think you are either, feel free to register, but please be patient: I have to manually approve your account. The server is multifunctional and will run anyway, so I have no need for financial support. If you still want to support me, please contact me.

Description:
Joining The Instance

First, please fully read this page to determine if this instance is a good fit for you, and submit an invite request to minori@vael.town, including some details about yourself and any relevant personal links, galleries, etc to give us an idea of the sort of content you post. Keep in mind there's preference for sites that do not require a login to view. We can't check Facebook or Instagram, personal sites are appreciated!

The instance requires invites to prevent spam and frivolous requests from users who do not want to read this page. The goal is to keep the instance relatively small, cozy, community-like, harassment-free, and the content aligned to our instance goals, so we perform a quick manual review for new account requests. Most requests will be checked within 24 hours (though typically much less).

Instance Values

  • This is a community focused primarily on expression through creative output, projects, and the exploration of ideas; as opposed to typical mainstream social media algorithms that promote draining, divisive and reactionary behaviors.
  • We recognize the urgent need for technology and society to reorient around sustainability, equality, open standards, and more ethical forms of computing and social media.

Community Ethics

We stand aggressively against sexism, racism, transphobia, homophobia, ableism, ethnocentrism, and speciesism.

Our members are also generally opposed to nationalism, religious fundamentalism, and other violent or coercive power structures.

Animal Rights

Some of us subscribe to a non-speciesist worldview and would like to keep animal cruelty off of our timeline(s). Promotion of content related to the human exploitation of other animals, including non-incidental depictions of the use of animal body parts or other derivatives as food, clothing or other material for human consumption is prohibited.

Allowance is made for discussion in opposition or protest of these behaviours as long as any media is tagged with a Content Warning where appropriate.

NSFW

NSFW content is permitted as long as it's on-topic to the community and appropriately tagged with a Content Warning as nsfw, i.e. original artistic works that include NSFW subject matter or imagery.

Perhaps obviously, any content that is clearly problematic, exploitative, non-consensual, or illegal according to US laws (where the instance's data is stored) is not allowed.

Marketing and Promotion

We heartily encourage the sharing of personal projects, even monetized ones. You're welcome to add appropriate storefront, merch, fundraising etc links to your profile description, and to post content related to your project(s).

We do however discourage using your account as a primary outlet to actively advertise a business venture. Typical commercial/corporate posting behaviour is often not well received on the Mastodon network. Using this instance to collect marketing data or to engage in unsolicited direct or mass advertising is prohibited.

The promotion of any form of organized religion is prohibited.

Cryptocurrencies, NFTs, AI

We recognize that:

  • Many cryptocurrencies, AI content generators, related technologies, and the culture(s) surrounding this topic are largely incompatible with our other stated values.
  • AI and Crypto tech is environmentally wasteful, unsustainable, and dangerously destabilizing.
  • Artists of all kinds have been forced to deal with scams and exploitation involving the theft of their artworks. The current nature of crypto and AI tech makes these incidents irreversible and largely unpreventable, leaving artists without recourse. In many cases this has had a chilling effect on the ability of artists to continue safely sharing their legitimate work online, especially on mainstream social media platforms.
  • Within the AI content generator scene, the copyrighted work of real artists, developers, and writers are exploited to train for-profit AI's and automatically generate content which closely replicates original human works or personal styles without permission, license, or any compensation to the original artist. In the vast majority of cases, this tech is not used as a tool for inspiration (as is often claimed), but rather for completely bypassing the creative process and laundering human-made artworks.

Our policy is thus to prohibit the posting and promotion of cryptocurrencies, NFTs, and content generated from any AI that is trained on harvested data. We will also limit or block any federated account or instance that appears to be used for the purposes of promoting or acquiring content for use as NFTs or for training AIs.

Cross-posting

Sharing similar content across your network is fine, but automatic or scripted cross-posting or mirroring to or from Vael with other social networks or instances is highly discouraged. It tends to lead to bot-like accounts that don't otherwise participate much in the community, and such accounts will be subject to removal.

Staff

[ @minori ]: Administrative Entity

[ @edmond ]: Instance admin

Privacy, Security, Data

We only store cookies and collect what data is necessary for the normal functional operation of the Mastodon software & network. No data harvesting is done for the purposes of marketing or advertising, nor will we ever sell or otherwise provide your data to any outside party, except if required by legal process or law enforcement action.

See the long version here: https://vael.town/terms

While no security guarantee could ever be 100%, our server admin has years of experience developing, hardening, and participating in auditing the security of production applications. Every reasonable effort is made to ensure the security of the instance, servers, and data to the best of our ability.

This instance subscribes to the Mastodon Server Covenant.

We highly encourage all instance users to participate in the security of the instance by using strong passwords and enabling two-factor authentication in their account settings.
Short: Vael Town is a Mastodon instance for artists, musicians, developers, and other like-minded creatives who practice and identify with concepts such as sustainability, open & independent web standards, human & animal rights, and divestment from dominant tech & power structures. We endeavor to build a community that energizes rather than drains, and mutually inspires expression through creative output.
This server is all about Camp Darling.  If you have stayed as a guest, or would one day like to, please feel free to register an account.

Description:
What is this server about?

We share the panda as a spirit animal.

If you can relate, this could be your place.

What this server is not about

  • Furry content

This server is not intended for furry content and we are not relaying from/to other furry instances.

Please checkout other instances: It will be easier for you to connect to other people sharing your interests.

  • Porn

Please don't post porn, neither of yourself nor of anyone else. No exceptions.

  • Selling drugs

Selling drugs is not allowed here.

  • Religion

This instance is not for

  • Musk, Trump, Rogan, Tate fan boys
  • Crypto Bros
  • Right-wing people in general
  • Pro/Anti-* Activism
  • Any sort of hate against anyone
  • Bots

DMCA / Intellectual Property

Send DMCA complaints to the email address linked on the /about page.
Short: by pandas for pandas.

Description:
Casual banter about plants and coffee. An occasional Livestream might occur here as well.

This is a generic instance run voluntarily, if you can spare a cup of coffee to help keep this running, head over to ko-fi.
Short: Casual banter about plants, coffee and an assortment of other random topics.

Description:
Dit is de mastodon testserver van mfbfreaks.nl Registratie is mogelijk: we heten philips liefhebbers van harte welkom.

Serverregels
Hieronder staat de samenvatting van onze regels die je op de mastodon.mfbfreaks.nl server gelden:

Heb respect voor elkaar. Be excellent!
Geen discriminatie of aanzetten tot haat.
Geen verspreiding van complottheorieÃ«n.
Geen verspreiding van pornografie.
Geen verspreiding van materiaal dat illegaal is.


mastodon.mfbfreaks.nl is een Nederlandstalige server, onderdeel van het Mastodon sociale netwerk.
Een proef van mfbfreaks.nl voor liefhebbers van mfb, of (philips) audio in het algemeen. Maak dus geen referrers of linkjes naar hatelijke, politieke, sexistische of racistische inhoud (de admin oordeelt zelf) Doe geen dingen die illegaal zijn, en ook geen reclame of spam.

Doel hiervan is om een alternatief te geven voor het forum van de website, je kunt het hier dus prima over philips, mfb, audio, hifi en andere zaken hebben. Uiteraard kun je ook leuke dingen van elders op het Internet hier met elkaar delen.

Hoe gaat het in zijn werk?
Mastodon is in het algemeen een sociaal netwerk bestaand uit steeds meer servers. Het lijkt een beetje op Facebook, Twitter, en Google Plus want je kunt berichten delen met tekst, video's en foto's; en je kunt mensen volgen. Ook kun je bepalen waar, of aan wie, een bericht zichtbaar mag zijn. Het bijzondere is dat er geen centrale website is die alles bepaalt zoals bijvoorbeeld bij Twitter, Facebook. De duizenden servers waaruit het Mastodon netwerk is opgebouwd zijn namelijk onafhankelijke servers die gezamelijk dit netwerk vormen.

Tijdlijnen
De "Start" pagina toont berichten van mensen die je volgt en je kunt met een mastodon-account op deze server mensen vanuit het werdeldwijde Mastodon netwerk volgen.
Dus als je iemand tegenkomt of kent met een account op een Mastodon server, onafhankelijk welke server, hoef je dus geen extra account te maken want je kunt een ieder vanuit hier volgen!

Mastodon is dus een "decentraal" open netwerk, te vergelijken met e-mail, blogs, podcasts, en andere open systemen. Je keuze voor deze mastodonserver is net zoals je zelf kiest waar je jouw e-mail account aanmaakt, en bijvoorbeeld welke website of welk programma je gebruikt om e-mail te lezen. Er bestaan in de appstore dan ook diverse programma's/apps waarmee je Mastodon kunt krijgen op je telefoon, deze zijn op dit moment allemaal server onafhankelijk. Je hoeft echter niet perse een handige app te installeren, hier online inloggen kan ook namelijk.

De "Lokaal" pagina toont berichten die "openbaar" zijn, gedeeld door mensen vanaf mastodon.mfbfreaks.nl. Dit is een beetje te vergelijken ons forum, want alleen onze eigen leden / accounts dragen bij aan wat hierin staat. En onze lokale beheerder(s) zullen indien nodig spam verwijderen of andere regels handhaven.

De "Globaal" pagina toont berichten vanuit het grotere Mastodon netwerk, inclusief van de duizenden andere servers, en soms ook in andere landen en talen. Dit is een beetje te vergelijken met een zoekmachine. Net als met zoekmachines, is elke zoekmachine anders. Onze "Globaal" pagina toont voornamelijk berichten van Mastodon servers waar Ã©Ã©n of meerdere van onze gebruikers mee in aanraking zijn gekomen. Je kunt, indien nodig, zo'n server rapporteren want mocht er ongewenst gedrag vertoond worden, kan deze geblokkeerd worden.

Wanneer je op een hash-tag klikt, kom je automatisch op de Globaal pagina uit, met de hash-tag als zoekopgave. Zo kun je bijvoorbeeld nieuws, muziek, of andere interessante berichten Of personen ontdekken.

Berichten tooten: zichtbaarheid Een Mastodonbericht wordt ook wel een toot genoemd. Voordat je een bericht plaatst, kun je de zichtbaarheid bepalen.

Openbaar Overall zichtbaar.
In Lokaal, Globaal, in zoekresultaten, op je profiel, en voor volgers op hun Start pagina.

Minder openbaar: (unlisted)
Zichtbaar op je profiel, voor volgers op hun Start. In principe voor iedereen toegankelijk wanneer ze een link krijgen, bijvoorbeeld wanneer het via-via met hen is gedeeld. Niet in zoekresultaten. Niet in Lokaal/Globaal.

Alleen volgers:
Alleen toegankelijk voor je volgers, getoond op hun Start.

Direct:
Alleen toegankelijk voor mensen die je in het bericht met een @ apenstaartje vermeldt. Getoond onder "Directe berichten".


Het is vaak de gewoonte om langere berichten, gesprekken, of draadjes, met de "Minder openbaar" zichtbaarheid te plaatsen. Hiermee voorkom je dat gedeeltes van gesprekken, of reacties daarop, zonder context in een openbare tijdlijn komen te staan.

Reacties op een bericht hebben standaard dezelfde zichtbaarheid als het bericht waar je op reageert.

Je kunt bijvoorbeeld als je meerdere berichtjes over hetzelfde onderwerp wil plaatsen, het eerste bericht plaatsen met zichtbaarheid "Openbaar" plaatsen en doorzoekbaar maken met een paar hash-tags, en dan daarop reageren met zichtbaarheid "Minder openbaar" voor de rest. Dan kan iedereen het draadje ontdekken, maar alleen het begin van het draadje komt dan in Lokaal en Globaal te staan.

Berichten tooten: CW-kopjes
Berichten gerelateerd aan politiek, en ander mogelijk gevoelige onderwerpen zijn niet altijd toegestaan. En is het de sociale norm voor zulke berichten de "CW"-knop gebruiken zodat mensen ervoor mogen kiezen wanneer ze dit wel of niet lezen, afhankelijk van hun humeur (voorbeeld).

De CW-knop kan ook in andere gevallen nuttig zijn, zoals:

Een bericht over de uitkomst van een sportwedstrijd.
Een bericht over de plot van een film of TV-serie die momenteel gaande is.
Verberg de clou van een mop of raadsel ğŸ˜ƒ (voorbeeld).

Waarin verschilt mastodon.mfbfreaks.nl van Mastodon algemeen en van overige sociale netwerken ?

Decentraal
Mastodonservers zijn decentraal. Dat houdt in dat er vele onafhankelijke servers zijn, die samen het netwerk vormen. Te vergelijken met e-mail, blogs, of wellicht je eigen website. Er is niet Ã©Ã©n organisatie die eigendom heeft over alle e-mail, of alle websites. Op de server van mfbfreaks.nl zul je lokaal vooral veel mfb en audio gerelateerde berichten tegenkomen. Het mooie is echter wel, net als e-mail, alle overige Mastodon servers elkaar wel kunnen vinden en herkennen. Dit in tegenstelling tot bijvoorbeeld internet forums of chatkanalen, die meestal "eilanden" zijn.

Het decentrale principe betekent ook dat Mastodon niet te koop is, en zo niet kan worden uitgeschakeld. Mocht een decentrale server eigenaar zijn gaan server sluiten, kun je eenvoudig je account en gegevens naar een andere server verhuizen.

Jij doet ertoe
Elke Mastodon server beheert hun eigen regels en antispam moderatie. Elk bericht komt het netwerk binnen via een server met meestal een kleine groep lokale gebruikers en een actieve eigenaar die verantwoordelijkheid neemt over hun "huis" en dit graag schoon wil houden. Wanneer er onenigheid is kan dit of worden opgelost door de eigenaar van de server waar het bericht vandaan komt, of als de servers andere regels hebben, kan een van de beheerders ervoor kiezen de verbinding tussen twee servers te sluiten en iedereen verder z'n gangetje laten gaan.

Doordat er geen centrale organisatie is die alles beheert, is er dus ook geen organisatie nodig die genoeg winst moet maken om de kosten te dekken. Bijvoorbeeld van het runnen van zo'n gigantisch netwerk, en de nadelen die daarmee komen. Of een algoritme dat bepaalt van wie je berichten ziet om betere advertenties te tonen, of berichten van volgorde verandert of totaal verbergt zodat je meer tijd op hun site doorbrengt i.p.v. ergens anders heengaat, of die je persoonlijke informatie verkoopt aan derden.

Op Mastodon staan berichten gewoon in chronologische volgorde. Er zijn geen commerciele advertenties. Sommige Mastodon servers met duizenden gebruiken staan wellicht geen nieuwe gebruikers meer toe. Sommige organisaties kunnen natuurlijk wel om donaties vragen.

Description:
Rules

We acknowledge that rules will never be comprehensive or cover every possible situation. Our instance rules are meant to be respected closely in cases that they do cover and to inform how we act in cases where they aren't explicit. Always try to act in the spirit of these rules.

This instance is hosted in Germany. All content posted on 137i.de must abide by German laws and regulations regardless of our own rules.

General

As members of 137i.de we accept these rules and commit to creating an inclusive and respectful environment for ourselves and others.

We do not tolerate oppression of people on the basis of who they are. This includes but is not limited to: gender, race, ethnicity, language, body size and shape, religion or spirituality, nationality, age, disability and sexual orientation.

We define oppression as any language or action that expresses, reinforces, upholds or sympathizes with any form of systemic social domination.

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

  • harassment, both individual and coordinated
  • insults and derogatory language
  • trolling (trying to deliberately provoke someone)
  • threats
  • doxxing (publishing of personal information without consent)
  • TERF and/or SWERF mindset

Bots, Automation and Organizations

Accounts on 137i.de are intended for human beings. Bots are generally not allowed on this instance. Exceptions must be explicitly allowed by the admins of the instance.

Tools that post on behalf on humans, like cross-posters that mirror content from other social media sites, are permitted but should be used with care and only replicate content that their owner has posted themselves (e.g. no retweets). All rules still apply in full to content that is posted through such a tool.

Organizations and institutions should generally not have accounts on 137i.de. Exceptions are possible but rare and need to be decided on by the moderators/admins.

Accessibility

Visual media that is posted to the public timeline should always have a text description that conveys its content accurately to someone who cannot see the image.

We avoid large clusters of non-text characters (e.g. Emoji and "glitchy text"), and refrain from using them in usernames at all unless we have actually tested how they are pronounced by a screen-reader and that it doesn't inhibit reading the timeline.

Nudity, Sex and Sex Work, Kink

Discussion and depiction of sexual, erotic, kinky and sex-work related content is explicitly allowed on 137i.de as long as it's not illegal in Germany.

Anything that falls into these categories should be posted with a content warning (CW) and media marked as sensitive when the post appears on a public timeline.

Other users should only be tagged in these posts if they have consented to it.

Content warnings

In addition to previous mentions of content warnings (CWs), the following types of content should be posted with a CW when they appear on the public timeline:

  • violence (depiction and graphic description)
  • self harm and suicide
  • dieting and eating disorders
  • citing/quoting content that would violate any of our rules, including screenshots of such content
  • visual media with rapid flashing/blinking

Creative Works

When posting works created by others (e.g. photos, artworks, comics, music, video, etc.), include attribution for the original artist/creator. If possible link back to their original post.

This rule does not apply to the citing of popular media, for example a screenshot or GIF from a movie, or things like memes.

Crypto

We don't tolerate promotion of any cryptocurrency, NFTs, de-fi, and related projects.

Violations, Conflict and Appeals

We strive to own our mistakes and to learn from them. When we receive feedback on our behaviour that we disagree with, our first reaction should be to listen. Many conflicts can be resolved by trying to see them from another person's perspective.

When directly engaging with each other isn't possible for any involved parties, the moderators/admins of 137i.de can intervene and will act in accordance with our rules.

Severe or repeated violations of our instance's rules can lead to freezing, limiting and suspending of a user's account.

Moderation decisions can be appealed to either via DM to @ordnung@137i.de, or if that's not possible (e.g. after suspension) via email to ordnung@137i.de. Appealing via the personal accounts of moderators or admins on this instance is unacceptable and will result in suspension.

Legal Attributing

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 International License.

Description:
This instance is for friends, family, and perhaps casual acquaintances of Andy Kish. Code of Conduct - largely lifted from tech.lgbt - this is a lightly moderated personal run instance. If you are very concerned about swift and tight moderation, this may not be the right instance for you.

A server uptime status page is available

Rules:

  1. Discrimination & Bigotry Wonâ€™t Be Tolerated. We're not a free speech absolutist. We're not interested in Nazis, TERFS, or hate speech.
  2. Respect Other Users. This instance is meant to be a friendly, welcoming space to all who are willing to reciprocate in helping to create that environment.
  3. Consent is Important in all contexts. If youâ€™re ever unsure, ask first. Use content warnings (CWs) where required.
  4. Listen; Donâ€™t Make Excuses. If youâ€™re accused of causing harm, either take some responsibility or ask moderators for help.
  5. Use the Report Feature. Our moderators are here to listen and respond to reports.

Wondering what Mastodon is? Check out joinmastodon.org! In essence, Mastodon is a decentralized, open source social network.

Attributions

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Code of Conduct

We're not a free speech absolutist, and there are instances available for that. We're not interested in Nazis, TERFS, or hate speech of any sort, which we will define at our sole discretion as moderators. No homophobia, transphobia, queerphobia, racism allowed.

This instance is meant to be a friendly, welcoming space to all who are willing to reciprocate in helping to create that environment.

Borrowed and modified from the mastodon.social instance information (and tech.lgbt)

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of kish.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Canada
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Description:
Welcome to Managed Service Providers (MSPs)

We are a community of IT professionals - #SysAdmins and MSP owners/employees, sharing about the unique experience of providing support and services to a wide variety of clients.

You have to request to join - but you simply need to submit your request from a work email whose domain points to your MSP website or note that you're a SysAdmin in the request. Join us!

If you find any vulnerabilities or site issues, please report them to the admin at help@msps.io. Moderation requests should be sent via DM to @mspsadmin@msps.io

This instance is hosted in the USA, thus all local laws apply

Community Guidelines

  1. Be nice and considerate, regardless of someone's experience
  2. Mark sensitive content with a content warning
  3. No Spam or Advertisements (Promoting your own work or business is fine within limits)
  4. No Hate Speech!

Moderators reserve the right to remove posts that violate these terms or ban users who repeatedly do so.

Warrant Canary (2022-11-09)

  • MSPs[.]io has never turned over our encryption or authentication keys or our customers' encryption or authentication keys to anyone.
  • MSPs[.]io has never installed any law enforcement software on our systems.
  • MSPs[.]io has never provided any law enforcement organization a feed of our customers' content.
  • MSPs[.]io has never provided logs to any law enforcement organization.
  • MSPs[.]io has never modified customer content at the request of law enforcement or another third party.
  • MSPs[.]io has never weakened, compromised, or subverted any of its encryption at the request of law enforcement or another third party.
Short: A Mastodon instance for MSPs and SysAdmins working in Information technology to share ideas, stories, and innovations.

Description:
Code of Conduct

Our Pledge

In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, we as contributors and maintainers pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment include:

  • Using welcoming and inclusive language
  • Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
  • Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
  • Focusing on what is best for the community
  • Showing empathy towards other community members

Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include:

  • The use of sexualized language or imagery and unwelcome sexual attention or advances
  • Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
  • Public or private harassment
  • Publishing othersâ€™ private information, such as a physical or electronic address, without explicit permission
  • Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting

Our Responsibilities

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable behavior and are expected to take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any instances of unacceptable behavior. Project maintainers have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, or to ban temporarily or permanently any contributor for other behaviors that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.

Scope

This Code of Conduct applies within all project spaces, and it also applies when an individual is representing the project or its community in public spaces. Examples of representing a project or community include using an official project e-mail address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed representative at an online or offline event. Representation of a project may be further defined and clarified by project maintainers.

Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported by contacting the project team at admin@adtech.land. All complaints will be reviewed and investigated and will result in a response that is deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. The project team is obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident. Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately. Project maintainers who do not follow or enforce the Code of Conduct in good faith may face temporary or permanent repercussions as determined by other members of the projectâ€™s leadership.

Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 1.4, available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4/code-of-conduct.html For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq
Short: An experimental mastodon instance mostly focused on adtech, media and privacy.

Description: Bienvenue

Federation Policy

The Mailbag limits federation with instances dedicated to NSFW content. Members can still interact with and follow people from these instances, but such posts will be hidden from the Federated timeline by default. (NSFW posts from general-topic instances may still appear in the Federated timeline.)

The Mailbag suspends federation with instances that host hateful, violent, or illegal content. Members will not see such posts in their timelines, nor be able to follow accounts from suspended instances.

Federation rules are handled manually on a per-instance basis. If you find content from instances that should be limited or suspended, please report the post via the "..." button.

Support Us!

Help keep the lights on by supporting us on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/validpostage

Full Rules

  • No advertising or excessive promotion.
  • No bots, unless they're cute, funny, or useful. Bots should avoid posting to the public timeline.
  • No pornography.
  • No gore or graphic violence.
  • Content that is borderline NSFW or could be construed as NSFW at a glance should be put behind a CW (Content Warning).
  • No racism.
  • No sexism.
  • No discrimination based on gender, sexual minority, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or national origin.
  • No xenophobia, nationalism, casteism, or fascism; no sympathizing with or advocating for these things.
  • No sexual depictions of children.
  • No holocaust denialism, no Nazi symbolism, no promotion of National Socialism.
  • No stalking or harassment. In general, if someone asks you to stop interacting with them, then stop.
  • Stalking, harassment, hate speech, or doxing that is posted to other instances or on other social media platforms is still grounds for having your account terminated here.
  • No posting (or threatening to post) other people's personally identifying information ("doxing").
  • No unwelcome sexual attention.
  • No public or private oppressive language or actions.
  • No promotion of conspiracy theories (eg anti-vax, anti-mask, anti-COVID).
  • No advocating for, or encouraging, any of the above behaviour.
  • No other unethical conduct.
  • No scraping content from web interface or API.

To protect the free speech of users belonging to marginalized groups, validpostage.com does not federate with overtly fascist instances. Additionally, we will refuse to federate with instances that themselves choose to federate with fascist instances.

Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "â€¦" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM Esther.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

Privacy policy

What will we do with your data? Nothing. How will you be influenced by advertisers? You won't. How will we aggregate your data in order to improve your serviceâ€¦ none of that.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests if it comes to that. (Hopefully it won't come to that!) Similarly, users and third parties are forbidden from scraping content from the instance's web interface or API; you are required to respect robots.txt files.

More privacy measures on validpostage.com:

  • HTTPS is used everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
  • No ads or trackers.
  • Links are direct URLs rather than tracking redirects.
  • Understand though that this instance is run by Esther, and (as is the case with all Mastodon servers) she potentially have access to your data, including DMs. The back-end is also not encrypted. If this is not okay with you, this might not be the instance for you.

(For truly private data sent between two people, Mastodon offers no E2E encryption. Use Signal for the things you really want to be private.)
Short: the Mailbag - our little corner of the web

Description:
Non-Server Related Information

For inquiries not related specifically to the operation of this server, such as press inquiries, please contact press@joinmastodon.org.

Funding

This server is privately funded right now. That may change in the future with the addition of Patreon or other donation links.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

Bots

A list of all bots running on this instance can be found here: https://bots.gruezi.net

Federation & Relays

Since we're a smaller server, we do utilize a couple relays to help bring more relevant content into our timeline. If we start getting flooded with spam/etc from them, I'll likely disable them

  • https://relay.infosec.exchange

Description:
General Information

This a boutique instance focused on law, with photography, space, and other user hobbies as secondary content. Approval is required for sign up, but just to prevent an overflow. Write a note, let us know why you're interested in joining.

As far as a general defederation policy, our goal is to save defederation for heinous instances â€“ those servers dominated by spam, hate, conspiracy, etc. Because of the rapid growth of the fediverse, we intend to analyze other issues on a case-by-case basis, primarily relying on the tools available to every user to shape their experience, followed by action against individual users on other servers, and defederating when another instances moderation team proves unwilling or unable to get a handle on their users.

Server Info

  • 5000 character limit.

  • Language translation provided through DeepL.

  • Full word search enabled via ElasticSearch.

  • Server uptime.

The administrator is in law school and probably has a paper due, so your patience is appreciated.

Support

The following referral links will give you free credits and kick back some credits to us on the various services we use:

Updown.io server status.
Short: The finest, boutique law server in the known fediverse.
