Description:
Regeln Â¶

"Be excellent to each other" ist leichter gesagt als getan und bedeutet fÃ¼r jeden etwas anderes.

Bei den folgenden Regeln handelt es sich um eine (nicht erschÃ¶pfende) Liste von Verhaltensweisen, die nach dem Ermessen der Instanzmoderatoren zur LÃ¶schung von Toots, Stummschaltung oder Sperrung von Konten fÃ¼hren kÃ¶nnen, wie in unseren Nutzungsbedingungen geschrieben.

Bitte melde Verhaltensweisen, die dich stÃ¶ren. Wir werden deine Meldung vertraulich behandeln.

  • Wir dulden kein diskriminierendes Verhalten und keine Inhalte, die die UnterdrÃ¼ckung von AngehÃ¶rigen von Randgruppen fÃ¶rdern oder befÃ¼rworten. Diese Gruppen kÃ¶nnen durch eine der folgenden Merkmale gekennzeichnet sein (wobei diese Liste natÃ¼rlich unvollstÃ¤ndig ist):
    • EthnizitÃ¤t
    • GeschlechtsidentitÃ¤t oder -ausdruck
    • sexuelle IdentitÃ¤t oder Ausdruck
    • kÃ¶rperliche Merkmale oder Alter
    • Behinderung oder Krankheit
    • StaatsangehÃ¶rigkeit, Wohnsitz, Aufenthaltsstatus
    • Reichtum oder Bildung
    • ReligionszugehÃ¶rigkeit, Agnostizismus oder Atheismus
  • Wir dulden kein bedrohliches Verhalten, Stalking und Doxxing.
  • Wir dulden keine BelÃ¤stigung, einschlieÃŸlich Brigading, Dogpiling oder jede andere Form der Kontaktaufnahme mit einem Nutzer, der angegeben hat, dass er nicht kontaktiert werden mÃ¶chte.
  • Wir dulden kein Mobbing, einschlieÃŸlich Beschimpfungen, absichtliche Falschbenennung oder Deadnaming.
  • Wir dulden keine gewalttÃ¤tige nationalistische Propaganda, keine Nazi-Symbolik und keine FÃ¶rderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus.
  • Wir dulden keine VerschwÃ¶rungsnarrative oder andere reaktionÃ¤re Mythen, die das oben genannte (und/oder Ã¤hnliche) Verhalten unterstÃ¼tzen oder dazu fÃ¼hren.
  • Handlungen, die darauf abzielen, diese Instanz oder ihre Leistung zu beschÃ¤digen, kÃ¶nnen zur sofortigen Sperrung des Kontos fÃ¼hren.
  • Inhalte, die in Deutschland illegal sind, werden gelÃ¶scht und kÃ¶nnen zur sofortigen Sperrung des Kontos fÃ¼hren.


Best practices Â¶

Die folgende Liste ist eine Sammlung von Verhaltensweisen, die wir von unseren Nutzern erwarten. Wenn du einen Nutzer siehst, der gegen diese bewÃ¤hrten Praktiken verstÃ¶ÃŸt und dich stÃ¶rt, meldee dies bitte und wir werden mit ihm sprechen.

  • Nutze generell die zur VerfÃ¼gung gestellten Mittel, um eine rÃ¼cksichtsvolle und zugÃ¤ngliche AtmosphÃ¤re zu schaffen. Dazu gehÃ¶rt auch die groÃŸzÃ¼gige Verwendung von Inhaltswarnungen (insbesondere bei potenziell beunruhigenden oder kontroversen Themen) und die Verwendung von Untertiteln fÃ¼r Mediendateien.
  • Wenn mÃ¶glich, solltes du in deinen BeitrÃ¤gen auch andere kreative Arbeiten benennen, die nicht deine eigenen sind.
  • Unaufgeforderte Kommentare Ã¼ber die persÃ¶nlichen Entscheidungen, den Lebensstil oder die Familie eines anderen Nutzers werden nicht geduldet und kÃ¶nnen als BelÃ¤stigung angesehen werden. Unangemessene sexuelle Aufmerksamkeit, Kommentare Ã¼ber das Aussehen und die Andeutung von KÃ¶rperkontakt werden gegenÃ¼ber einem nicht einwilligenden Nutzer nicht toleriert.
  • Wenn du sexuelle oder blutige Inhalte verÃ¶ffentlichst, verwende Inhaltswarnungen.
  • Wenn du Werbung verÃ¶ffentlichst, solltest du eine Inhaltswarnung verwenden. Die Werbung sollte nicht Ã¼bertrieben oder automatisiert sein.
  • Bots dÃ¼rfen nur dann mit einem Nutzer interagieren, wenn sie von diesem dazu aufgefordert werden.
  • Automatisierte BeitrÃ¤ge und hochfrequente BeitrÃ¤ge sollten unlisted (fÃ¼r alle sichtbar gemacht werden, aber nicht in der lokalen Timeline erscheinen), damit die lokale Timeline unserer Instanz ein Ort des Gemeinschaftsdialogs und der menschlichen Interaktion bleibt. Dies gilt auch fÃ¼r Bots, Feed-Poster, Twitter-"Retweets" und Twitter-Crossposts mit unterbrochenen ErwÃ¤hnungen. Crossposter-Konten, die sich nicht mehr aktiv an unserer Gemeinschaft beteiligen, kÃ¶nnen nach dem Ermessen der Moderatoren entfernt werden.
  • Bleib in Diskussionen bitte hÃ¶flich und beleidige deine GesprÃ¤chspartner nicht. Beachte, dass Ironie, Sarkasmus oder Ã¤hnliche Formen der Sprache sich nicht gut in die Schriftsprache Ã¼bertragen lassen und dazu neigen, Diskussionen oder MissverstÃ¤ndnisse zu eskalieren.

(Diese Best Practices wurden durch die Bedingungen von chaos.social und bsd.network inspiriert. Wir danken!)

Spenden Â¶

Ich stelle bvb.social werbe- und trackerfrei in meiner Freizeit zur VerfÃ¼gung. DafÃ¼r fallen derzeit folgende Kosten an:

  • einen Server fÃ¼r ca. 21 â‚¬ pro Monat
  • S3-Speicher fÃ¼r Medien fÃ¼r etwa 10 â‚¬ pro Monat
  • die Domain bvb.social fÃ¼r 37,44 â‚¬ pro Jahr

Wir machen dies gerne und erwarten keine Gegenleistung von euch. Wenn ihr uns dennoch etwas zurÃ¼ckgeben mÃ¶chten, kÃ¶nnt ihr dies auf verschiedene Weise tun:

  • via Github
  • ko-fi via PayPal
  • via PayPal


Attribution Â¶

Dieser Text darf unter den Bedingungen der CC-BY (Attribution 4.0 International)-Lizenz frei bearbeitet und neu zusammengestellt werden.

Description:
Welcome!

Sineware is an organization providing free/open source cloud services, hosted on our own hardware and infrastructure! We like to have fun over here ğŸ‰

Our Mastodon service is a general instance open to anyone (as long as you follow the outlined rules). When you sign up for the Sineware Mastodon instance,you can see, follow, and interact with anyone on any other Mastodon instance, and they can do the same with you!

Other Mastodon servers that violate our standards will be silenced/suspended.

We follow the Mastodon Server Covenant

About Mastodon

"The social network of the future: No ads, no corporate surveillance, ethical design, and decentralization! Own your data with Mastodon!"
Short:
Sineware is an organization providing free/open source cloud services, hosted on our own hardware!

Our Mastodon service is a general instance open to anyone. Join the decentralized social network!

Description:
Impressum

Enrico Meinel
Neue Gasse 7
08233 Treuen

kontakt@vogtland.social

Verhaltensregeln

Da "Geht gut miteinander um" einfacher gesagt als getan ist, haben wir eine (nicht vollständige) Liste von Verhaltensweisen aufgestellt, die zu einer Löschung von Trouml;ts(Nachrichten) und zu einer Blockierung von Accounts führen können, wenn die Probleme fortbestehen. Insbesondere tolerieren wir nicht:

  • Belästigung, Stalking, Doxxing
  • Rassismus, Sexismus, Beschimpfungen oder deren Befürwortung
  • Diskriminierung von Geschlechtern und sexuellen Minderheiten oder deren Befürwortung
  • Nationalistische Propaganda, Nazi-Symbolismus oder Förderung der Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus
  • Leute kontaktieren, die klar gemacht haben, dass sie keinen Kontakt wollen. Dogpiling
  • Nicht markierter sexueller Inhalt und/oder Gewaltdarstellungen
  • Werbung, die nicht als Werbung getaggt, automatisiert, oder auch übermäßige erfolgt.
  • Bots, die ohne ihre expliziten Anfragen, ob es gewünscht ist, mit Nutzern interagieren
  • Bots, die nicht als Bot (in den Einstellungen) markiert sind.

Bitte melden Sie Verhalten, das Sie stört. Das schließt Verhalten von anderen Instanzen mit ein - wir sind sehr gerne bereit, mit Instanzen die Verbindung zu unterbrechen, die sich negativ verhalten. Basierend auf dem "About" von chaos.social verfügbar in deren Github-Repository.automatisch.

Backup

Da dieser Server privat betrieben wird, kann aktuell kein Baackup erstellt. Sobald wir ein Backup haben, erfahrt Ihr hier mehr darÃ¼ber.

Vorhaltezeit von Medien

Da der Server derzeit privat finanziert wird, werden alle Mediendateien wie Bilder, Audiodateien, Videodateien usw. 90 Tage vorgehalten und dann, sofern nicht mehr benötigt, gelöscht.

Short: Mastodon is a decentralised social network. This is my instance of it and will be largely full of ADHD-ridden Toots.

Description: This is a server for people who live in or have passed through Waterford city at some point in their lives. It's waterford.international because a lot of people living in Waterford come from somewhere else, and a lot of people born in Waterford have moved away. Some are regular visitors, others blow in and out on the trade winds and others still look in from afar. International is also a mindset: an outward looking and curious attitude to the world that transcends geography and location. This is a server that celebrates those diverse interests and experiences through the peculiar spatiotemperal funnel of contemporary Waterford.
Short: A Mastodon instance emanating from Waterford city in Ireland. Mastodon is a decentralised, federated microblogging social network.

Description:
This server is operated by @odo@dustbuster.club as a place for Friends of Desoto to have a Mastodon home. It is moderated by me too. My moderation is simple. Don't send spam or you'll get a ban. I run it on a server in my basement so expect the occasional unplanned outage when our power goes out.

INTRODUCE YOURSELF

  • You can call me:
  • I'm from:

Description:
Who are we?

Messy Desk is a fediverse instance for queer and queer-friendly hackers, makers, and artists, spawned from the mastodon.technology diaspora. New members must be invited by an existing member.

We do not federate with any fascist, racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, xenophobic, or casteist instances, or instances tolerant of these views. Please notify an admin or moderator if you see anything of this sort.

Privacy

Do not use this instance for sensitive communications. The current admins and moderators don't care about your private messages and won't read them unless required for moderation. But Mastodon DMs are not encrypted! They exist merely for convenience. Use an encrypted IM provider like Signal for privacy.

You do not have permission to scrape or bulk-download content from this site for any purpose.

Code of conduct

We are committed to providing a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment. Treat others with respect, and do not engage in harassment, stalking, trolling, or other antisocial behavior.

Rules

The admins and moderators will usually give warnings for first offenses, but we reserve the right to banish anyone at any time for any reason. Among those reasons are: violation of the code of conduct or policy described above, sexism, discrimination based on physical appearance or beliefs, hate speech, pedaling conspiracy theories, or anything similar.

Graphic violence or sexuality involving minors is forbidden. Other "NSFW" material should be placed behind a CW (content warning). This is a site for and by adults, but consider that not all content is appropriate for browsing while waiting in a supermarket checkout line, and throw a CW on anything in doubt.

These rules are subject to change.

The admins and moderators are not interested in debating the rules after an infraction. We are providing this service in good faith and expect you to behave in the same spirit.

Coffee

The red panda coffee mug can be purchased online here: https://society6.com/ryannotbrian
Short: Messy Desk is a small fediverse instance for queer and queer-friendly hackers, makers, and artists, spawned from the mastodon.technology diaspora. New members must be invited by an existing member.

Description:
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of mastodon.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

English version below

nixos.paris est un serveur Mastodon communautaire dÃ©diÃ© Ã  la communautÃ© francophone et parisienne de NixOS, un systÃ¨me d'exploitation Linux open-source. Ce serveur Mastodon offre un espace sÃ»r et respectueux oÃ¹ les utilisateurs peuvent discuter de NixOS, partager des astuces et des conseils, et dÃ©couvrir des projets intÃ©ressants liÃ©s Ã  NixOS.

Les membres de la communautÃ© peuvent Ã©galement partager leurs projets personnels et crÃ©atifs, poser des questions, et Ã©changer sur des sujets connexes tels que la programmation, la sÃ©curitÃ© informatique, et la virtualisation. nixos.paris est un lieu de rencontre pour les passionnÃ©s de NixOS qui souhaitent se connecter avec d'autres personnes partageant les mÃªmes intÃ©rÃªts et en apprendre davantage sur cette distribution Linux unique.

Ce serveur accepte bien entendu toute autre discussion n'Ã©tant pas strictement reliÃ© Ã  l'informatique.

Les rÃ¨gles du serveur Mastodon sont strictement appliquÃ©es pour garantir un environnement sÃ»r et respectueux pour tous les membres de la communautÃ©. Les administrateurs du serveur sont Ã©galement disponibles pour aider les membres de la communautÃ© et rÃ©pondre Ã  leurs questions ou prÃ©occupations.

English version

nixos.paris is a Mastodon community server dedicated to the French-speaking and Parisian community of NixOS, an open-source Linux operating system. This Mastodon server offers a safe and respectful space where users can discuss NixOS, share tips and advice, and discover interesting NixOS-related projects.

Community members can also share their personal and creative projects, ask questions, and exchange on related topics such as programming, computer security, and virtualization. nixos.paris is a meeting place for NixOS enthusiasts who want to connect with other like-minded people and learn more about this unique Linux distribution.

Certainly, this server also accepts any other discussion that is not strictly related to computer science, i.e. "offtopic".

The Mastodon server's code of conduct is strictly enforced to ensure a safe and respectful environment for all community members. The server administrators are also available to assist community members and address their questions or concerns.
Short: nixos.paris is a FR Mastodon community server for NixOS enthusiasts who want to discuss this open-source Linux operating system, share tips and advice, and connect with other like-minded individuals.

Description:
Code of Conduct

This document lays out the ground rules for participating in this community. It is intended to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible.

Goals

  • Provide a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone
  • Create a supportive community, where people freely share their passions and are excited and positive about each other's successes.
  • Provide a venue for casual conversations

Public Toots

Public Toots are those that are posted to the public timelines. This means that anyone on this server can see your Toot on the local timeline and anyone on the Internet can see your Toot via the see what's happening page. This also means that your Toot will be visible to any instances that this server federates with, via the federated timeline.

Non-Public Toots

A non-public Toot are Toots that are not posted to the public timelines. These include Toots that are posted with the following privacy settings:

  • Unlisted â€“ Not posted to public timelines, but viewable if someone visits your profile.
  • Follower-only â€“ Only viewable by a user who follows you.
  • Direct â€“ Only viewable to users who are @ mentioned in a Toot.

Users who follow you have consciously opted in to what you have to say. By using Follower-only you are talking direct to those people, and not the wider fediverse. People who follow you are more likely to understand the context and tone of what you're trying to say.

Rules for All Toots

All toots (public and private) should abide by the following rules:

  • Do not use slurs or racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, ableist or otherwise discriminatory or hateful jokes or language or promote white supremacy, anti-Semitism, transphobia or other hateful ideologies.
  • Do not harass anyone, participate in group harassment of anyone, or otherwise engage in personal attacks. Posting or threatening to post other peopleâ€™s personally identifying information (â€œdoxingâ€) constitutes harassment.
  • Do not post adult content, including pictures containing nudity, or unwelcome sexual attention (including sexualized comments or jokes).
  • Do not post spam. A toot that is nothing other than a link constitutes spam, as does any overly commercial self-promotion. (It is fine, however, to toot about your own projects and share what you are excited to be working on â€” just keep the toot itself interesting).
  • Do not use automated tools to toot without participating in the community. It is fine to post with an automated tool (e.g., a Twitter cross-poster) so long as you are an active member of the community and respond to replies you receive here. However, unmonitored accounts that post automatically are not acceptable.

Reporting Violations

If you notice a toot that violates this code of conduct, please report it. It is easy to assume that someone else has already reported a toot, but it is easy for everyone to feel that way and no one to report the toot.

Donations

This Mastodon instance is currently run as a free service but it does costs money. If you'd like to donate towards the running costs you can contribute by:

  • Square
  • PayPal

Welcome!

This Mastodon instance is hosted and operated by 23M GmbH.

We've created this instance as a place for anyone that enjoys working with servers, IT in general, or networks. Nonetheless anyone is welcome to create an account here as long as you follow our rules and work towards creating a welcoming environment.

Obviously, the posts here don't have to be server or IT focused all the time and it's totally okay to fill your own timeline with cat content. But we expect all users in our instance to be respectful and inclusive towards each other.

Backups should not be missed, of course. Therefore, a backup of the system is made every hour. For the media files we use our own S3 storage.

There is no need to contribute anything to keep this instance running, since we are hosting it on our own servers. However, if you like this page speed, maybe check out our hosting solutions over at 23M.com

Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

Welcome, neighbor. Glad you could join us today! (Yes, that's a Mister Rogers quote!)

Guidelines

This site is about providing a safe, supportive peer community, where people can express themselves; find their unique voice and share their story at their own pace; find and offer empathy, love, acceptance, and support; and advocate and organize to fight oppression, exploitation, victimization, and abuse, in its various forms.

Quite a few of the subjects we need to talk about will probably be pretty heavy. Taking a deep breath and facing these head-on may be the most effective way to deal with them, but we will likely also need to pace ourselves. Posting lighter content, such as cute pictures of animals and babies, is certainly welcome as well. ğŸ˜€

As much as possible, I ("Uyakon") would like to encourage thoughtful conversations that are both intellectually and emotionally intelligent. I realize, though, that when dealing with heavy-duty emotions, thinking rationally may sometimes be out of reach. And that's OK.

Active listening will be an important skill here. Try to listen to understand, not just to respond.

In general, try to stick to the main purpose of this site. This is not a dating app, for example. Nor are we here to sell things. There may be exceptions occasionally, but these are the general guidelines.

We are not professionals. If someone needs professional mental health treatment, for instance, please refer them to a suitable mental health professional.

Rules

Don't be evil.

Hate speech is not allowed. The definition of "hate speech" that I propose is: any form of communication expressing or promoting hostility toward any individual or group that does not deserve it.

Certainly, recognizing the patterns and trends that exist within a particular group can be valuable and helpful. Anger at an institution for institutionalized problems is also perfectly valid. When dealing with individuals, though, I think it's important to treat each person according to his/her/their own character and inherent worth as a human being. Just because a particular moral fault is generally characteristic of a group of individuals, does not necessarily mean that every individual within that group has the same shortcoming.

For instance, I've heard some say that "there is no such thing as a good cop." I don't believe that's true. Yes, the law enforcement system in America is broken. Yes, there are many bad cops out there, doing bad things -- perhaps more now than there have been in a long time. But there are also good cops, who join the ranks out of a desire to do good -- for example, to work with social workers to help children caught in abusive family situations. (I am open to correction on this, though, if you have enough evidence to prove me wrong.)

Nazis, on the other hand, are evil as a movement. They are a hate group at the very core of their identity. (See definition of "hate speech," above.) There is more than enough information available out there at this point in history, that anyone joining a Nazi or neo-Nazi group should know these things.

This site is not the place for explicitly violent content, nor for sexually explicit content. Certainly no illegal or child pornography. No harassment, flame wars, trolling, or the like. Always act in good faith.

Respect others' boundaries, and be careful about posting things that might traumatize someone else. If someone indicates that what you are saying, or how much detail you are going into, is problematic for them or makes them uncomfortable, be less specific or stop talking about that subject with them, as appropriate. If you still need to talk more about it, a qualified mental health professional may be your best option.

Don't be afraid to state hard truths here, within the above guidelines. A personal example: Fundamentalist Christianity really damaged me ("Uyakon") while I was a part of it. And I have a whole long list of specific reasons why. It's OK to talk about those sorts of things here. Often, we need to be able to talk about these things, in order to heal and move forward. However, that doesn't mean that it's OK to beat people over the head with stuff just to hurt them.

Making deliberate false accusations is not OK. That is not at all the same thing as justified criticism, though!

Don't use this site to distribute spam; to impersonate any other user; to share or distribute pirated music, movies, etc. Do not attempt to hack, probe, or Denial-of-Service-attack this site. Etc.

Finally:

Take courage. You are not alone. There are lots of other people like you out there. Good people. Kind people. As well as people who are well-intentioned, but who may need to be educated further on how to relate to certain others. If they are willing to listen, perhaps you can help educate them. ğŸ’ª
Short: Mastodon is an ethically-designed, open-source microblogging platform consisting of a network of independent servers that talk to each other (part of the "fediverse"). It can be thought of as an alternative to Twitter, for example. This particular server focuses on two things: First, fighting oppression, exploitation, abuse and victimization, whether of humans, plants, animals, or the planet itself. Second, helping people heal from any of the above that they have experienced or witnessed.

Description:
This is a small instance for me and a bunch of peers. I'm going to treat this like my personal mail server which i am running for a couple of years now and intend to do so for as long as i am using mail. Nonetheless i can not guarantee uptime or data consistency. If you still want to join, you'll need an invite from a user of this instance.

The rules for this instance are based on the rules from https://chaos.social/about/more/ (with friendly permission) (exception: Content warnings (CW) for political content are not required.):

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people. This is a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the discretion of the instance administrators. In particular, we do not tolerate:

  • Harrassment, stalking, doxxing
  • Racism, sexism, verbal abuse or advocation thereof
  • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
  • Violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  • Contacting people who made clear they want no contact. Dogpiling/brigading
  • Untagged sexual content, gore, or advertisement
  • Untagged, or automated, or excessive advertisement
  • Bots interacting with users without their explicit requests
  • Spamming: If you or your bot need to post with a high frequency, please restrict your posts to your followers to keep the local timeline readable.
  • We are not a "free speech zone.", a term established by right-wing groups to defend their publishing of racist, sexist, abusive, or otherwise inacceptable content.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. That includes behaviour from other instances - we have no problem with stopping to federate with asshole instances, or suspend contact with single accounts.

I will also block the same instances chaos.social is blocking. See the list of blocked instances

Description:
Welcome to our community of Thinking in Systems enthusiasts and practitioners.

We are dedicated to fostering a vibrant community of individuals passionate about Systems Thinking AND Systems Practice

Our platform serves as a hub for micro learnings, offering valuable insights into systems thinking, its practical applications, and the transformative power it holds.

Our content is curated from a collection of both published and unpublished original ideas by our curator. These works draw from extensive research, practical experiences, and deep understanding of systems thinking principles. We highly value the intellectual property rights associated with these works.

We strongly encourage the sharing of knowledge and the exchange of ideas within our community. Collaboration is at the heart of our mission, as we believe in the power of collective learning and growth. However, it is essential to respect and protect intellectual property rights while engaging in this process.

We ask all community members to observe the following guidelines in our Server Rules.

By fostering a culture of collaboration, mutual respect and knowledge sharing, we strive to create an inclusive and supportive community that thrives on the principles of systems thinking. We believe that through micro learnings, we can collectively deepen our understanding and refine our practices, leading to positive and sustainable change.

We would like to acknowledge the wisdom and insights of Donella Meadows, a renowned scientist, educator and pioneer in the field of systems thinking. Her statement,

"We live in a world of systems."

encapsulates the fundamental understanding that the intricacies of our world and the problems we face are deeply interconnected and interdependent.

We hope to make productive use of this quality in our community so thank you for being part of our community.
Short: A community dedicated to making sense of systems thinking through practice, potentially developing new systems concepts as a response to everyday situations in both in private and professional lives

Description:
Welcome to KitchWin! An instance for those who love to make and/or eat food!

Your friendly neighbourhood admin is @gusyoft



ghborhood admin is @mdszy

We run glitch-soc with a character limit of 5000 to make it easier to post full recipes and such!
Instance-specific rules
Content Warning Policy

    CW'ing of food is not required! Any post made on the instance without a CW will have the CW "auto cw: could contain food" when it federates. However, the post will appear non-CW'd on this instance itself. This allows us to not have to CW and click through every post, while still protecting folks on other instances who wish to have food content behind a CW.

    However, cursed food (i.e. food posts that are meant as humor and would probably be considered gross) must be CW'd.
    CW'ing of meat or non-vegan content is recommended.
    Cocktails/homebrewing are incredibly valid forms of cooking too! However, please CW alcohol-related content appropriately.

Other Instance-specific policies.

    The best way to cook, bake, eat or otherwise enjoy something is the way that specific person enjoys it. That is, gatekeeping will not be tolerated.
    This instance is for folks who cook/bake/etc. of all skill levels! Do not disparage beginners. Be respectful and helpful.
    Do not use any method of crossposting from Twitter or other social networks to Too Many Cooks.
    Signups are approval-only. This is to prevent spam. If applicable, please mention any other fedi account you might consider your "main" to make approvals easier.

All around rules

    No advertising or excessive promotion.
    No bots without prior approval.
    No pornography.
    No gore or graphic violence.
    Food preparation involving raw meat could be considered an exception to this. Always CW content of this kind.
    Content that is NSFW or borderline NSFW must be put behind a CW.
    No racism, sexism, ableism, transphobia, nationalism, fascism, or sympathizing with or advocating for any of these things or related things.
    No Nazis or related symbolism.
    Respect boundaries. If someone asks you to stop interacting with them, stop. If someone blocks or mutes you, do not attempt to evade that action in any way.
    No stalking, harassment, dogpiling or any other action that is meant to intimidate anyone.
    Any other unethical content is disallowed and will be left to the discretion of the admin(s).
    Just don't be a dingus.
    Do not scrape any content from the web interface or API.

Reporting

It is best to err on the side of reporting content you think may be breaking rules. Reports will be kept anonymous. Do not, however, make bad-faith reports or spam reports on clearly non-rule-breaking posts. Feel free to report content that isn't on the instance itself, but that appears on the Federated timeline and would be considered breaking our rules.
Federation policies

We do not federate with overtly fascist instances or instances that associate with them. Feel free to let the admins know if you have a problem with this policy so they can defederate with you, too.
Privacy Reminders

    This instance uses HTTPs everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
    New users of the site are opted out of search engine indexing by default. Note that this relies on the search engine itself respecting this setting, so it's not foolproof.
    No ads, trackers or analytics of any kind are used on Too Many Cooks.
    Understand that this instance admins have access to all data submitted to, and all data that federates with this site. Data is not encrypted, this includes followers-only and DM posts.

Media Storage

This isn't so much a rules section as it is thanking Jortage for providing the media storage for the instance!

This instance's media is powered by Jortage Storage Pool Î“Ã‡Ã¶ lightning-fast pay-what-you-can media storage for Fediverse instances
Moderated servers

Mastodon generally allows you to view content from and interact with users from any other server in the fediverse. These are the exceptions that have been made on this particular server.
Filtered media

Description:
Criteria for Joining duck.haus

This instance started out as a curiosity among friends. But we're committed to sticking around for a while, so we've decided to (slowly) open it up to new members.

Since we're running the show, and we're responsible for what happens on this server, we're starting out with a fairly restrictive set of criteria for joining duck.haus. Will we revise or relax these rules in the future to allow more folks to sign up? Maybe, but it's not currently on our roadmap. Also we don't have a roadmap because we're just a bunch of goofs with server.

Let's get into it. The criteria for joining duck.haus are as follows:

  1. New members need to be sponsored by one of the five (5) founding members of duck.haus. The five founding members are @toasty@duck.haus, @ry@duck.haus, @dan@duck.haus, @powerllama@duck.haus, and @joesteel@duck.haus.

  2. For now, to be sponsored, we need to know you in real life. That means we know you in some way outside of Twitter, Slack, or other social networks. This helps us moderate our content and keep things within the lines with our very limited capacity as admins.

  3. The founding duck.hausers can only sponsor one applicant per month.

  4. A sponsored applicant must receive a three-fifths approval vote in order to be admitted.

  5. New members will be required to pay a portion of the server costs. The current cost per user for 2023 is $30. Billing is annual and non-refundable. New members will pay their sponsor who will, in turn, submit payment to the server admin.

  6. If the addition of a new member causes an increase in the overall server cost (i.e. pushes us to a higher tier on masto.host), all five founding members must approve the increase in cost in addition to the three-fifths approval of the applicant. Additional pro-rated costs for existing members will be due at the time of server cost increase.

  7. In the event that a member's conduct violates our Code of Conduct, a three-fifths vote will approve a 21 day suspension of the user's account.

  8. After two suspensions, if we find grounds for a third, a user may face permanent deletion from the server. All five founding members must approve permanent deletion.

And that's it. For now.

If you think you fit this criteria and are willing to play by our rules, contact a founding member by DM and ask to be sponsored.

Server rules

Below is a summary of rules you need to follow if you want to have an account on this server of Mastodon:

Code of Conduct

Note: "Duck Haus" in this document refers to the Duck Haus Mastodon instance at https://duck.haus. "The administrators" refers to the administrators on this organization: currently @toasty@duck.haus, @ry@duck.haus, @dan@duck.haus

Duck Haus is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

This code of conduct applies to all Duck Haus spaces, including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the administrators.

Types of Harassment

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, immigration status, religion, or other identity marker. This includes anti-Indigenous/Nativeness and anti-Blackness.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person's lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of "dead" or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they're not appropriate
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or "backrub") without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Stalking or following
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person's identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication
  • Jokes that resemble the above, such as "hipster racism", still count as harassment even if meant satirically or ironically.
  • Microaggressions, which take the form of everyday jokes, put downs, and insults that spread humiliating feelings to people of marginalized groups

The administrators will not act on complaints regarding: *"Reverse"-isms, including "reverse racism," "reverse sexism," and "cisphobia" *Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as "leave me alone," "go away," or "I'm not discussing this with you." *Communicating in a "tone" you don't find congenial *Criticism of racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a member of Duck Haus, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact an administrator (listed at the top of this document) directly or file a report using the Mastodon reporting system (click the "..." on a post and then use the reporting feature).

The administrators reserve the right to exclude people from Duck Haus based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Duck Haus spaces and behavior towards people who are not in Duck Haus. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Duck Haus spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Duck Haus members or the general public.

Updates

The administrators reserve the right to update the Code of Conduct at any time at their discretion. Updates to the CoC will be communicated to users via email and posts from admin accounts. If you have any concerns about or suggestions for the CoC, please contact an administrator via DM.

License

This was adapted from the Friend Camp Code of Conduct which was adapted from the LGBTQ in Tech Code of Conduct and as such is licensed using a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.
Additional info

About

mellow.zone is a general chill and laid-back instance for people to hangout outside of corporate social media.

Rules

  • No bigots. This includes but is not limited to Nazis, TERFs, racists, antisemites, Islamophobes, any form of genocide deniers, and ethnonationalists.
  • Be nice. We are all here to have a good time.
  • Keep things legal. Please don't make me deal with that.
  • Use content warnings. Please make sure to use content warnings when necessary.
  • Caption your media. If you attach an image or video to your post, please make sure to include a description of your image.

Licenses

Description:
Welcome to Cuddly Space!

Hey there! So glad you've stumbled upon us. Let's make your stay here awesome. Go ahead, sign up, create your little corner of this digital world, and hey, bring your friends and family along!

Just a little heads up before you dive inâ€”around these parts, we're all about the good vibes. So, we've got a little list of things we do not allow here, to keep the place sunny:

  1. Any form of hate speech
  2. Discrimination or purposeful insults
  3. Spreading false information
  4. Anything that intentionally upsets others
  5. Posting sensitive stuff without appropriate content
  6. Filling our feeds with spam
  7. Anything that's illegal under the laws governing this platform, or where you live
  8. Revealing other people's personal information (you shouldn't disclose your own, either)

If anyone forgets these friendly reminders, we might have to nudge you back on track with a warning, a bit of silence, or a timeout, or kick you out for any particularly bad behavior. But as long as you're here for kindness and good times, you're golden!

We're here to be good to each other, share some laughs, and build a community that's as warm and welcoming as a group hug.

General

A community of beer drinkers, brewers, and sharers. This Mastodon instance is setup for the beer community. While we do allow discussion of other topics, we try to remain focused on beer.

We have simple rules, do your best to follow them, don't abuse this service its ran free as in beer.

This is the internet, don't share personal information with anyone you don't know. Please report any users or posts and we'll do our best to handle them quickly.

If you have suggestions, or any issues feel free to reach out to any of the admins.

Security

This site is protected by cloudflare, and backed further by magic transit. Disks are encrypted, and no commercial CDN is used.  Every effort is made to ensure that this site is stable and secure.

Privacy

We do not collect any information other than what is required to sign up. We do not sell, barter, give, or otherwise use your data in a way i wouldn't want my own data to be used. 

Last Requirement

Drink good beer, don't be afraid to try everything, and don't forget to share.
Short: Community of beer lovers, brewers, breweries. Be responsible, drink good beer, and try everything.

Description:
Server Setup

  • k3s 1.26.1

    • 6 SoQuartz Blades
    • 6 Rock64s

  • postgres nodes (independant)

    • 2 Rock64s each with SSD storage

  • Garage nodes

    • 2 RockPro64s each with 1x3TB spinning disk
    • The 6 SoQuartz Blades each with 500GB NVMe

  • router

    • 1 RockPro64

  • backup

    • 1 RockPro64 with 3x8TB spinning disks

Rules and Such

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of asonix.dog; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    3. Untagged pornography and sexually explicit content
    4. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence
    5. posts being mean to hyenas

  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism

  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

OOUR (Osnovna Organizacija UdruÅ¾enog Rada / Basic Organization of Associated Labor) was, as the name suggest, a legal concept from the early '70s that defined the smallest unit of economic endeavor in Socialist Federative Republic of Yugoslavia. Multiple OOURs would form associations that formed bigger companies, sometimes counting hundreds or even thousands of these "basic units" that represented different departments or other organizational points. All of it was truly publicly owned, but the workers comprising OOURs shared the profits and self-governed. This mandate required re-investing into the community, and in the end allowed for a real-world worker-controlled socialist utopia to materialize in Yugoslavia and usher an era of unprecedented prosperity--for a while, until the country's political collapse and war in the early '90s due to an onset of economic troubles that were exploited by jingoists. In any case: better futures are possible.

Description: DogHub.eu: ... a friendly place for active dog owners

Code of Conduct

Note: Note: "Frog Camp" in this document refers to the Frog Camp Mastodon instance at https://frog.camp. "The administrators" refers to the administrators on this organization: currently @kelseyfrog@frog.camp.

Frog Camp is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

This code of conduct applies to all Frog Camp spaces, including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the administrators.

Types of Harassment

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, immigration status, religion, or other identity marker. This includes anti-Indigenous/Nativeness and anti-Blackness.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person's lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of "dead" or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they're not appropriate
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or "backrub") without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Stalking or following
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person's identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication
  • Jokes that resemble the above, such as "hipster racism", still count as harassment even if meant satirically or ironically.
  • Microaggressions, which take the form of everyday jokes, put downs, and insults that spread humiliating feelings to people of marginalized groups

The administrators will not act on complaints regarding:

  • "Reverse"-isms, including "reverse racism," "reverse sexism," and "cisphobia"
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as "leave me alone," "go away," or "I'm not discussing this with you."
  • Communicating in a "tone" you don't find congenial
  • Criticism of racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a member of Frog Camp, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact an administrator (listed at the top of this document) directly or file a report using the Mastodon reporting system (click the "..." on a post and then use the reporting feature).

The admins reserve the right to exclude people from Frog Camp based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Frog Camp spaces and behavior towards people who are not in Frog Camp. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Frog Camp spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Frog Camp members or the general public.

Updates

The administrators reserve the right to update the Code of Conduct at any time at their discretion. Updates to the CoC will be communicated to users via email and posts from admin accounts. If you have any concerns about or suggestions for the CoC, please contact an administrator via DM.

License

This was adapted from the LGBTQ in Tech Code of Conduct and as such is licensed using a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.

Privacy Policy

The data you post here lives on a server that Darius Kazemi runs. He promises that he won't look at your private data. You are just going to have to trust him on this.

This is, however, an ActivityPub federated server. This means that other people on other federated servers can find you, send you messages, etc. This also means that any information you put in posts, whether they are public or private, might end up "federated" -- basically, a copy of your post gets put on any server that reads your post.

If you want decent privacy (the info doesn't leave this server), the only way to do that is to set your account to private, only accept friend requests from other frog.camp users, and only ever @ mention other frog.camp users. Once you start talking to people on other servers, all bets are off. Any private message you send to someone on another server could be looked at by the admin of a different server. This is kind of like email: if you are on a private email server, and you send an unencrypted email to a gmail account, congrats, Google now has the content of that email. But also, you do this every day, so, hey. The internet!

License

This privacy policy was written by Darius Kazemi, modified for frog.camp by Kelsey Santos and provided under a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain.

Description: "It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen." Thus begins, George Orwell's "1984". The expression of the clocks striking thirteen, pre-dates Orwell as an adage meaning, to ignore, reject, or discount everything that's come before, a pretty accurate representation of current events. So pull up a seat, fellow traveler. There are stories to be told.
Short: It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen. Welcome to 13 Bells, a respite from the commercial social media platforms.

Description:
the derg.nz / dragonhive mastodon social server for interacting with the fediverse!

Currently not taking random registrations, although if you're a friend or you have a dire need for a place to be, you can try to poke me on here (@anthropy) or on Matrix (@anthropy:m.derg.nz), or on telegram (@xarinatan).

The aim of this server is to provide long-term stability over features, and is intended to run as long as I (@anthropy) can help it.
Short: A server for myself (@Anthropy) and friends, running on the DragonHive infrastructure (dragonhive.net). Expect Geeky and Furry types of content, but most other types of subjects are also welcome!

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

While this is a private server intended for a closed group of friends, it's important to establish some ground rules for how we interact with the Fediverse at large. This is adapted from the code of conduct of https://icosahedron.website, partially because that's an instance that the server admin (@QuietMisdreavus) has previously used, and also because it's easy to read and interpret.

Be friendly.

  • The internet is a network that connects people using computers. The other endpoint is a human being with an inner life just as complex as your own. Act accordingly.
  • Consider the reach of the posts you make. Tag content that you expect others might not want to see.
  • Harassment and bullying of any kind are not tolerated here. Do not engage with a user if they do not want you to. Do not ask other users to, either.

Donâ€™t start shit.

  • Do not make posts just to get angry reactions.
  • â€œI was being ironicâ€ is an extremely flimsy excuse for behaving badly.
  • Do not drag unrelated people into a discussion.

Obey the law.

  • Specifically, United States (server+admin location) law.
  • No illegal file sharing, no illegal pornography, no publication of personal protected information, you know the drill.
  • While things like holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism aren't directly against US law, they're also not allowed on this server.

Spam is not allowed.

  • Bots that interact with a user without a users explicit request are not allowed.
  • Automated or excessive advertising is not allowed.

Be aware of the nature of the network.

  • This website is part of a network of similar websites. Other websites may have different rules.
  • The local administration has little control over users of other websites. You can, however, block and mute them - same as local users.
  • In egregious cases, remote users or entire groups of users may be blocked from interacting with users of this website.

Fascism is incompatible with a free exchange of ideas.

  • When you endorse racism, exclusion and the structural and physical violence that come with it, you show yourself to not be interested in any sort of dialogue.
  • Those who work towards a society based on chauvinism and nationalism rather than peaceful coexistance are not welcome here.

Admin decisions are final.

  • The interpretation of these rules is up to the administration and an admins decision overrides the rules.
  • â€œTechnically I did not violate any ruleâ€ is an extremely flimsy excuse for behaving badly.
  • The rules may be changed or amended when necessary.

These goal of these rules is to ensure a safe and welcoming environment.

  • Rule enforcement is guided by this goal.
  • Any enforcement action will generally be kept between those involved.
  • Try to self-moderate, but do not hesitate to involve an admin when necessary.
  • There is presently one person with administrative access to the website, @QuietMisdreavus.
  • You can report rule violations via the report function, or via e-mail.

Recommended CWs

To keep the timeline smooth for everyone, here are some recommended CWs to use. This is not an exclusive list; it's just a quick reference to give the idea of what kinds of content should be folded up:

  • Politics (country/state/local; this also includes certain kinds of activism)
  • Animated GIFs
  • Food
  • References to abuse
  • References to racism/sexism/homophobia/transphobia/etc
  • Nudity/Sexually suggestive content

Admin notes

Server notices will be posted on @mayor@squad.town's account. This will announce things like downtimes for upgrades, backups, etc. Ideally, i'd like to install updates to the server system regularly, but regardless, i'll post there when i need to take the server down or if i have things to say to the server at large.

Description:
This is a private instance.

Emoji credits

Some emoji from Mutant Standard (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0)

Some emoji by Pollomostro - Link collection (CC BY-SA 4.0)

Fox emoji by ren/ziphi

Code of Conduct

This is not a legal document. As of writing, this community is very small and is entirely run by one person. I could copy a well-thought-out code of conduct from somewhere elseâ€”or worse, I could try and come up with one on my ownâ€”but I don't think we'd benefit from either. If we find we could use an actual code of conduct, its writing should be collaborative: it should be owned by our community.

In the meantime, here is where I stand:

  1. I'll start by saying (as many mastodon instances do) that I'm committed to combating racism, sexism, homophobia, and transphobia.
  2. I believe it's impossible to make literally every human feel welcome and included; welcoming one person can always risk excluding another. So I see no hypocrisy in excluding you for intolerant behavior. There are mastodon instances that celebrate intolerant behavior, and you can join one of them.
  3. If you make someone feel hurt, unsafe, or unwelcome, then I expect you to do whatever it takes to make it right.

Staff

@matt@istheguy.com
Short: A social network for you (if you are the guy)

Description:
Server rules

This server is for ethical advocates of the Arts and Artistic Culture. We invite creators, fans and advocates of Music, Film, Writing, Creative Media, Physical Artistic Creations.

Below is a summary of rules you need to follow if you want to have an account on this server of Mastodon:

  • Be nice to each other

  • Do not publish advertisements Do not publish conspiracy myths Do not publish content illegal in Europe, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism Do not publish content promoting the ideology of National Socialism Do not advocate authoritarianism or tyrant in any way shape or form

    Do not publish content that is hateful towards specific individuals or groups, or intended to cause or incite harm

Endeavor to be the best version of yourself

Description:
Code of Conduct

All participants of Press.Community are expected to abide by our Code of Conduct, both online and during in-person events that are hosted and/or associated with Press.Community.

The Pledge

In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, we pledge to make participation in our project and our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity and expression, level of experience, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

The Standards

Examples of behaviour that contributes to creating a positive environment include:

  • Using welcoming and inclusive language
  • Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
  • Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
  • Referring to people by their preferred pronouns and using gender-neutral pronouns when uncertain

Examples of unacceptable behaviour by participants include:

  • Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, public or private harassment
  • Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or electronic address, without explicit permission
  • Not being respectful to reasonable communication boundaries, such as 'leave me alone,' 'go away,' or 'Iâ€™m not discussing this with you.'
  • The usage of sexualised language or imagery and unwelcome sexual attention or advances
  • Assuming or promoting any kind of inequality including but not limited to: age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity and expression, nationality and race, personal appearance, religion, or sexual identity and orientation
  • Attacking personal tastes
  • Other conduct which you know could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting.

Enforcement

Violations of the Code of Conduct may be reported by sending an email to abuse@press.community. All reports will be reviewed and investigated and will result in a response that is deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately.

We hold the right and responsibility to remove comments or other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, or to ban temporarily or permanently any members for other behaviours that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.

Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from dev.to.
Short: A community for progressive journalists and media folk

Description:
A hackerspace (also referred to as a hacklab, hackspace, or makerspace) is a community-operated, often "not for profit", workspace where people with common interests, such as computers, machining, technology, science, digital art, or electronic art, can meet, socialise, and collaborate. Think of this as your virtual hackerspace.

We are located in Australia (thus the domain) but we don't restrict membership to Australia but we do ask that profiles and posts are in english so as to be the most accessible.

To keep spam and trolling to a minimum we moderate registration. Our server is primarily geared towards people who are in or interested in the Hackerspace movement. We want this to be a place where you can freely discuss your projects and project ideas.
Short: A place for Aussie hackers. A hacker is a person who uses their technical knowledge to achieve a goal or overcome an obstacle. We void warranties, not break laws.
This is a single-user instance for @millenomi@lily.network.

Description:
How to join

Invitation-only. This Mastodon instance costs money and time to host, so I [@kalle@javisst.space] am keeping it closed to friends only. Friend-of-a-friend rule applies here; if you got an invitation to here, then you are a friend.

It's up to every single user on this site to evaluate, case by case, whether a given person may be invited. These decisions does not need to be unison between all the users, only 1 users approval will let you in.

Why does this site exist?

There's a bunch of reasons. The uplifting ones are:

  • Fediverse is cool, I want to get in on this. We can expand later with other platforms that integrate with the fediverse, such as chat apps, image micro-blogging, video streaming, etc.
  • I want all my friends also to have access to this nice tech.
  • Get some practical learning of setting up Linux servers, hardening them, setting up monitoring, e-mail servers, taking use of AWS S3, and just playing around with that. Always wanted to have a server.

But then also we have the full anti-big-corporation arguments. Personally, as a long time Google and Facebook fan and overall lover of the free services we have available today, it has been kind of a red pill mental rollercoaster. Today I'm very keen on adopting these federated solutions instead. Here's why:

  • Fediverse supports diversity of platforms, whereas the current big name platforms only walk towards a more and more locked in oligopoly.
  • Companies sell products to make money, and if their services are free then you as a user are the product they sell. Or rather, everything they know about you is what they sell. This is the whole "they're selling your data" argument. Today, using donation/patron based financial plans is much more viable, and I personally see a much brighter future in such an ecosystem.
  • No risk of a company throwing away (deprecating) the platform out under your feet. The point of this federated solution is that if one Mastodon instance is about to shut down, you can just export your data and move it to a different instance. As there's no company controlling all the instances, no one entity can just throw away features you're relying on.
  • The big corporations that holds the pop social network markets today has thousands of scandals under their belts. Often reoccurring incidents that the companies can solve by tossing money at the problem. As a user of the platform, what can you do? We ponder on our thresholds, like "is this scandal bad enough for me to leave?", to then have the fact that it's so tedious to move being the winning argument to stay. Fediverse solves this a bit by allowing you to completely jump ship and just take all of your content with you, even if you want to jump away not just from a Mastodon instance but away from Mastodon completely.

^ These, and more minor arguments, is what has grinded in my head for the last year. Want change? Make change!

Code of Conduct

This project adheres to No Code of Conduct. We are all adults. We accept anyone's contributions. Nothing else matters.

For more information please visit the No Code of Conduct homepage.

(You visiting and using this site is considered contributions)

Description:
Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of lasersword.club; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    -Excessive advertising
    -Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    -Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    Racism or advocation of racism
    Sexism or advocation of sexism
    Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    Sexual depictions of children
    Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
    Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
Short: A friendly, inclusive Masto instance for fans of a galaxy far, far away....

Description: Awoo Social: Now with more cats!

Short: Toots from the intersection of art and technology.
A private server until we get it established

This is a small Mastodon instance run by the Ethical Systems Nerd, open to anyone who is actively trying to live and work as ethically as possible. Mastodon is a distributed microblogging framework, so nobody owns the whole thing, and it's federated so the distributed instances can talk to each other.

Description:
About

We set up https://guerrill.art as a space for creative minds: a digital community for artists, designers, coders, hackers, activists and inventors - for socializing and learning... Since we are a very small instance, right now we only accept new members who have been recommended to us, or who provide a good specific reason (like a recommendation, or a convincing conversation with us via email or an encrpypted chat) why they want to join our server. There are other large public instances and due to the nature of the Feediverse it is always possible to connect!

It is our intention that you use this service for personal enjoyment and respectful, friendly interaction. To that end, we hope to foster a welcoming and inclusive environment.

This Mastodon server is privately funded and hosted by us on our VPS in Iceland. Fun fact: this server uses 100% green energy.

We are maintaining this instance on our spare time, hardware and nerves.
Don't push either of those...

You can find further information on our instance and the changes we have implemented in our GitHub repository.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  1. In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  2. When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  3. Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  4. If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  5. If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  6. Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  7. Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions. Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  8. In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

These server rules and best practices were inspired by the terms of chaos.social & bsd.network. Thank you!

Cryptobiosis

  1. Cryptobiosis is an amorphic state of life entered by an organism in response to adverse environmental conditions such as dessication, freezing, extreme heat and oxygen deficiency.
  2. In the cryptobiotic state, all measurable metabilic processes stop, preventing reproduction, development, and repair.
  3. When environmental conditions return to being hospitable, the organism will return to its metabolic state of life.

Short: guerrill.art --> made for creative minds: a digital community for artists, designers, coders, hackers, activists and inventors - for socializing and learning...

Welcome to vyrse.social!

Storytelling touches all aspects of our lives. Narrative is a powerful tool in all forms of communication and experience, even in the most empirical fields of study.

Writers, podcasters, actors, journalists, academics, artists and activists are all storytellers. The power of communication and creative expression unites us!

This instance wants to be a home for those who live and breath communication and creative expression. We are all different, but find common ground in our love of storytelling and narrative.

No corporate & brand accounts are permitted, but self-promotion is welcome. Collaboration is encouraged. Exploration and growth is the goal!
Short: A home for storytellers. Artists, authors, actors, scientists, journalists, musicians... anyone and everyone who is driven to use story and narrative to explain, entertain and understand.
