Description:
Welcome to Verum Social!

Social networking, back in your hands

It's never been easier to share your thoughts. You can publish anything you want: links, images, text, and video. All on a community-owned and ad-free platform.

Verum Social has 5000 characters. Your photo's thumbnails can be changed using focal points. You can use personalized emoticons, hide information behind spoiler alerts, and control who sees a particular post. mishandled it? You can quickly rectify errors by deleting and redrafting.

Verum Social is based on Mastodon that gives you the freedom to enjoy content you like. You get to choose who you want to see in your feed, which is non-algorithmic, ad-free, and chronological.

Here are some helpful tidbits for Verum Social newbies.

You can just type @user to specify someone who is on the same server as you, or @user@server to specify someone who is on a different server.
You will receive an alert right here if you are followed or mentioned by anyone on any internet server.
My entire tag is @verum@verumsocial.com.

Please don't hesitate to Direct Message me ( @verum@verumsocial.com ) or tag me in Posts if you have any questions or even if you just want to chat.

So let's talk a little bit about the timelines. There are three of them (unlike twitter, which just has one):
Home, Local, Federated.

Everyone you are following appears on your Home timeline, just like you would expect it to on Twitter.

Every post created on your local server appears in the local timeline.

What is interesting is the federated timeline. It creates a single timeline from all of the servers' timelines.
You can view everyone on the server who has followed them by doing so (assuming the post is public).
As a result, this timeline accurately depicts every Verum Social user online (though not really).
Our Federated Feed is quite robust and covers hundreds of instances because we also have a bot that roams the office and federates with everyone it encounters.

The only other aspect that is distinct is whether a post is listed or not.
You can set a post to be listed or unlisted in addition to the standard privacy settings found on Twitter.

If it's unlisted, it behaves exactly like a regular tweet but doesn't appear anywhere on local or federated timelines.

It should go without saying, but do not be racist, sexist, or hateful, and do not harass others. Don't be shitty! It's a pretty shitty thing to do!

Staff

In addition to the site's owner, @verum verumsocial.com's moderation staff include:

  • @m
Note:
We will never advertise on Verum Social or sell your information to third-partiesYour data is safe with us

Rules

What will get you banned:
  • Anything illegal.
  • Intentionally creating a Verum Social account to circumvent people blocking you.
  • Explicit hate-based racism, sexism, and other hateful speech, but generally unpopular opinions voiced respectfully will be fine.
  • Being a bot (unless you post unlisted and do not auto-follow)
  • Any account setup solely to advertise a product or service
  • NSFW without a content warning
  • Spoilers without a content warning
  • Blocking of moderators is prohibited since it interferes with their ability to moderate content. However if you do not wish a moderator to comment on your posts outside of official moderator communication such a request will be honored.

What won't get you banned:
  • Hurting someone's feelings
  • Anything that can be solved by a personal block
  • Cursing
  • Lewd jokes
  • A bot where all posts are unlisted

Despite the fact that we support the right to free speech, we aim to foster an environment where people respect one another. Don't treat individuals disrespectfully; if they do, block them and go on. An administrator will get in touch with the parties concerned and try to negotiate a peaceful resolution if we get a report about one of our users. We'll have an adult conversation about it. Keep in mind that there is a person on the other side of the computer; if we can act responsibly in real life, we can do the same online.

Federating: Silencing & Blocking


We do not censor or block other Fediverse instances because of their agenda, politics, or users' or staff members' viewpoints. We just demand one simple requirement from the servers we federate with: respect for a user's ability to disconnect. Blocks will only be reserved for technical assaults like DDoS attacks; offending servers would only be hushed, not blocked.

Some examples:
  • If, for any reason, a user requests another user to not tag them, this request will be respected without exception.
  • If a user is blocked and it is clear the user who was blocked that this was directed at that user. Then creating additional accounts specifically to circumvent this block would be disallowed. If the user was unaware of the block then they wouldn't be accountable however.
  • Unsolicited advertising must be opt-in only. This means commercial advertisements which directly tag individual users without permission from that user, especially when done in bulk, will not be allowed.

We understand that moderators will not always catch all of the offenses listed above. If a server does not appear to be in compliance with the above federation policy, we will first contact the server's moderators. We will continue to federate if those moderators actively take action to handle those cases as they are reported. Only cases in which moderators are made aware of the aforementioned cases and fail to act will result in defederation.

Similar to the above, we will always contact the admins of the other server, typically with a CC from a non-Verum Social account, if we receive anonymous reports of *any incident of any type from a foreign server directed towards one of our own users. We will, however, respect any request made by a moderator or administrator not to be contacted for any reason.

We currently do not block or silence any servers in the fediverse.

Longevity and Verum Social

A problem with a federated social network like Mastodon is that users must be certain their instance won't vanish over night. We've seen this happen on several occasions, so we want to allay your concerns if you decide to use Verum Social.

We're not planning on going anywhere, however, we have a strategy in place if we do.

What if we do decide to close down?

The Verum Social won't likely close because we have solid staffing and financial standing. However, we promise to provide you at least three months' notice if we do decide to shut down the instance. Our members should have ample time to discover a new instance, migrate, and let their followers know about it.

Cross-posting

The automatic copying of posts from one platform to another is known as "cross-posting." The simultaneous posting to various platforms from the same app, like Twidere, is not included in that description. We consider all posts from Twidere or PostyBirb as originals.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other social media sites is completely allowed. Cross-posting to Mastodon from another platform is allowed under the following conditions:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Mobile & Desktop Apps

Thanks to Mastodon's open API, you can use it from any of these apps developed by third-party developers.

Android

  • Mastodon for Android - free
  • Tusky - free
  • Yuito - free
  • Subway Tooter - free
  • FediLab - paid

iOS

  • Metatext - free
  • Mastodon for iOS - free
  • Amarok - free
  • Toot! - paid
  • Mast - paid

Web

  • Pinafore - free
  • Halcyon - free
  • Cuckoo - free
  • HyperSpace - free

Desktop

  • Whalebird - free
  • TheDesk - free
  • HyperSpace - free
  • Sengi - free
  • Mastonaut - paid
  • Mast - paid

Attributions

What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on the internet

If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, youâ€™re not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.

  • United States: Contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Crisis workers are available 24 hours a day. Calls are free and confidential.
  • Other countries & regions: To find a crisis center near you, visit International Association for Suicide Prevention.

If you or someone you know is thinking about engaging in self-harm or suicidal behavior, you should seek help as soon as possible by contacting services with expertise in crisis intervention and suicide prevention.

Description:
Verhaltensregeln

Ich habe fÃ¼r die Nutzung gewisse Serverregeln erstellt, die Ihr etwas weiter unten auf dieser Seite findet und die Ihr mit der Erstellung eines Accounts bei social.retronerd.at akzeptiert. Bitte beachtet, andere Instanzen haben andere Regeln. Was hier erlaubt ist, kann dort verboten sein und umgekehrt. Wenn Ihr VerstÃ¶ÃŸe erkennt, kÃ¶nnt Ihr diese Ã¼ber das Meldesystem melden. Bitte seit dort so genau wie mÃ¶glich und gebt mir ggf. Zusatzinformationen, damit ich den Vorfall besser (und schneller) einordnen kann. Bei VerstÃ¶ÃŸen gegen die Serverregeln kann es zu einer LÃ¶schung der BeitrÃ¤ge und auch zur LÃ¶schung des verursachenden Accounts kommen. Was bedeutet Relaying?

Alle Nachrichten (Toots), die Ã¶ffentlich markiert sind und auf der lokalen Zeitleiste erscheinen, werden zusÃ¤tzlich auf den o.g. Relay Ã¼bergeben und somit zusÃ¤tzlich in den lokalen Zeitleiste auf den teilnehmenden anderen Instanzen eingeblendet. Dies fÃ¶rdert kleinere Instanzen um mehr Inhalte in der lokalen Zeitleiste angezeigt zu bekommen. Ihr mÃ¼sst hierzu selbst nichts machen, dies geschieht automatisch.

Description: Small Akkoma Instance

Over Masto Kreks

Wie

Masto Kreks is ogezet door Remco - onderheerser over het Kreksiverse.

Waarom

Op de eerste plaats omdat we moeten zorgen dat er veel kleine Mastodon server moeten zijn i.p.v. een paar te grote.

En op de andere eerste plaats om een zo vrij mogelijke instance te runnen. Natuurlijk wordt er ge-moderate want het moet geen Parler, Truth of Twitter worden. Maar verder dan echte zuigers, trollen, fascisten en nazi's zal er vanuit deze server niet gemodereerd worden.

Het leven heeft nou eenmaal ook sarcasme en cynisme nodig. De Sywerts van deze wereld hebben tegengas nodig. Daarom Masto Kreks.

Geld

Zo'n server kost geld. Blijft het bij een paar gebruikers dan betaald Kreks dat wel, worden het er wat meer dan komt er een mogelijkheid om vrijwillig bij te dragen.

Mastodon Server Covenant

We zijn niet aanwezig op joinmastodon.org (geen behoefte en deze server is toch te klein) maar hun covenant gebruiken wij als handvat (we houden ons er aan). Dit houdt o.a. in dat er minstens 3 maanden van te voren duidelijk wordt aangekondigd dat de server opgeheven gaat worden, mocht dit ooit het geval zijn.

moderatie

  1. Binnen deze instance
    • Ga je steeds regels (die paar die zijn) overtreden verzoeken we je te verhuizen.
    • Duurt het te lang dan doei.
  2. Andere instances
    • Een gebruiker overtreed een regel = block.
    • Een instance vol met geteisem blocken we helemaal.
  3. Maar dus niks op voorhand
Short: Om mijn steentje bij te dragen aan de decentralisatie van Mastodon kunnen 100 mensen gebruik maken van de server van Kreks. Een server met wat basisregels, verder niks.

Description:
Welcome to the squeakyverse!

Squeaky.social is a Mastodon server catering to those who enjoy the more lighter side of life, with the appreciation for all things inflatable.

The server is is open for requests to join - users must either be invited or submit a reason for joining. We review all requests personally.

The server is built around trust and respect for all its members. We ask that all individuals adhere to the code of conduct as follows.

Code of Conduct

  1. You must be of legal age.
    The server hosts content from other servers around the fediverse. The administrators and moderators cannot be held accountable for the content which is hosted by this service. As such, all users must be of the legal age of majority (usually 18 years) in their country at the time they join the server. Users found violating this will be immediately banned from the server.
  2. No hate speech.
    Users are expected to refrain from using hate speech, not limited to; bigotry, transphobia, homophobia, racism and sexism. We are a welcoming community, and expect our users to be as well.
  3. Be respectful of others.
    Treat everyone as you wish to be treated in public, and be respectful of others views. Not everyone is expected to share the same religion, culture or views as you, so be patient and kind. Conversely, repeated behaviour which expresses views or ideals not suitable for this community will be dealt with accordingly.
  4. Public content must be suitable for all ages.
    Content posted on this server must either be suitable for all ages, or designated as "sensitive media" and be tagged with the appropriate details. Failure to do so will result in a warning; repeated failure will result in automatic sensitive flag to all posts or even suspension.
  5. Harassment will not be tolerated.
    Harassment of any kind will not be tolerated, and will be dealt with through suspension immediately. Repeated offences will result in a permanent ban.
  6. Spamming or unwanted solicitation prohibited.
    Users must not use this service for the purpose of spamming, distribution, marketing or solicitation of goods, services, or any unwanted material. This can include but not be limited to promotion of commercial goods and services, political advertisements, and illegal activities. We do allow for reasonable self-promotion of personal and professional activities, so long as the treatment is consistent with our community and does not occur more than once daily.

Funding

This server is crowdfunded by Liberapay donations. If you enjoy using social.b4tech.cc then consider donating

Description: Generalist instance for anybody over the age of 18.

A Mastodon instance for Gamers and Content Creators

I decided to build this instance as I couldn't really find any other that fit my niche well. This server is open to anyone, but the primary niche is for anyone into video games, content creation (youtube, twitch, etc.) or a mix of the two. It's especially aimed for small creators to help foster a community to build each other up, but both creators of any size, or people who aren't creators at all, are welcome.

Registration

Status: Approval Required

I'm currently working to finalize a few things in order to get this instance ready for open registration, but if you wish to join now, feel free to ask for approval, for the reason give a quick blurb about yourself, if a content creator link to your main channel as well if possible. Due to the influx of users Mastodon as a whole is seeing, once I do push registration to be open, it will be at my discretion to close them off at any point should I feel the need to do so.
Short: A Mastodon instance primarily for gaming and content creation (Twitch, YouTube, etc.)

Description:
You can read more on those rules below.

The Dreamer's Guild Redux

It feels a bit odd to be using this name after such a long hiatus. I admit, I was a bit leery to use the name as the first iteration (nearly 20 years ago, now) ended. The few remnants of the Dreamer's Guild who I remain in contact with felt this was an appropriate use of the domain, though, so here we are.

The Dreamer's Guild is really just a collection of friends who managed to stay friends long enough to form a community. There is no real magic to it beyond that. Some have been here since the beginning. Others joined along the way. If you think you'd be a good fit, drop us a note. We're always looking for like-minded folks to help us grow and evolve, but we're old enough now to be picky. I would argue that "Dreamer's" is a bit of a misnomer - as most of us prize moving from dream to action. In that sense, we are dreamers who do and our interests and curiosities remain vast.

We're geeky - to be sure - but far more than the sum of those interests, alone.

Code of Conduct

I will make this easy - if you are on this server, you are here by invitation. That invitation can be revoked at any time for any reason. I look at the Dreamers Guild as a community, and that community has specific standards. If you violate those standards, don't expect to be invited back.

With that in mind, here is a basic list of our community standards (as seen above).

  • Don't be a dick.
  • If you must be a dick, punch up not down.
    • Basically, any post that contributes further harm to marginalized identities will be removed and could lead to your removal from the community.
    • We do value education over retribution - but only if there is a genuine desire to learn and grow followed by actual growth and change.

  • This is a federated site and we want to be respectful of our broader content communities.
    • Do use Content Warnings try to add descriptive text to all posted images.
    • Violating this may not get you kicked, but it is a best practice we want to encourage.
    • Think before you post federated content. We use the Hometown variant codebase which allows the posting of non-federated content. This allows you to share things with the local community without it being shared beyond. Keep this in mind when you think about where you are posting.

That should be enough to get us going. We are small community and if you are part of us, it probably means you know all of the above anyway. It is good to have it listed, though.

If you have questions - ping @scrivenersjest
Short: The Dreamer's Guild is a motley collection of developers, creators, artists, tech experts, and academics who somehow managed to become a community.

Description:
This server is for all forms of cycling, anywhere it occurs - a potential home for #BikeTooter members (term coined by carol)

Administrator is US & English based, but that does not need to limit members.

If you're here via Flyyn and are trans but not a cyclist, Flyyn also runs transforthe.win

Registration

We sometimes switch registrations to require manual approval for safety and performance of our system.

If we are moderating registrations, please include a brief summary when you register, and we'll be happy to welcome you!

Moderation

Please report any unacceptable content.

Our administration + moderation team is limited, so we can't guarantee our response will be instant, but we will address anything that is needed.

Server

This instance is currently running on a medium sized server privately owned and funded by Flyyn. The server is on annual billing, so we aren't disappearing overnight.
Short:
A space for competitive and casual cyclists.

Admin is in the amateur + collegiate MTB/CX scene in New England, but space is open to all.

Description:
The Dandelion Hub features the Dandelion Network social network to support communication and collaboration between activists creating a movement of movements for science, people power and a livable future. It aims to provide a "digital neighbourhood" for like-minded people to connect, organize and advertise actions. It is a service provided by the Dandelion Hub (https://dhub.global), a platform for progressive civil resistance movements.

All users are advised to be friendly, constructive and effective in their communication. While users are encouraged to share information and opinions on relevant topics, they are endorsed to avoid off-topic content.

Posts containing off-topic contents (e.g. funny cat videos) will be interpreted as an act of civil resistance against the civil resistance movement and will result in a raised eyebrow by the admin ;-).

To discuss specific topics in channels use #HashTagsWithCamelBackNotation.

To permanently share content consider using external file sharing services which allow a hierarchical folder structure, e.g. Nextcloud.

In addition the rules of the mastodon.social network apply [1]:

  1. Sexually explicit or violent media must be marked as sensitive when posting
  2. No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, or casteism
  3. No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies
  4. No harassment, dogpiling or doxxing of other users
  5. No content illegal in Germany

[1] https://mastodon.social/about/more
Short: "The Dandelion Network"(https://dhub.social) is part of the federated social network to support communication and collaboration between activists creating a movement of movements for science, people power and a livable future. It is a service provided by the Dandelion Hub (https://dhub.global), a platform for progressive civil resistance movements.

Description:
No matter what you #make this is an open, decentralised, free online space for you to share what you're doing and connect with with other makers. Your info will never be sold and you will never be advertised to. You can always download all your posts, move to a new server and/or delete your account - you always have full control.

The Ballarat Hackerspace operates this Mastodon instance and we are a non-profit volunteer run space that is open to the community for as many hours are we can find people to open the space. If you are a local maker feel free to drop in, we are not exclusively for tech and robot geeks!
Short: An open and inclusive place for all Aussie (and Aussie at heart) makers! Come and share what you're making with the world.

Description:
Cette instance Mastodon communautaire a pour but d'accueillir des personnes passionnÃ©es par les histoires et la crÃ©ation autour des cultures de l'imaginaire. L'imaginaire est entendu au sens large incluant notamment, mais pas exclusivement, la science-fiction, la fantasy, le fantastique, le polar, le thriller.

MÃªme si la passion des histoires est le ciment qui nous lit, les discussions dÃ©bordent bien sÃ»r de ce thÃ¨me, comme dans toutes comme communautÃ©. La dÃ©couverte, l'ouverture et la curiositÃ© sont les bienvenus.

Ce serveur se veut une oasis et un espace de convivialitÃ©, de dÃ©tente et de libertÃ© pour ses membres. On est lÃ  pour respirer, sourire, et vivre notre plus belle vie. On a le droit d'Ãªtre en colÃ¨re, mais gÃ©nÃ©ralement, on essaie dans nos messages d'Ãªtre le plus positif possible et de voir la vie du bon cÃ´tÃ©. On n'est pas lÃ  pour ruminer ou se prendre la tÃªte entre nous. Cela guide nos choix dans nos messages: Les posts qui ont le plus de valeur ici sont ceux qui font du bien Ã  nous et aux autres et nous Ã©lÃ¨ve en tant qu'humain. C'est pompeux, mais vous voyez l'idÃ©e. AprÃ¨s, ce n'est pas non plus le monde des bisounours. On parle de fantastique, de thriller, parfois de dark fantasy ou de gore, bien volontiers, mais on pense aussi aux autres en ajoutant les trigger warnings qui vont bien pour masquer ces posts par dÃ©faut.

Pour garantir le caractÃ¨re thÃ©matique, amical et inclusif du serveur, l'inscription se fait par invitation. Si vous voulez nous rejoindre, demandez Ã  un membre existant !

Amusez-vous bien !

Du bon usage du Fediverse

Il est conseillÃ© d'utiliser des hashtags pour parler de sujets en particulier (#Ã©criture, #graphisme, ...), afin de rendre la recherche de posts sur un sujet ou un autre plus simple.

Les flux local est important. Merci de bien limiter la diffusion des messages qui ferait double emploi, comme par exemple, les messages successifs d'un thread.

RÃ¨gles

Cette instance demande Ã  ses occupants de se plier Ã  certaines rÃ¨gles, avoir un comportement tel que ceux qui suivent vous exposeront Ã  une suspension immÃ©diate :

  • Le fait de poster des contenus illÃ©gaux est... IllÃ©gal. Ce serveur est situÃ© en Suisse, regroupe essentiellement des francophones, mais il respecte la loi franÃ§aise. Les contenus appelant Ã  la haine, la propagande nazie, la pornographie infantile, et tout autre contenu illÃ©gal selon la loi franÃ§aise est interdit.
  • Le fait de poster des contenus homophobes, sexistes, racistes, antisÃ©mites, islamophobes, ou haineux de quelque faÃ§on que ce soit. Il est toutefois possible de discuter de tels sujets (bien que cette instance ne soit pas nÃ©cessairement le meilleur endroit pour le faire) en utilisant un CW, des citations, et en incluant du contexte.
  • Postez du contenu pornographique.
  • Rendre public, en faisant un screenshot ou en copie/collant des messages publics privÃ©s ou directs que l'auteurÂ·trice ne voulait pas voir public.
  • Prendre part Ã  une campagne de harcÃ¨lement
  • Poster du spam, de la publicitÃ© pour un produit commercial, etc. Poster de temps en temps des informations sur vos crÃ©ations, bouquins, illustrations, est cependant totalement admis. C'est le fruit de notre passion, quoi !

Avoir un comportement tel que ceux qui suivent vous exposeront Ã  une suppression de votre message et a un avertissement. AprÃ¨s trois avertissements, vous serez suspenduÂ·e. - Poster des nus sans le marquer NSFW. - Manquer clairement de respect envers unÂ·e autre utilisateurÂ·ice. - ÃŠtre un connard (ou une connasse, Ã§a peut parfois aussi arriver).

Actuellement, l'administration est gÃ©rÃ©e par @mickael, et recherche des modÃ©rateurs. Cela peut changer Ã  l'avenir, et Ã§a sera notÃ© sur cette page. Merci de signaler les contenus et utilisateurs ne respectant pas les rÃ¨gles Ã©noncÃ©es plus haut en utilisant la fonction de signalement. Nous n'hÃ©sitons pas Ã  modÃ©rer les posts, Ã  silencer et/ou suspendre les utilisateurs, locaux ou distants, et les instances.

Informations techniques

Le serveur est hÃ©bergÃ© chez Exoscale, dans le datacenter de GenÃ¨ve.

ConfidentialitÃ© des donnÃ©es

Les donnÃ©es que vous postez ici vous appartiennent. Les opÃ©rateurs du serveur respecte la vie privÃ©e de ses utilisateurs et se conforme Ã  la RGPD. Nous ne vendons pas les donnÃ©es, nous n'envoyons pas de spam.

Plus

J'ai (MickaÃ«l RÃ©mond) tentÃ© de ponder une version de ces rÃ¨gles avec le plus de bon sens, mais j'ai dÃ» certainement faire pleins d'erreurs, d'imprÃ©cisions. Je vous remercie de proposer vos amÃ©liorations !

N'hÃ©sitez pas a nous contacter pour plus d'informations par email, ou directement sur Mastodon, aux adresses indiquÃ©es sur ce site.

Description:
preppers-shelter.nl rules!!

no content that is racist, hate speech or otherwise deemed offensive (ultimately to be decided by the admin) no things that are illegal in the Netherlands no advertising and no spam respect each other hide sensitive texts and media when there is a reason to do so

========================================================================================
Wij willen een virtuele plek bieden voor iedereen die zich bezig houdt met 'Preppen'.
Het woord 'preppen' komt van het Engelse 'prepare', voorbereiden.
Een begrip wat zeer veel onderwerpen bevat.

Of je nu je voorbereidt op het tijdelijk niet beschikbaar zijn van elektriciteit, water, gas, de supermarkt, het uitvallen van de pinautomaten door lokale incidenten en rampen (zoals inmiddels ook geadviseerd door de overheid) of je gelooft dat de hele (wereld) maatschappij afstevent op een complete ineenstorting en je geheel voor jezelf moet zorgen.

Zelf(samen)voorzienend zijn, doe het zelf, survival, bushcraft, voedsel verbouwen, medische kennis, tactieken, etc, we zijn hier om van elkaar te leren en contacten te leggen. Ga fatsoenlijk om met andere leden en respecteer dat meningen vaak verschillen. Deel je informatie en laat een ander vrij in zijn of haar keuze. Het eindeloos trachten te overtuigen van anderen van een bepaalde visie (stokpaardjes), grof taalgebruik, op de man spelen, is niet toegestaan.

Wij vragen begrip voor het feit dat niet ieder prepper gerelateerd onderwerp hier besproken wordt, zie bv. regel over vuurwapens en andere in NL verboden wapens voor niet vergunninghouders.

Het beheer behoudt te allen tijde het recht om posts, topics of gebruikers te verwijderen die ons inziens onze visie niet ondersteunen.

Mvgr, De Beheerders.

Voor een uitgebreide versie van onze huisregels zie: forum regels
Short: Mastodon server voor de leden van de preppers-shelter.nl community
OsobnÃ­ Mastodon server :-)

Basic models of flocking behavior are controlled by three simple rules: 1) separation: avoid crowding neighbours (short range repulsion); 2) alignment: steer towards average heading of neighbors; 3) cohesion: steer towards average position of neighbors (long range attraction). With these three simple rules, the flock moves in an extremely realistic way.

youusme is a place to share with your friends, but not for anyone to make money off your data. We may has for a little cash from time to time. We need to keep the squirrels running the servers. Or you can pay it forward for others. We try to keep your data secure from others, but Mastodon does not encrypt or store data in encrypted form.

We request that once you complete the sign up process you do the following. Check your preferences and turn off most of them. Also check other under preferences and set Posting Privacy to - Follows-only

Also remember when posting a message with someone tagged, they will get a copy of the message. When posting, decide if you want that directly sent to the person you are tagging or not. Make sure you check the world icon at the bottom of the post and choose private for most conversations.
Short: Join the Not Twitter crowd and get your data back. We do not use your information.

Description: Desea's comfy lil cafe

Mastodon instance of PegeLinux Community. Currently, registration is limited to members only. We are only a small instance. We do some moderation and process reports.

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

CoC

  • Keep it kind, free speech is fine, but it doesn't mean you can harass and insult other members
  • Feel free to geek out about anything you're passionate about (whilst adhering to other rules)
  • Everyone is equal
  • Don't post anything that would be classified as illegal in Indonesia

Terms

  • The servers is hosted in Indonesia.
  • The only logs created are the ones from: caddy, mastodon (nodejs, puma, postgre, redis, sidekiq) and minio (assets).
  • There is no retention currently in place as all of the logs are ephemeral inside docker container.
Short: Mastodon instance of PegeLinux Community.

Description:
Code of Conduct

Note: "Simian Rodeo" in this document refers to the Simian Rodeo Mastodon instance at https://simian.rodeo. "The administrators" refers to the administrators on this organization: currently @boogah@simian.rodeo.

Simian Rodeo is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

This code of conduct applies to all Simian Rodeo spaces, including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the administrators.

Types of Harassment

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, immigration status, religion, or other identity marker. This includes anti-Indigenous/Nativeness and anti-Blackness.
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a person's lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of "dead" or rejected names
  • The promotion or endorsement of so-called "conversion therapy" or related programs.
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they're not appropriate
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or "backrub") without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Stalking or following
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person's identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication
  • Jokes that resemble the above, such as "hipster racism", still count as harassment even if meant satirically or ironically.
  • Microaggressions, which take the form of everyday jokes, put downs, and insults that spread humiliating feelings to people of marginalized groups

The administrators will not act on complaints regarding:

  • "Reverse"-isms, including "reverse racism," "reverse sexism," and "cisphobia"
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as "leave me alone," "go away," or "I'm not discussing this with you."
  • Communicating in a "tone" you don't find congenial
  • Criticism of racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Reporting

If you are being harassed by a member of Simian Rodeo, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact an administrator (listed at the top of this document) directly or file a report using the Mastodon reporting system (click the "..." on a post and then use the reporting feature).

The admins reserve the right to exclude people from Simian Rodeo based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Simian Rodeo spaces and behavior towards people who are not in Simian Rodeo. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Simian Rodeo spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Simian Rodeo members or the general public.

Updates

The administrators reserve the right to update the Code of Conduct at any time at their discretion. Updates to the CoC will be communicated to users via email and posts from admin accounts. If you have any concerns about or suggestions for the CoC, please contact an administrator via DM.

License

This was adapted from Friend Camp's modifications to the LGBTQ in Tech Code of Conduct and as such is licensed using a Creative Commons Zero License, meaning the contents are in the public domain. It's turtles all the way down.

Description:
Welcome!

hex.st is a coven in the big world of people-owned social networks.
(In more occult words: a Mastodon instance, part of the Fediverse.)

This space is intended for discussions about anything and everything, and in particular topics at the intersection of art, play, community and technology.

We welcome anyone as long as they share a few core values.
To state things more explicitly: we don't accept everyone and we don't tolerate everything. The driving principle behind hex.st is to create a warm and safe environment for its inhabitants. To enable this, a modicum of decency and kindness is required from members, and they must follow a few rules designed to protect a healthy and inclusive atmosphere. If you object to this in any way, the rest of the Fediverse awaits you!

What are the core values of the hex.st community?

While a definite list would be impossible to document, here are the broad strokes:

  • All humans deserve equal rights and opportunities; empathy and solidarity mean the most privileged ought to support those who need it. Black lives matter. Trans lives matter.

  • We reject ideologies that lead to the impoverishment, exploitation and degradation of the most vulnerable: fascism, imperialism, capitalism, longtermism, religious extremism. We reject entities that exist to uphold these ideologies, including the police and armed forces, tech oligarchies, the church.

  • Questioning power and critical thought are equally important to navigate a world submerged in data, but we must be wary of conspiracy theories and schemes designed to exploit or radicalize. The planet is not flat and vaccines do not contain microchips. Climate change is an urgent threat that humanity must face now.

  • In case it wasn't clear, this is not a 'politics-free zone' â€“ demanding that political discussion be silenced is a privileged stance that only furthers the status quo. We believe that every part of our lives is influenced by the politics and policies that form the social structure we exist in, and as such it is our responsibility to examine them and work towards their betterment.

For rules on specific behaviors and topics, see the "Server rules" section below.

Why this name?

"hex.st" is meant to evoke, at once: the comradeship of modern (queer) occultism; the sometimes fascinating intertwining of geometry and mathematics; the reclaiming of the web for deeply personal aesthetics; the (a)symmetry of game spaces. (You don't have to understand or agree with any of this mumbo-jumbo to join!)
Short: A coven founded on empathy and solidarity. Here we discuss anything and everything, and in particular topics at the intersection of art, play, community and technology.

What is this

The Dingo Network is a Mastodon based social network for human pups, handlers, and other pet players.

Based in Australia but open world-wide, The Dingo Network provides a way for you to share posts, videos and images with the world. Think of it as sexy Twitter, without advertising and not being actively destroyed by a Billionaire throwing a tantrum.

Adults Only

Joining the Dingo Network is easy, but requires age verification to prove you're over 18.

Tell Me More!

About the Server

This server is run by Pup Reckon.

Mastodon

Mastodon is a social media service that is run by its users. Anyone is free to start a Mastodon server, anyone from any server can follow anyone else, and you're free to move your account to another server if you'd like.

Description:
Welcome!

Provo was a Dutch counterculture movement in the mid-1960s, including anarchists, provos, beatniks, pleiners, scissors-grinders, jailbirds, simple simon stylites, magicians, pacifists, potato-chip chaps, charlatans, philosophers, germ-carriers, grand masters of the queen's horse, happeners, vegetarians, syndicalists, santy clauses, kindergarten teachers, agitators, pyromaniacs, assistant assistants, scratchers and syphilitics, and other riff-raff.

We've named our instance in their honour.

Provo.lol

Provo.lol is a tiny server running Mastodon. Our small community values knowledge-sharing, creativity, empathy, and socialism. This guide will help people who want to join provo.lol to get started.

What is Mastodon?

Mastodon is a micro-blogging platform based on the principles of free, open source software and distributed networking. If you are familiar with Twitter, you already know what micro-blogging is: the sharing of short online messages with a public community. Mastodon is free and open source, which means that everyone can download the software free of charge, and contribute to its development. Mastodonâ€™s network is distributed, which means that the messages sent across the network are not all stored on a single computer, but on as many computers as there are Mastodon servers.

You can see provo.lol as a tiny star in a vast network of Mastodon servers, a network thatâ€™s also known as the Fediverse (as in, federated + universe). Everyone who is part of provo.lol can connect with hundreds of thousands of microbloggers across the world!

Signing up

Signing up to a Mastodon server is easy. All you need is a username, an e-mail address and a password for your account. At provo.lol weâ€™re not requiring anyone to give their real name. You could do so, but a nickname or alias is perfectly fine too. But do make sure you choose a good password. (For a fun way to generate strong passwords, try the diceware method at the Electronic Frontier Foundation.)

For extra security, it is possible to set up two-factor authentication later. Provo.lol uses Google Authenticator for this, an app you can download on your phone for free. We strongly recommend setting up two-factor authentication, as it allows us to verify itâ€™s really you. Each time you log in, we can then check both your password and a unique code generated on your phone. In this way, someone who got hold of your password still would not be able to log in under your name. This keeps your account super safe.

If you want to sign-up to provo.lol, you will have to request an invitation, or wait until one of our community invites you.

Community culture

Weâ€™re a friendly community at provo.lol, and we hope you will make new friends on the Fediverse (recall, the big network of all Mastodon users). Please make sure to follow our Server Rules, which for example prohibit making racist or transphobic remarks, or inciting people to commit violence. Provo.lol will defederate from any servers that have a track-record of condoning fascists, racists, sexists, TERFs, or ableists.

If you see that any message or media broadcast by our server is inappropriate or offensive, or see that we amplify messages from a problematic server, please report it to @mar, our administrator.

Development

This instance is still under development, though it is currently functioning smoothly. Recently we've upgraded to Mastodon 4. We've added external physical storage (1TB SSD) for user file hosting and cache. We're trying to run this instance wholly locally, without dependence on cloud storage. We have daily off-site backups of our database.

Still to do: better documentation, and (ideally) a move to solar power

Description:
Privacy

It is important to understand that this service does not provide strong privacy guarantees - Mastodon is neither a private nor encrypted messenger. Please do not attempt to use Mastodon for secure or non-public communications, and recall that you alone are responsible for ensuring your privacy needs are met. This is true of all Mastodon instances.
Short: Taking the "Twitter" out of "InfoSec Twitter."

Description:
Legal Notice

Responsible for the operation of this instance is

Thomas Frenzel
KÃ¶penicker LandstraÃŸe 272
12437 Berlin

In case of any questions concerning this instance you may contact mastodon@fediver.de

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.

When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.

Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user. If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings. If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated. Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so. Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("â€¦@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators. In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network. Thank you!)

Attribution

This text is free to be adapted and remixed under the terms of the CC-BY (Attribution 4.0 International) license. We adapted the text and the server rules below from chaos.social.

Description:
The alien.insurrection.tech instance is specifically serious hardcore #UFO #UAP #ET #PSI #ALIENABDUCTION orientated. There may also be some #IT #LINUX #OSS related matters as well, as takes my fancy.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offences, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offences.

Description:
This is a private instance of @dunkelstern@kampftoast.de. Occasionally I will let people join that I know personally.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behaviour that can be expected to see from users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (see below for more information), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • Again, if you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Twitter crossposters, "retweets" and posts with broken mentions ("â€¦@twitter.com") will not be tolerated.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to.
  • Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings, so be clear if you want to use them and apologize if you see them missunderstood.

On Content warnings

There is not a firm rule on content warnings. Use them as you please. However here are some best practices for you to consider.

Content Warnings have a few uses:

  • If discussing topics that can cause distress or trigger PTSD, like a great many political situations
  • Discussing topics that will spoil a book / movie / show

It is recommended that people make use of them.

It is far easier on the mental health of other users to opt into a discussion about Whatever than to skim past it.

Please make sure that your CWs are specific so users know whether they want to opt in or not. e.g. are you hiding a toot / image that depicts violence or hints at it? Are you hiding the season finale to a show? How users socialize their use of CWs is what makes them useful. Making heavy, unclear, use of CWs adds confusion.

Description:
Welcome

This instance was created with the intent of making a safe digital space for musicians, fans, promoters, and anyone else in the Boston music scene.

Community Guidelines

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of bostonmusic.online community; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies: The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

  • Excessive advertising (see Advertising Policy, below)
  • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
  • Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
  • Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
  • Racism or advocation of racism
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism
  • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
  • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
  • Sexual depictions of children
  • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism, Nazism, fascism.

Stalking and Harrassment

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
  • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
  • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
This document was last updated April 17, 2020.
Originally adapted from the Mastodon Code of Conduct and Pixelfed's code of conduct.

Advertisements policy

Advertising of shows and events are allowed. only two posts per event please: once before the event, and once on the day of. Any more than this will be consider spam.

Recommendations

To get the most out of Mastodon, I recommend using Tusky or Fedilab for Android, and Toot!, Amaroq, or Mast for IOS.

Funding

For now, this instance is personally funded.

Staff

For now: I, MostToast, am the only moderator.

Mastodon
Short: Digital space serving the Boston music scene.

Description:
Code of Conduct

This policy is a “living” document, and subject to refinement and expansion in the future. Last updated July 13, 2019.

Everyone participating in the Wrestling.social communityâ€”including, but not limited to the Wrestling.social mastodon instance or in-person meetupsâ€”is required to agree to the following Code of Conduct. This includes all attendees, members, patrons (sponsors), volunteers, and staff.

Wrestling.social is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neurotype, physical appearance, body, age, race, ethnicity, nationality, language, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

Anyone who violates this Code of Conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from the site (or any in-person event) at the discretion of the Wrestling.social admins.

Definitions

Harassment includes:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neurotype, physical appearance, body, age, race, ethnicity, nationality, language, or religion
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a personâ€™s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of â€˜deadâ€™ or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where theyâ€™re not appropriate
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like â€œhugâ€ or â€œbackrubâ€) without consent or after a request to stop
  • Threats of violence
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Stalking or following
  • Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Deliberate â€œoutingâ€ of any aspect of a personâ€™s identity without their consent except as necessary to protect other Wrestling.social community members or other vulnerable people from intentional abuse
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication without consent by the involved parties

Wrestling.social prioritizes marginalized peopleâ€™s safety over privileged peopleâ€™s comfort. Wrestling.social reserves the right not to act on complaints regarding:

  • â€˜Reverseâ€™ -isms, including â€˜reverse racism,â€™ â€˜reverse sexism,â€™ and â€˜cisphobiaâ€™
  • Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as â€œleave me alone,â€ â€œgo away,â€ or â€œIâ€™m not discussing this with you.â€
  • Communicating in a â€˜toneâ€™ you donâ€™t find congenial
  • Criticizing racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, Wrestling.social may take any action we deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Wrestling.social spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Wrestling.social community members or the general public.

Reporting and Enforcement

If you are being harassed by a member of the Wrestling.social community, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please send a message to @phil@wrestling.social or contact us immediately via email at ws@extrafuture.com.

Thanks

This policy was based on resources provided by XOXO Fest, Geek Feminism, and borrows heavily from similar open source policies authored by JSConf AU and Django.

Thank you also to Ashe Dryden and Karolina Szczur for their advice and support.

This policy is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license, and is available on GitHub. We encourage other events to adopt (and enforce) similar policies by using and remixing ours.

Description:
The Texas Observer strives to make Texas a more equitable place through investigative reporting, narrative storytelling, and political and cultural coverage and commentary. We dig beyond the headlines and contextualize news events. Our essays, reviews, and criticism seek to create a new cultural canon and challenge existing mythologies.

Since our founding in 1954, the Observer has focused on communities whose stories are too often ignored or poorly told. We seek not only to inform, but to empower our readers, as we work to hold public officials and corporations accountable. Our reporters recognize that oppressed people are experts on their own lives and trust their expertise.

Our journalism is fact-based and rigorous, and we prize writing that entertains as it informs. We value history as a reporting tool that allows us to interrogate the origins of policies and to correct narratives that whitewash exploitation, dispossession, and genocide.

Our founding mission statement continues to guide our work:

â€œWe will serve no group or party but will hew hard to the truth as we find it and the right as we see it. We are dedicated to the whole truth, to human values above all interests, to the rights of humankind as the foundation of democracy. We will take orders from none but our own conscience, and never will we overlook or misrepresent the truth to serve the interests of the powerful or cater to the ignoble in the human spirit.â€

(Header illustration by AdriÃ  VoltÃ , depicting a cowboy on a horse in silhouette, riding into the sunset down the dry canyon where the Rio Grande once flowed. The tall stone walls are lined with prickly pears and other succulents.
Short: Founded in 1954, The Texas Observer is a progressive nonprofit news outlet and print magazine covering the Lone Star State.

Wenn du nicht mit jemandem interagieren mÃ¶chtest oder einen seiner BeitrÃ¤ge nicht sehen mÃ¶chtest, stehen dir Tools wie die Mute- und Blockfunktionen zur VerfÃ¼gung. Bitte melde Verhalten, von dem du glaubst, dass es die Regeln verletzt. Das schlieÃŸt Verhalten von anderen Instanzen mit ein. Achte auch darauf was du postest. Toots auf Mastodon sind erst einmal Ã¶ffentlich und das Internet vergisst nie! Wenn du nicht mÃ¶chtest, dass jeder deine BeitrÃ¤ge lesen kann, verwende die PrivatsphÃ¤re-Einstellungen.

FÃ¶deration

karottenfabrik.net glaubt nicht an Zensur. Fediverse ist ein Netzwerkdienst und die Aussetzung der Fediverse mit einem anderen Server wird nur als letztes Mittel durchgefÃ¼hrt. Sollten aber einzelne Instanzen dauerhaft entgegen unserer Regeln handeln, kÃ¶nnen diese durch uns stummgeschaltet oder gesperrt werden. Haben wir deiner Meinung nach eine falsche Entscheidung getroffen? Dann kontaktiere uns!

Backups und VerfÃ¼gbarkeit

Es werden tÃ¤gliche Backups der Instanz angelegt. karottenfabrik.net wird privat in unserer Freizeit betrieben. Wir behalten uns vor, den Dienst jederzeit aus rechtlichen, technischen oder finanziellen GrÃ¼nden einzuschrÃ¤nken oder zu beenden. Sollte dies der Fall sein, geben wir uns MÃ¼he, dies mindestens 3 Monate im Voraus bekannt zu geben.

Spenden

Wir stellen karottenfabrik.net werbe- und trackerfrei in unserer Freizeit zur VerfÃ¼gung. DafÃ¼r fallen im Moment folgende Kosten an:

ein Root-Server fÃ¼r 8â‚¬ monatlich die kratottenfabrik Domain fÃ¼r 39 â‚¬ jÃ¤hrlich

Wir machen das gerne und erwarten auch nichts als Gegenleistung von dir.

Description:
Welcome!

I (Tyler) operate this instance for myself and anybody in my circle that would like to join. If we've met in-person, we've worked together, or we've ever sent one another a message over email or text, that's plenty of reason to join. I'd love you have you here!

Aside from "you know who I am", why would you elect to create an account here rather than somewhere else?

  1. I'm privacy-paranoid. You're reading from a Mastodon instance that's full-disk encrypted at rest and using solely my own self-hosted services.
  2. I'm operationally paranoid. This server keeps regular disk snapshots, is fully config-managed, and capable of being scaled up at-will.
  3. I won't enforce draconian rule. You and I can have different opinions ğŸ™‚

Moderation/Policy

Please adhere to the rules. There aren't many.

There isn't a rigid content policy and this server doesn't have a particular focus, although I do mostly post about technology and my interests. Please don't break the law with what you post. I'm not perfect either so I'll try and be flexible.

I will vehemently defend your information and I'd rather pull the plug on this server and leave it an unintelligble pile of encrypted bits than hand it over to a three-letter agency.

  • I commit to providing at least three months notice if I ever intend to shut this server down in order to provide users sufficient time to offload accounts, data, and do so on.
  • My priorities are:
    1. To preserve your privacy,
    2. To administer the server equitably, and
    3. To ensure service reliability

Hosting

I'm hosting this instance on the cheap (technicall, it's free right now), but if you'd like to support me, I'll gladly accept. You can use the following methods:

BTC: bc1qha9fjyh0scjmgv26tqw0srfry0kuxyhhnpaecpdz4872wkn2aw2s2wty23

GitHub sponsors

Currently, I'm abusing taking advantage of public cloud free tiers! Which means that any support you provide is mostly to justify spending my time administering the instance (I'm donating my time but my normal consulting rates are pretty high ğŸ˜„).

Note: don't worry too much about reading into "running on a cloud free tier" to mean that I'm going to tear it down if things ever become expensive. I don't mind paying for a VPS and can always migrate if we need to.

Warrant Canary ğŸ¦œ

I have not been served with a secret government subpoena for any of my services. If this warrant canary is ever removed, users are to assume that I have indeed been served with a secret subpoena. The intention is to warn users of the existence of a subpoena passively, without disclosing to others that the government has sought or obtained access to information or records under a secret subpoena. Warrant canaries have been found to be legal by the United States Justice Department, so long as they are passive in their notifications.
Short: Typing ink on onto digital paper for distribution via digital pigeons.

Description:
NB: For tiden godtar vi ingen nye registreringer! Gjerne kom tilbake ved en senere anledning :)

Sosialist.party er gratis, men dersom du Ã¸nsker Ã¥ stÃ¸tte instansen, slik at eksistensen er sikra framover og at vi eventuelt kan utvide kapasiteten dersom behovet oppstÃ¥r har vi Ã¥pna for bÃ¥de medlemskap med mÃ¥nedlig trekk og Ã©ngangsdonasjoner pÃ¥ https://ko-fi.com/sosialistparty :) Dersom du velger et mÃ¥nedlig medlemskap, uansett hvilket, fÃ¥r du ogsÃ¥ tilgang til en liten Discord-server. Vi hÃ¥per at "yt etter evne, fÃ¥ etter behov" ogsÃ¥ kan bli et bÃ¦rekraftig prinsipp for oss :)

Velkommen til sosialist.party!

Dette er en norsk Mastodon-instans. Navnet sier sitt! Vi er i all hovedsak et sted for dem som fÃ¸ler seg hjemme pÃ¥ norsk venstreside. Definisjonen kan selvsagt strekkes langt, og ingen kommer til Ã¥ kreve muntlig eksamen i Maos lille rÃ¸de her.

Dette skal ikke bli et ideologisk ekkokammer, men et sted der vi alle kan trives! Kanskje til og med en forvirra Venstre-velger vil kunne finne sitt hjem her! Du trenger rett og slett ikke Ã¥ vÃ¦re med i et sosialistparti for Ã¥ kunne vÃ¦re et godt tilskudd pÃ¥ sosialistparty!

Ytringsfrihet schmytringsfrihet

Vi skal vÃ¦re et Ã¥pent og inkluderende nettsamfunn med rom for uenighet og gode diskusjoner, men det betyr slettes ikke at man kan ytre absolutt alt. Vi klargjÃ¸r dette mer tydelig i reglene - men hvis du skulle vÃ¦re ytringsfrihetsekstremist er sannsynligheten stor for at dette ikke er stedet for deg. Det finnes heldigvis mange andre instanser du kan sjekke ut!

Hvem styrer dette?

Instansen ble oppretta av @nrmn@sosialist.party. Du kan lese mer om Norman pÃ¥ nrmn.no. Alt som legges ut pÃ¥ @nrmn@sosialist.party er personlige standpunkt.

Det som kan sies Ã¥ vÃ¦re offisielle anliggender som angÃ¥r instansens drift vil legges ut pÃ¥ @formann_mjau@sosialist.party.

SprÃ¥k

Dette er en norsksprÃ¥klig instans. SelvfÃ¸lgelig er det ingen regler mot Ã¥ bruke andre sprÃ¥k. Mastodon-samfunnet er internasjonalt, og det vil det alltid vÃ¦re. Vi har dog et Ã¸nske om at norsk skal vÃ¦re hovedsprÃ¥ket du bruker her, helt uten at dette er en absolutt regel!

Hvordan funker dette her?

Mastodon er et desentralisert sosialt nettverk. Det bestÃ¥r av mange instanser (gjerne kall det servere eller nettsider om du synes det er lettere), som alle kan snakke med hverandre. Litt som epost. Du vil ogsÃ¥ se at brukernavnene ligner veldig pÃ¥ epost-adresser.

Dersom du Ã¸nsker Ã¥ fÃ¸lge noen trykker du deg enkelt inn pÃ¥ profilen deres og fÃ¸lger dem. Hvis du bare har brukernavnet deres (som for eksempel @formann_mjau@sosialist.party) kan du enkelt lime det inn i sÃ¸kefeltet og finne brukeren slik.

NÃ¥r du fÃ¸rst har registrert brukeren din er det forskjellige feeds som viser litt av hvert:

  • Home-feeden: Denne viser alt som blir delt av folkene du fÃ¸lger.

  • Den lokale feeden: Denne feeden viser alt som blir delt av brukerne som har konto pÃ¥ sosialist.party

  • Felles-feeden: Denne feeden viser grovt oppsummert alt som deles av folk pÃ¥ sosialist.party, i tillegg til alt som deles av folk pÃ¥ andre instanser, som blir fulgt av vÃ¥re brukere, altsÃ¥ alt som sosialist.party vet om at finnes pÃ¥ Mastodon. (Den viser litt mer enn det, men det er detaljer jeg skal spare dere for her!)

Du kan ogsÃ¥ sÃ¸ke pÃ¥ ulike hashtags. Hvis du for eksempel sÃ¸ker pÃ¥ #NorskTut, som er hashtaggen mange bruker for Ã¥ finne andre norske brukere, finner du alle innleggene som inneholder taggen og som vÃ¥r instans vet om. Jo flere brukere vi blir, og jo flere hver og en av oss fÃ¸lger, jo mer mangfoldig vil resultatene bli.

Hvordan finner jeg twittervennene mine?

  • Du kan bruke verktÃ¸yet Fedifinder til Ã¥ se om noen av de du fÃ¸lger eller som fÃ¸lger deg pÃ¥ Twitter har lagt til Mastodon-brukeren sin i bioen, navnet eller en pinna tweet.

  • @forteller@octodon.social tok initiativ til et dokument der Twitter-folk som Ã¸nsker Ã¥ bli funnet kan skrive inn Mastodon-brukeren sin! Dette finner du her. Gjerne skriv deg opp pÃ¥ lista og fÃ¸lg dem du vil fÃ¸lge :)

Viktig om personvern!

Akkurat som pÃ¥ Twitter og Facebook er private meldinger ikke ende-til-ende-kryptert pÃ¥ Mastodon. Du burde ikke bruke Facebook og Twitter til Ã¥ dele sensitiv informasjon pÃ¥ melding, og du burde ikke bruke Mastodon til Ã¥ dele sensitiv informasjon pÃ¥ direktemeldinger.

Hvis du Ã¸nsker Ã¥ sjekke ut trygge chatteapper og gjÃ¸re noe bra for bÃ¥de ditt og dine venners privatliv, sjekk ut Signal, Threema og Session. Alle har noen fordeler og ulemper, avhengig av smak og behag og hva man vil bruke dem til, men Signal har vÃ¦rt en god erstatning for bÃ¥de Messenger, SMS og facebook-eide WhatsApp for veldig mange! :)

Emojier

Vi har allerede lagt til en del emojier. Pride-flaggene (unntatt Progress-flagget som vi gjenskapte i samme stil) er tatt fra Mutant Standard og publisert under en Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 4.0-lisens.
Short: Sosialist.party er en norsk instans pÃ¥ Mastodon. Instansen er partipolitisk uavhengig, og alle som fÃ¸ler seg noenlunde mer eller mindre lÃ¸st tilhÃ¸rig pÃ¥ den norske venstresida er velkommen her.

Description:
Rules

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the discretion of the instance administrators. Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):

    • ethnicity, e.g. using slurs
    • gender identity or expression, e.g. deadnaming or intentional misgendering
      • sexual identity or expression
      • physical characteristics or age, e.g. "making fun" of somebodies appearance
      • disability or illness
      • nationality, residency, citizen status
      • lack of wealth or education
      • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
      • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
      • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
      • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
      • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
      • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
      • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
      • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.
      • We do not tolerate copaganda and will not allow law enforcement officers onto this instance.
      • All NSFW content needs to be CWed.
      • We do not tolerate brand or commercial accounts.

Imprint

E-Mail: root(at) trees (punkt) social
Adresse:
Andrej SchÃ¶ke
Postfach 20 01 07
69459 Weinheim

Description:
Code of Conduct

Our Pledge

In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, we as contributors and maintainers pledge to making participation in our project and our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity and expression, level of experience, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment include:

  • Using welcoming and inclusive language
  • Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
  • Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
  • Focusing on what is best for the community
  • Showing empathy towards other community members

Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include:

  • The use of sexualized language or imagery and unwelcome sexual attention or advances
  • Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
  • Public or private harassment
  • Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or electronic address, without explicit permission
  • Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting

Our Responsibilities

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable behavior and are expected to take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any instances of unacceptable behavior.

Project maintainers have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, or to ban temporarily or permanently any contributor for other behaviors that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.

Scope

This Code of Conduct applies both within project spaces and in public spaces when an individual is representing the project or its community. Examples of representing a project or community include using an official project e-mail address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed representative at an online or offline event. Representation of a project may be further defined and clarified by project maintainers.

Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be reported by contacting the project team at eugen@zeonfederated.com. The project team will review and investigate all complaints, and will respond in a way that it deems appropriate to the circumstances. The project team is obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident. Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately.

Project maintainers who do not follow or enforce the Code of Conduct in good faith may face temporary or permanent repercussions as determined by other members of the project's leadership.

Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 1.4, available at http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4
Short: An invite-only group of friends and friends of friends, managed by Brett Hutley and Helen Bucknall.

Description: Privately owned server, small user group, registration needs approval.

Code of Conduct

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of magnificentbeardsfan.club; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    x. Excessive advertising
    x. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    x. Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    x. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    x. Racism or advocation of racism
    x. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    x. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    x. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism

  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    x. Sexual depictions of children
    x. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    x. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

    1. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service.
      This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
      x. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
      x. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
      x. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

English

General

pets.contact is a Mastodon instance for all those who are looking for a digital home for their pets/animals.

The instance is operated by Ğ›Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸.

The server is hosted by Markus' company, weingaertner-it.de.

Donations

If you feel comfortable you are welcome to leave some change at Ko-fi or Liberapay.
You are also welcome to empty Ğ›Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸'s wish list.

Anything that comes in too much in donations will be passed on to an animal welfare organization/animal shelter or similar after a prior survey.

Rules

Post only pet/animal content and be excellent to each other.

Even if you are godparents of animals, you are welcome to register on the instance.
Animal welfare organizations and animal shelters are also welcome here.

But:
Since "Be excellent to each other" is much easier said than done, we have a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, and silencing or suspension of accounts, if problems persist. In particular, we do not tolerate:

  • Harrassment, stalking, doxxing
  • Racism, sexism, verbal abuse or advocation thereof
  • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
  • Violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  • Contacting people who made clear they want no contact. Dogpiling/brigading
  • Untagged sexual content, gore, or advertisement
  • Untagged, or automated, or excessive advertisement
  • Bots interacting with users without their explicit requests

Please report the behavior that bothers you to Luna v.d. kleinen Samtschnuten or Ğ›Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸.
That includes behaviour from other instances - we are very willing stop federating with asshole instances.

Based on the about of chaos.social available in their Github-repository.

Description:
The Oddly Influenced podcast is about playing with ideas from outside software and (optionally) asking how they could be applied to software development. If you like the podcast, I hope you'll like the community. If you don't like podcasts, but you read broadly, I hope you'll find things to read and talk about.

It's my hope people will read the Local timeline, where the discussion will happen, but you can also use it as your main Mastodon presence.

This server is administered by Brian Marick, who provides all the funding.

Registrations must be approved. Just show that you understand what this instance is about.

Thank you.

DCMA

If you believe this site contains material under your copyright, note that it is registered at dmca.copyright.gov. Please send notices to marick@exampler.com (preferred) or in writing to 913 W White, Champaign, IL, 61821, USA.

Privacy

Site usage by children
