Description:
The YSHI server is private and intended to serve our members and their guests.

The current admins are:

  • @owls@yshi.org
  • @infinityb@yshi.org

We want this to be a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

Information For Members

All YSHI members are entitled to an account here. To redeem this entitlement, you only need to ask. You may share the invite link with your associates.

Please be considerate of other fediverse citizens. Make use of content warnings & sensitive media flags for spoilers and other content people may not wish to see. Images for mature audiences are allowed, but people would like to have Mastodon open in public without needing to worry about whatâ€™s going to appear unprompted in front of coworkers, customers, or strangers.

Many of us are used to Twitter; this place is vastly different. Be mindful and stay open to feedback.

Governance

Members are invited to participate in the governance of the YSHI server. If you would like to develop policy, moderate, manage emojis, or host parts of the infrastructure: speak up!

Logs and Records

Please be mindful that your public posts will be cached by federated servers. Due to the nature of the fediverse, the YSHI server surrenders control of your content the minute it is sent to a remote follower or interacted with by a remote user.

Direct messages (DMs) are not encrypted and no measures are in place to hide them from server admins. YSHI admins can view all DMs sent or received by local users, and remote server admins can see the same when you interact with their users. The content of your DMs is not made easily-accessible to admins unless it is reported, but you should not consider DMs to be private.

Please exercise caution and refrain from sharing sensitive information that could harm you or others if it became public.

Data Retention

The server retains all content that passes through it, including direct messages and cached copies of remote users, posts, and related data. Access logs, including IP addresses, are retained indefintely for troubleshooting and capacity planning.

The YSHI Mastodon server is run in the US and therefore subject to subpoenas from US courts. Our logs may be subject to subpoena and could become public as part of legal proceedings.

Harassment

Harassment includes:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a personâ€™s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of â€œdeadâ€ or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behavior in spaces where theyâ€™re not appropriate
  • Simulated physical contact (e.g. textual descriptions like â€œhugâ€ or â€œbackrubâ€) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication

Reporting

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact the admins. They will respond as promptly as they can. Our admin team is small and aligned around North American timezones; we apologize if this causes delays in responding to reports.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person/server about whom weâ€™ve received harassment complaints or privately warn third parties about them. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Local users of the YSHI server that are asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a local user engages in harassing behavior, the admins may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from this server and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom weâ€™ve received complaints. And sanctions will extend to other other aspects of the YSHI operation.

Remote users are subject to the policies of their own server. Those policies may not be compatible with our own. Local users can report offending remote users, or their server, to the YSHI admins. We may may block the offending user at the server level, or choose to defederate with the offending server entirely.

Federation Policy

A list of filtered/blocked servers is available to our members, along with the rationale.

In general, servers that exhibit bad behaviour towards the YSHI instance or specific members will be actioned. The admin team may proactively defederate with servers known to be malicious or have policies and values too far out of alignment with our own.

Users on the YSHI instance may appeal a server block by talking to an admin. Appeals from outside the instance will be ignored.

Use of YSHI Data by Third Parties

Use of mastodon.yshi.org data for commercial purposes is only permitted by our registered users. Third parties are strictly prohibited from utilizing data via the API or through other means for commercial purposes.

The server will federate with other servers operated by commercial entities. We will proactively defederate when there is suspicion that a commercial entity is engaging in data harvesting, indexing, analysis, profiling, AI model training, or similar.

Researchers who wish to study mastodon.yshi.org or our users by collecting data using the API or through any other means that does not involve an â€œopt-inâ€ from individual users are strictly prohibited. A user opting-in to have their posts included in search indexes is not consent for inclusion in studies.

Credits and License

This code of conduct is based on Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy. We have adapted the Sample Slack Code of Conduct for our own use under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution License.

Description:
Welcome!

I don't get much traffic here but if you are reading this, thanks for stopping by! If you are new to Mastodon, check out this "Mastodon quick start guide" from the Join Mastodon blog.

Funding

This server is not explicitly funded but you can buy me a coffee, I guess.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

Please understand I have no interest in suppressing free speech. I also have no interest in hosting a platform for violence, hate or illegal content. If you don't like the rules please choose a different Mastodon server.
Short: A social platform tailored towards tech enthusiasts and multimedia content creators, however everyone is welcome!

Description:
Rules Â¶

"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators, as described in our Terms.

Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

  • We do not tolerate discriminatory behaviour and content promoting or advocating the oppression of members of marginalised groups. These groups may be characterised by any of the following (though this list is naturally incomplete):
    • ethnicity
    • gender identity or expression
    • sexual identity or expression
    • physical characteristics or age
    • disability or illness
    • nationality, residency, citizen status
    • wealth or education
    • religious affiliation, agnosticism or atheism
  • We do not tolerate threatening behaviour, stalking, and doxxing.
  • We do not tolerate harassment, including brigading, dogpiling, or any other form of contact with a user who has stated that they do not wish to be contacted.
  • We do not tolerate mobbing, including name-calling, intentional misgendering or deadnaming.
  • We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • We do not tolerate conspiracy narratives or other reactionary myths supporting or leading to the above-mentioned (and/or similar) behavior.
  • Actions intended to damage this instance or its performance may lead to immediate account suspension.
  • Content that is illegal in Germany will be deleted and may lead to immediate account suspension.


Best practices Â¶

The list below is a collection of behaviour that we expect to see from our users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and we will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post sexual content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("â€¦@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in our community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network. Thank you!)

I (@smoe) am maintaining this instance on my spare time, hardware and nerves. Don't push either of those.


Attribution Â¶

This text is copied from chaos.social and modified by replacing the maintainer and removing the ressources paragraph.

This text is free to be adapted and remixed under the terms of the CC-BY (Attribution 4.0 International) license.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

Code of Conduct

Encouraged Behavior

Here are some things we think will make everyone's experience of techdon.dev better, but these are only suggestions.

  • We encourage you to be welcoming of people with many backgrounds.
  • We encourage you to be kind, listen first, act second and do your best.
  • Please use content notes (or content warnings) liberally (at your discretion), particularly for:
    • Content that would be reasonably expected to be harmful to any group, particularly marginalized groups.
    • Includes flashing or rapidly changing images.
  • Your well-being is important. Filter, mute and block when needed.
  • DMs are not end-2-end encrypted. Please do not use DMs to send any confidential information that you won't be comfortable sharing with the system admins and moderators.
  • When sharing images, please provide alt-text.

Moderation

Violation of the rules of the server will result in removing of the content, in case of multiple violations the account will be disabled at discretion of the moderators.
Illegal Behaviour will be reported to the competent authorities and the account disabled.
Short: This is a small instance for all tech things, you are welcome to discuss all about creativity and building things!

Description: Pixels is an image sharing platform run by Heimdall. It's designed to be an ethical alternative to platforms like Instagram and Facebook, which prioritise profit over the mental health of users. Pixels doesn't use advertising, instead we rely on user donations to fund the platform. On top of that, we use a chronological feed with a focus on the people you follow, so that you can keep up to date with the thing you care about.
Short: Pixels is an image sharing platform by Heimdall, focused on privacy and sharing with friends.

Description:
This is a small, invite only server for freinds and family, run by @mhamiltonj.

Data Retention

This information is in addition to the general privacy policy published elsewhere on this site.

Media

Media posted by users on this server is retained indefinitly, until that user initiates deletion. Deleted media will be removed within 24hrs. Some copies may be retained beyond this period by our storage service provider (OVH Group SA), in line with their policies. Media forwarded to this server by the operation of the AcivityPub protocol, will be removed automatically, generally within 7 days. In addition to the primary application server in Nuremberg, Germany, media is stored in datacenters in Frankfurt, Germany.

Profile information, posts

Users' profile data, posts and related metadata is retained indefinitly, until that user initiates deletion. The primary storage location for this information is Nuremberg, Germany. Copies of such data may also be stored in database backups in Grevelines, France, for upto 90 days after it's removal from the primary database.
Short: This is a small, invite only server for freinds and family, run by @mhamiltonj
The social network of the future: No ads, no corporate surveillance, ethical design, and decentralization! Own your data with Companies.Social!

Description:
Hello, and welcome to the General Chat's Mastodon server!

This is essentially a private instance for members of the General Chat Discord server - and their friends. For information on the General Chat, scroll down to General Chat History.

As we know and trust all our users, we moderate ourselves - therefore any rules we list are generally for the benefit of visitors to the instance - including admins and moderators of other instances. For clarification on a rule, comments on missing rules, or concerns about our users, please get in contact with Splatsune.

Currently, The General Chat's domain hosting and services is paid for out-of-pocket by Splatsune (with the exception of our Minecraft server, which is/was maintained by Vidvisionify). At this time there is no way to donate to keep the server running.

General Chat History

(Currently incomplete.)

The history of The General Chat begins at a quaint little site for Flash animation and comics called Porplemontage Studios (archive.org), from roughly 2005-2008. While not the birth of the Chat, some of its members first met there through making and sharing their creative projects, and chatting on its phpBB message board (archive.org).

In addition to the message board, in the later years of Porplemontage Studios there was also a Skype group chatroom where some of the creators and regulars gathered. Skype would remain the preferred gathering place for the proto-General Chat as its members eventually moved from Porplemontage Studios to ___ and then mindStage.

The first true General Chat began around the formation of The Layabouts. (TBC)
Short: We are the General Chat, a long-running private community of friends (and friends of friends) going back to the days of phpBB message boards.
Memes. Games. Kawaii.

Description:
This is currently not a completely open-registration server

Submit a request to join and include a reason. Are you an acquaintance of mine? Are you local? Do you like the same junk I do?

If you're new to Mastodon and are using the official mobile app, highly consider using an alternative mobile app or the actual web site. The "Federated" feed is an excellent way to discover new users and posts and is not available in the official mobile app. Ice Cubes on iOS is a good one and open-source.

Also I'd recommend going into Preferences->Other and setting the language filter so you don't see a lot of posts in languages you don't understand.

For more information about this platform, see https://joinmastodon.org. It is a free, open-source decentralized social media platform.
Short: Located in sunny Arizona, USA for locals, friends and family.

Description: Our goal as a community is to be an inclusive and safe place for furries to gather on the internet. This lends the unique opertunity for us to build out our game servers, social platforms, and all you see here, in the name of having a free inclusive and safe place to simply exist on the internet and have fun. If you want to be part of our community, we welcome you with open arms and the same goes for if you want to volunteer and help out! All staff members are community members who volunteer to lead and help our community. Sometimes this means helping write code, or maintaning a game server, or even moderating chats. There are many things we do at Furry Refuge to cultivate an amazing community, but the reason is always the same. Community is everything and we want you to feel at home here!
Short: A gateway to the Fediverse and social media platform for the Furry Refuge community! Meet Up, Game On, Chill Out!

Description:
This server is operated and owned by the Heimdall Intranet project, with support from the UNSW Queer Collective, to provide a safe space online for queer people away from the Big Tech platforms, which have a track record of lax privacy and security. Additionally, we're focused on promoting queer creators and activists, using our connections in industry and online to bring attention to Australian queer issues.

We have an Open Collective page if you'd like to contribute to server costs.

If you'd like to join the moderation team, please fill out this form.
Short: This server is for LGBTQIA+ people in Australia (although anyone is welcome to join), focused on highlighting queer issues and promoting queer voices in the Fediverse space.

OSINT tools to archive, document and debunk the Russian War against Ukraine This project is a Telegram Archive, a News aggregator & publishing engine designed to support Ukraine and keep Ukraine information in the News cycle.

To eliminate the language barrier issue as much as possible with the current state of machine translation,

I still remember 2014 and how the invasion of Crimea & Donbass left Ukraine voiceless.

Provide a solution for newsrooms, journalists, activists and basically everyone to have an easier access to this information for certainly, one of the defining moment of our generation in Europe and the global impact the War on Ukraine unleashed.

Hunt for Russian Disinformation narratives and war crimes with the intent to archive it outside big platforms

Find intelligence signal in the ongoing cyberwar leaks and operations to disrupt Putin and the system he controls to wage war on Ukraine.

Pressure European capitals to not concede a pre-cooked defeat with Putin at the cost of Ukraine integrity.

Pressure Western Governments to actually deliver their Help to Ukraine

Boycott Amnesty International until the organization retract the â€œreportâ€ and formally apologies to Ukraine.

Put the Media under pressure for not covering Ukraine, putting constantly the aggressor propaganda instead of the impact of the war against Ukraine.

Pressure Western Governments and allies to Officially designate Russia as a Terrorist State.

Weapons for Ukraine because a genocidal war from a Terrorist State does not get stopped by wishful thinking for peace.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

Welcome to mel.social ğŸ‰

A budding Mastodon instance for residents, friends and fans of Melbourne.

Follow @admin for server news, status updates, planned downtimes, etc. DM is currently the preferred method of communication with the staff.

Note that this is a public server and you shouldn't use it to share private information. If you need to send private messages, please consider using an encrypted messenger like Signal.

Eligibility

  • You must be aged 18 years or older to register for an account.
  • Brands/businesses accounts are not permitted at this time.
  • Bot accounts or automated posting accounts are not permitted.

We reserve the right to refuse or revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Code of Conduct

The following types of content and conduct will result in removal, account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

  • Content that is illegal in Australia or the United States of America.
  • Nude or pornographic images, or other content that would be considered "18+" or "adult" by a reasonable person under Australian law.
  • Gore or extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions.
  • Content that is harmful to the public good, such as incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies, antivax or climate denial.
  • Content that reinforce or advocate social structures of domination related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, religion (or lack thereof)
  • Promotion or encouragement of suicide or self-harm.
  • Stalking, including advocating any physical, sexual, or emotional harm against individuals or groups.
  • Harassment or bullying of any kind, including consistent baiting, bad faith gaslighting, unwanted sexual advances, etc.
  • Unauthorised distribution of any personal information or data (DOXing).
  • Impersonating individuals, groups, or organisations in a manner that is intended to or does mislead, confuse, or deceive others.
  • Any conduct intended to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed.
  • Promotion of scams, including web3/crypto and other ponzi schemes.
  • Excessive advertising or promotion

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:

  • Content promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
  • Holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism, or similar content illegal in the state of Victoria, Australia or in the European Union.
  • Violence: You may not make specific threats of violence or wish for the serious physical harm, death, or disease of an individual or group of people. This includes, but is not limited to, threatening or promoting terrorism. You also may not affiliate with organisations that â€” whether by their own statements or activity both on and off the platform â€” use or promote violence against civilians to further their causes.
  • Child exploitation: You may not post (or promote) suggestive depictions of children in any way (regardless of context). Example: No bath photos

mel.social is a privately-operated space, and membership is not a right. The administrator has discretion to suspend or refuse membership without providing grounds. The administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
Short: A very livable Mastodon instance for residents, friends and fans of Melbourne Australia.

Description:
This instance is run by me, Thomas Preece, as a home for my own personal account and accounts relating to my various projects and bots. As registration is not open to other users on this instance, I am personally responsible for all accounts on this instance.

I have specified a basic code of conduct in the server rules below. These are based on the rules from several popular servers and should represent reasonable fediverse norms. If you think I've missed anything, please let me know. As I am responsible for every account on this instance, it is really on my own honour that these rules are followed - but I don't expect ever to come even close to violating any of them. If for some reason I ever do, please call me out on it. If I don't respond to that, please block me or defederate.

Please be aware that the texts used by the @cowsay bot come from a standard database; I have looked through and excluded categories of sayings that are obviously less appropriate, but I haven't vetted every single saying personally. Any that do turn out to be inappropriate will be deleted after posting at the first opportunity.

Description:
Welkom op de instance van Sargasso! Het staat je vrij om een account aan te maken, maar we verwachten daarvoor - indien je dat kan betalen - wel een maandelijkse bijdrage. Klik hier voor de details.

Sargasso bestaat sinds 2001 en is daarmee Ã©Ã©n van de oudste weblogs in Nederland. In de rijke historie van Sargasso vind je onder meer de introductie van het liveblog in Nederland, het munten van de term reaguurder, het op de kaart zetten van datajournalistiek, de strijd voor meer transparantie in het openbaar bestuur (getuige de vele Wob-procedures die Sargasso gevoerd heeft) en de jaarlijkse uitreiking van de Gouden Hockeystick voor de klimaatontkenner van het jaar. Je kunt onze geschiedenis hier bekijken.

Platform Als rode draad door het bestaan van Sargasso loopt de overtuiging dat bloggers en lezers elkaar aanvullen en versterken. Het is onze missie om een laagdrempelig platform te creÃ«ren waarop mensen kunnen publiceren, reageren en discussiÃ«ren.

Onze bloggers nemen het nieuws door en ontleden het, lezers reageren daarop, wat weer kan leiden tot nieuwe ideeÃ«n en artikelen. Zo onderzocht Sargasso met hulp van tientallen vrijwilligers het cameratoezicht in Nederland.

Community Sargasso is niet alleen platform voor discussie, maar ook een community van gelijkgestemde mensen.Â  Sargasso heeft een progressieve signatuur, maar is niet dogmatisch. We zijn onbeschaamd intellectueel en kosmopolitisch, maar tegelijkertijd hopeloos genuanceerd. Dat betekent dat we de wereld vanuit een bepaald perspectief bezien, maar openstaan voor andere zienswijzen.

Ieder lid van de community draagt op zijn eigen manier bij aan het voortbestaan van Sargasso. Of dat nou is door te schrijven, te reageren of te doneren.

Doneer De redactie van Sargasso bestaat uit een club vrijwilligers. In 2011 kregen we een eenmalige subsidie van het Stimuleringsfonds voor de Pers. Inmiddels draaien we volledig op donaties. Lees meer over hoe je kunt bijdragen om Sargasso te ondersteunen.

Lees meer Geschiedenis van Sargasso Aanmelden als blogger Privacy/Cookies Huisregels Gastbijdragen
Short: Sargasso is een community van gelijkgestemde mensen en heeft een progressieve signatuur, maar is niet dogmatisch. Onbeschaamd intellectueel en kosmopolitisch, maar tegelijkertijd hopeloos genuanceerd.

Description: Dilavni Social

1in1.net Mastodon

Welcome to the Mastodon instance of 1in1.net. We are a small community of friends, who like to self-host our services.

Who is in charge?

This service is administrated by Kevin Kandlbinder.

Rules

The current rules (may change later). If you find any content on this instance you feel violates any rules, please contact @kevin@1in1.net on Mastodon or send a mail to kevin[at]1in1.net.

  • Strictly no trans-, homo- and queerphobia, racism, sexism, or xenophobia.
  • No sexualization of minors (including, but not limited to, images and text)
  • No harassment of other users (including those on remote instances)
  • No spam
  • No bots without talking to an admin first
  • Don't be an asshole
  • No untagged NSFW/NSFL

Guidelines

The guidelines outline the best possible behaviour, please try to follow them as best as you can.

  • Tag anything that might make people uncomfortable with a CW (Content Warning), so everyone can choose what they see
Short: Just a small private server.

Description:
Sharebright!

A non-public social network for people who know about it. If you know somebody on Sharebright, feel free to register and tell us how you know them. Some people may even receive invitations.

By keeping the Sharebright community down to a smaller number of people, all of whom know each other, we can more effectively keep the content safe for everybody. Please see The Rules for more details, but basically: behave yourself and keep it clean so we can all enjoy Sharebright. Moderators will be actively ensuring the quality of content.

The Rules

Sharebright is a safe place for all of its members. Moderators will respond to infractions with removal of content and a possible ban. Possibly permanent.

  • Please avoid profanity.
  • No sexually explicit content.
  • No politics.
Short: A non-public social network for people who know about it. Sign up! Tell us who you are! We might let you in!

Description:
Welcome!

Mastodon is a new adventure for all of us. If you're a Twitter refugee, be warned that it's a bit different around here. This service encourages users to engage in friendly conversations and share information. Think of it as a town square filled with polite neighbors, not a big, noisy city boulevard overrun by aggressive drivers.

The admin and creator of Hypermute is @mechaneyes, and @humthrush is the moderator. Please reach out to us if you have questions, wonder what this Mastodon thing is all about, or just want to say hi.

Have fun!
Short:
We always find something, eh Didi, to give us the impression we exist?

Hypermute is currently a closed server as we learn how to scale it.

Description:
oldfriends.live is a small specialty server with a few accounts, currently invite only, and runs on the Mastodon open-source platform. We are fully federated and connected to the over ten million, and growing, people on the #fediverse that you can follow and interact with.

Due to Ohioâ€™s Parental Notification by Social Media Operators Act, Ohio Revised Code 1349.09, no one ages 16 years old and under is permitted to have an account on OldFriends.Live and none do. https://codes.ohio.gov/ohio-revised-code/section-1349.09

We're home of the popular 9 o'clock HashTagGames. One new hashtag game every day at 9PM EST, (6PM PT / 2AM BST / 3AM CEST / 11AM AEST / 1PM NZST). We encourage all users to add #HashTagGames to every game play so non-players can mute new daily games in their filters instead of muting every new game.

Social networking, back in your hands!

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmicâ€”you decide who you want to see!

Be sure to check our Terms & Code of Conduct.

How To Send Us a DMCA Takedown Notice

Question: How do I send a DMCA notice to get infringing material taken down from oldfriends.live?

Answer: You may send a DMCA notice to DMCA@oldfriends.live. Your DMCA notice should:

*include your signature or the signature of a person authorized to act on your behalf (your â€œagentâ€) (the signature can be either physical or electronic); *identify the copyrighted work that is being infringed; *identify the activity that is infringing and information reasonably sufficient to permit the service provider to locate the infringing activity on its site; *include your email address and any other information to allow the service provider to contact you or your agent directly; *include a statement that your or your agent has a good faith belief that the activity is unauthorized; and *include a statement that the information in the notice is accurate and, under penalty of perjury, that your agent is authorized to act on your behalf.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Federated Community

This service is community driven and runs on the Mastodon open-source platform. We're fully federated and connected to the over seven million other people on the #fediverse.

Security

Backed up locally and offsite https everywhere

Please note: It is important that you protect your account with 2factor authentication. You can set this up after you register. Direct Messages (DMs) - These are just direct "toots" - They are not encrypted. Please only use DMs to send anything you just don't want broadcasted but is not confidential. (The developers are exploring end to end encryption here)

Welcome to the #fediverse
Short: A place where old friends can meet in the Fediverse! Home of the popular 9 o'clock #HashTagGames. Specialty server, invite only at this time.

Moderated by the team at AGiLE ANiMAL, INC.

Registrations must be approved by the team but all are welcome.

We started this instance to try to keep a manageable local timeline that would be interesting to us and our friends.

Nothing harmful, hateful, or illegal will be tolerated.

If you're into technology, software development, devops, elixir, phoenix, iOS apps, or similar, this is probably a good place to call home.
Short: Moderated by the team at AGiLE ANiMAL INC (AAI). This is a programming (Elixir/Phoenix) focussed instance but all are welcome. Nothing harmful, hateful, or illegal will be tolerated.

Description:
Welcome to psu.social

This is an independently-operated site focused on the Penn State community, both in Pennsylvania and beyond. Registration is open.

About

The intent of this Mastodon server is to build a network of people with some connection, interest, or support for Penn State University. This spans any use case from academic to research to topical collaborations to the very best collegiate sports teams in America.

There is no monetization model, we don't sell your information, and we don't advertise to you. A detailed privacy policy stating this is available here.

Staff

The site operators are @rob and @cyn. You can also email sysadmin@psu.social for help or questions.

Tech Information & Details

The server is hosted in Los Angeles, California.

  • "Bare metal" 64-bit ARM server
  • 16 dedicated CPUs
  • 64GB memory
  • 6TB local disk storage
  • Cloudflare for security and acceleration
  • AuthSMTP for email delivery
  • Permanent status page at Railgun

This site is committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant. In a nutshell, this means:

  • We will actively moderate against racism, sexism, homophobia, and transphobia.
  • We maintain daily backups.
  • At least one other person has emergency access to our infrastructure.
  • A minimum of 3 months of warning will be provided should we ever shut down the site.

Donations

This site is operated and paid for by Robert Brown, via our husband/wife California small business Chic 42 Enterprises. We plan to continue to support it financially and otherwise indefinitely.

We are not seeking contributions, but if you would like to give back we would appreciate donations to the Robert J. Brown Award for Excellence in Finance. This is a scholarship established in memory of your site operator's father Dr. Robert J. Brown, a long-time professor at Penn State Harrisburg.

Moderated Servers

Mastodon generally allows you to view content and interact with users from any other server in the "fediverse". Exceptions and blocked sites will be listed towards the bottom of this page, and at this early state there are no blocks in place.

DMCA Policy

The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA), and specifically the provisions located at 17 USC 512, set forth the steps an online service provider such as psu.social must follow in the event of copyright infringement on their servers.

Notification of Infringement

If you believe that someone on psu.social has violated your copyright, you may send us a Notification of Copyright Infringement. For us to process such a notification, it must substantially comply with the requirements set forth in United States law. To speed our handling of your notification, please make sure it complies with the following criteria:

  • Notifications may be submitted to our Registered Agent in one of two ways. You may send it via email (no attachments, please) to sysadmin@psu.social, or you may send it via physical mail to 1223 Wilshire Blvd #213, Santa Monica, CA 90403. We prefer to receive notification via email.
  • Notifications must be signed by the copyright holder or the copyright holder's designated agent. Signatures may be a physical signature or a digital signature in a recognized industry-standard format such as PGP. Unsigned notifications will not be processed.
  • Notifications must specifically identify the copyrighted work being infringed upon. For instance, if the work is a published book, provide the title, author, and ISBN; if the work is a magazine article, provide the title, author, magazine name, and magazine issue; if the work is available on the Internet, provide the URL of the work.
  • Notifications must specifically include the URL where the work is being infringed upon our servers. For us to be able to reasonably identify the material, you must provide us with the complete URL, not a link to the entire journal. For instance, instead of https://psu.social (a link to the entire journal), provide https://psu.social/123.html (a link to the specific entry).
  • Notifications must include sufficient information for us to contact you, including your address, your telephone number, and your email address.
  • Notifications must contain a statement that you have a good faith belief that the use of the material in this manner is not authorized by the copyright owner(s), their agent, or the law.
  • Notifications must contain a statement that the information in the notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, that you are authorized to act on behalf of the owner of the copyright that is allegedly being infringed.

Takedown Process

When we receive a properly-formatted notice of copyright infringement, we will forward it to the account owner and provide a limited amount of time to disable access to the allegedly-infringing content.

If you have received this notice from us, this disabling can generally be done in one of two ways: you can delete the entry, comment, or image in question, or you can allow us to set the entry, comment, or image in question to non-viewable. Setting an entry's security to Private or screening a comment is not sufficient to qualify as 'disabling access' under the law, as this can be undone at any time.

If we do not hear back from you with information about which option you'd prefer within the length of time we provide for you to select an option (usually between 24-48 hours), we will assume that you would like for us to set the entry, comment, or image in question to be non-viewable, and we will do so. This will not affect the rest of your account.

You then have one of three choices:

  • You can accept the allegation of infringement, and state that you will not restore the content, file a counter-notification, or make further infringement upon the work in the future. If you choose to do this, you must delete the entry, comment, or image, if you have not already done so. This will count against you for determination of 'repeat offender' status. If you do not reply to any of our contact about an alleged infringement within 10 days of our forwarding the notification, we must assume that you have chosen this option.
  • You can state that you do not accept the allegation of infringement, but you do not want to file a counter-notification or have us restore access to the allegedly-infringing content. If you choose to do this, we will not restore access to the entry, comment, or image. This will not affect the rest of your account. This will not count against you for determination of 'repeat offender' status.
  • You can state that you do not accept the allegation of infringement, and let us know that you want to file a counter-notification under the provisions of law. If you choose to do this, please see the section below. This will not count against you for determination of 'repeat offender' status.

If you have received a notice of alleged infringement, you may not re-upload or re-post the allegedly-infringing material, unless you have gone through the counter-notification process. This applies whether you have deleted the material yourself, or you have chosen to allow us to disable access to the material. If you do re-upload or re-post the material, we will be forced to entirely disable your account.

Counter Notification

A counter-notification is a statement, under the provisions of 17 USC 512(g)(3), that you do not believe your content infringes on another person's rights, or that your use of another person's copyrighted material falls into one of the protected categories under law.

By filing a counter-notification, you are indicating that you are willing to defend your use of the material in court, if the copyright owner chooses to bring a lawsuit against you for your use of the material. This may involve civil and/or criminal penalties. We strongly suggest you contact an intellectual property lawyer licensed to practice law in your jurisdiction before you do this, so that you are aware of your rights and obligations under the law.

There are groups that may help you understand your rights and obligations, including the Chilling Effects Clearinghouse, the Electronic Frontier Foundation, and the Organization for Transformative Works. We are not affiliated with any of these organizations, and they may not be able to help you, but their mission and mandate involves educating people about their rights and obligations under intellectual property law.

A counter-notification must contain the following items:

  • Your signature. Signatures may be a physical signature or a digital signature in a recognized industry-standard format such as PGP.
  • The URL of your entry, comment, or image that has been called into question. A statement, under penalty of perjury, that you have a good faith belief that the material was removed or disabled as a result of mistake or misidentification of the material. This should include any reasons why you believe your use of the material is not infringing.
  • Your name, address, and telephone number.
  • A statement that you consent to the jurisdiction of Federal District Court where you reside, or (if you live outside the United States) that you consent to the jurisdiction of Federal District Court where Chic 42 Enterprises, Inc. is located (currently Santa Monica, CA).
  • A statement that you will accept service of process from the person who provided notification of infringement, or that person's designated agent.

Your counter-notification will be provided, in its entirety, to the person who provided notification of alleged infringement.

Restoration Process

When we receive a counter-notification, we will forward it to the person who made the original notification of alleged infringement. From that point, the original notifier has 10 business days after receiving the counter-notification to file an action in court, seeking an injunction against the use of that material.

If you have provided us with a notification of infringement, and the user of our service has chosen to file counter-notification, you must inform us that you have filed court action no more than 14 days after we forward the counter-notification to you. If you do not, we will re-enable access to the allegedly-infringing material no less than 10 days, and no more than 14 days, after we forward the counter-notification.

If you have received a notification of infringement, and you have provided us with your counter-notification, we will re-enable access to the allegedly-infringing material, or let you know that you can re-post the allegedly-infringing material, no less than 10 days, and no more than 14 days, after we have forwarded your counter-notification to the original notifier.

If you have filed a counter-notification, you can not re-upload or re-post the allegedly-infringing material until we notify you that the waiting period has expired. If you do, we will be forced to entirely disable your account during that time period.

Repeat Offenses

US law requires us to disable the accounts of repeat offenders of others' copyright. What constitutes a repeat offender is not defined by law.

We currently define a repeat offender as anyone who has received five valid notifications of copyright infringement. Instances where you have filed a counter-notification, or instances where you have indicated that you do not accept the allegation of copyright infringement but do not wish to file a counter-notification, will not count against your account for purposes of determining 'repeat offender' status. We reserve the right to alter this definition in the future, at our sole discretion.

We also reserve the right to terminate the accounts of those who, in our opinion, misuse or abuse the DMCA notification process against other users.

Description:
We're a small group of friends and friend of friends using mastodon wanting a stable, fast & transparent instance. As of writing, we have a 99.88% uptime

Moderation policy

As we're a small instance, We do not feel the need for a complete Code of Conduct or a complete definition and expanded list of rules.

If the rules are not clear, please ask us. We will be happy to explain them to you. We will also be happy to explain why we have chosen to enforce them.

As well, If the need arises, we will define a more complete Code of Conduct and rules.

Local accounts

Local users have to abide by our rules, failure to do so might result in moderation actions. The severity of the action depends on the severity of the rule broken. For example, Posting illegal content will result in a ban, while posting a NSFW image without a CW will result in temporary forced sensitive marking.

Federated accounts

Federated accounts are moderated slightly differently, as we have less tools for those. Initially, our moderation policy is to: Mark sensitive > Limit > Suspend. If reasonable percentage of the accounts of a instance is moderated, We will look into applying moderation to the instance itself.

Exceptions

Things will always be a bit complicated, and we will always try to be reasonable and fair. We reserve the right to skip moderation steps if we feel it is appropriate.

Transparency

We try to be as transparent as possible, and will always try to explain our moderation actions. If you feel we have been unfair, please contact @beep. We are always open to discussion, and will always try to be reasonable.

Expected response times

We will try to respond to moderation requests as soon as possible, but we are all volunteers, and we have lives outside of this instance. We will try to respond within 24 hours, but we can't guarantee it. Feel free to ping us if you feel we have been too slow, We love to work with other instances.

Extra Credit

This is the shilling corner, Here I shill other companies that I use for things

Description:
Hello! Thank you for visiting our Mastodon instance :)

About

This instance is part of goose.rodeo and you need to be a member to be able to sign in to it. goose.rodeo aims at building and maintaining a community where everyone feels comfortable. In order to achieve this goal, we have decided to limit our registrations to invite-only. This means that in order to be able to join, you first need to find a current goose.rodeo member who is willing to invite you.

Rules

We aren't a "free speech zone" where you're free to disrespect and discriminate others - we firmly believe in inclusivity and basic common sense. We enforce a basic set of rules to aid us in this purpose.

Please note that in the end every dispute will be handled on a case-by-case basis. If you do not understand why you got punished for an action, feel free to ask and/or create an appeal!

To other instance admins

We are always open to communications! If you encounter issues with accounts hosted on our instance, please contact us. We do our best to ensure that we don't cause any issues or increased moderation demands on other instances, but it is possible for some things to slip through. We are sorry about potential inconveniences caused by us!

You can reach us by messaging @gus, @lus or @max or by sending an email to hi@kas.lu.

Credits

Parts of our instance were inspired by the cool people at chaos.social.
Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

Description:
About the server

Run by Tillwoofie, currently hosted in Canada.

Running on 3 servers:

  • 1 Proxy machine (1 shared core, 1GB memory)
  • 1 App machine (1 shared core, 2GB memory)
  • 1 DB machine (1 shared core, 2GB memory)

It is currently not a high-performance or high-storage infrastructure, so it may occasionally have issues. I am reachable by the same username most places if there are issues. It will be upgraded and scaled as required, which may occasionally introduce issues, but I can work through them.

Backups will be added soon.

Joining

If you would like to join the server, please apply, and I will look over your application.

Content policy

Content following the rules will stay up, unless you elect to (re)move it. Content not meeting the rules will receive warnings, and severe content infractions may result in total removal (these will get warnings first).

Repeat issues may result in the account in question being removed from this instance.

Server roles

Admins

  • @Tillwoofie

Moderators

  • Will be added when needed.

Official Accounts

  • @Tillwoofie for now, may add more the future.

  • Gehen Sie aufeinander ein, auch wenn Sie unterschiedliche Meinungen haben. Pflegen Sie auch bei unterschiedlichen Sichtweisen immer einen freundlichen und respektvollen Umgangston. Beachten Sie, dass sich Ironie, Sarkasmus oder Ã¤hnliche Ausdrucksweisen nicht gut in die Schriftsprache Ã¼bertragen lassen und dazu neigen, Diskussionen oder MissverstÃ¤ndnisse zu eskalieren.

Dazu gehÃ¶rt die groÃŸzÃ¼gige Verwendung von Inhaltswarnungen (insbesondere bei potenziell beunruhigenden oder kontroversen Themen) und die Angabe von Untertiteln bei Mediendateien.

Description: Yet another personal mastodon instance.

Privacy

All social media platforms require some data storage, and Mastodon is no exception. However, with more people switching to Mastodon from Twitter, it's important to note some of the privacy concerns. The main concern is that private messages are stored. This is necessary to enable conversations, but it's important to recognize that the operators of the server, as well as any receiving server, may be able to view such messages. Additionally, recipients may screenshot, copy or otherwise share them.

As Mastodon's privacy policy indicates, there are some instances where privacy may be compromised. Some media outlets have used this as an argument against Mastodon, but the level of privacy depends on the instance you use. At billys.mom, we take privacy seriously and only read personal messages if they are reported by a user or if law enforcement issues a reasonable notice.

Can I trust billys.mom?

As with any Mastodon instance, we cannot guarantee 100% privacy. You should always be cautious about what you share on any website. However, we are committed to privacy and will not engage in voluntary surveillance programs. Moreover, governments cannot legally force services to implement blanket spying programs.

If you want to ensure a higher level of privacy, use PGP.

Status

To view the status of billys.mom, please visit status.billys.mom.

Staff

Our moderators and administrators are volunteers who dedicate their spare time to managing the platform and enforcing the rules when necessary. If you would like to support a specific staff member, please reach out to them directly.

Donations

While billys.mom is and will always be free, hosting the platform comes with costs. As such, any donations are greatly appreciated. Even a small amount can make a difference. To donate, please visit me on Liberapay.
Short: Billy's Mom, an privacy-focused instance hosted by Billy (not his mom).

Description:
Kaisendon is the mastodon instance dedicated for TPC3 user communications.
Currently experimental, so don't expect 24/7 availability (no SLAs!).

This instance is only intended for internal communication so I STRONGLY recommend you to create account on other instance if you want to do some public postings or use mastodon as daily driver.

For TPC3 members: accounts are only provided when you invited. Contact me for more info.

Administrative notifications like maintenance schedules may provided in discord server OR @h2yk.
If you have any questions...etc, feel free to contact us!

Short: A mastodon instance for decent, smart people. No restrictions aside from a total ban on political conspiracy-theory nut-jobs. (Sorry, that may exclude an entire party.)

The official Mastodon server for At the Tavern

Description:
Welcome to Snowmansland!

Do you want to build a snowman?

About

We're here for all, who like it cold... or warm in a cozy hut. For fans of hot chocolate (or tea/coffee), hot baths or hot springs. If you like Ice and Snow... bad puns or a new story to tell: You're welcome!

Languages: Mostly Ger/Eng
Please read the Server-Rules first, so you'll know what you get! If you have any Problems, Bugs and Complaints, please let me know! We have Daily Database backups!

Disclaimer

This instance currently is open for registration on a approval-basis!

I will open or limit registration again if I see fit. I want to grow this place as organically as possible. While keeping everything manageable.

To Imprint, Terms of Use and Privacy Policy (English-only- German Version is in build)

Rules

  1. Be yourself, but stay decent and mindful towards others!
  2. The Netiquette exits! Please look it up!
  3. Please do these elsewhere:
    • Sensitive content without CWs (Examples: Violence, Trauma, ...).
    • Sexual content in general. There are more suitable instances for this.
    • Hate-Speech, including derogatory use of language for Hate-Speech purposes.
    • Harassing or threatening users in any form (including DMs).
    • Promoting Violence or self-harm
    • Trolling
    • Aggressive advertising
  4. Please leave your Twitter-Snark at the doormat.
  5. Make use of CWs for context clues, whenever useful. You'll lose nothing by being helpful to others and respecting their boundaries!
  6. Use image descriptions whenever possible. They hurt nobody.
  7. When Interacting with users from other instances, their Server rules apply in addition to ours. It's basically like visiting other peoples' homes.
  8. If you have a problem, don't hesitate to contact a Mod or Admin. You don't have to solve it alone!
  9. "Take care of yourself! And be well!" - (Dr. Bernard - "Chubbyemu")

Resources

Blocking Lists

None, Only manual Blocks/Mutes at the moment. (Blocklists or similar might be used when found useful)

Artwork/Banner/Emojis

Emojis:

  • Blobhaj by @heatherhorns@plush.city (CC BY-SA 4.0)
  • Blobcat (citation needed!)
  • Sources for misc Emojis?!?!?

Artworks:

  • Banner: Snowy Plains by @Weirdaholic@snowmans.land (CC BY-NC-SA 3.0)

Things, that have to be implemented

  • DSGVO/DSA Compliance
    • Updating the Privacy-Policy(!!!),
    • reconfiguring Data Storage (eventually changing Storage Server Provider) to be better compliant with the European GDPR.
Short:
A lonely checkpoint in the middle of nowhere. A place to rest.
Maybe a place for new stories to share?
Who knows?
Building a hut in the middle of nowhere maybe wasn't a mistake after all...

Description:
Goals

Our goal is to provide a friendly space for people who love FFXIV and want to show that with the Fediverse.

We want members to be able to share their adventures and congratulate/encourage others.

This is by no means a FFXIV-only instance! Feel free to share your real life adventures as well if you feel comfortable doing so, and anything else that brings you joy (other games, movies, books, crafts, etc!).

If you'd like to join a larger general gaming instance, mstdn.games is run by some great people!

Server Info

Currently invite-only to ensure server performance remains stable. Feel free to request an invite if you're looking for an instance to join and you identify as a fellow Eorzean.

Instance currently running on a Linode 2GB vm and I'm closely monitoring performance/capacity to migrate to a larger instance when necessary.

Monthly costs are currently only $12.50/month so I'm happy covering everything for now. I'll let you all know if we ever open up donations so anyone can chip in.

Always open to suggestions/ideas/feedback/etc!

Contact

  • Kadaan Wroth@Gilgamesh
  • Discord: Kadaan#1605
  • ğŸ“§kadaan@eorzea.social

      • Server status page: https://status.eorzea.social
Short: Small cozy instance for Warriors of Light who spend way too much time in Final Fantasy XIV. If this sounds like you, feel free to sign up and join us!

Description:
Weâ€™re a general server thatâ€™s invite only.

Social media is just enough human contact to push off a constant feeling of disconnection. But it will never fully address our existential loneliness, boredom, and dread*. We are isolated and floating around in a sea of disingenuous bullshit. Connection comes through vulnerability and weâ€™re so afraid of being vulnerable we canâ€™t even stand to show strangers the texture of our skin. Social media objectifies us. Our likes, web history, purchases, psychological profiles, attention, etc. are a commodity. Our information is used to manipulate us into bizarre beliefs, consumerism, and discontent. No wonder depression is on the rise. All this doom and gloom leads me to ask, are we social?

*Ok, I do believe that people can form genuine connection over the internet but it usually takes more effort that casual scrolling.
Short: This is a general server for our friends.

Kulturfront drivs av ett kollektiv av demokratiska socialister, fackmÃ¤n och andra aktiva i arbetarrÃ¶relsen.

kulturfront skapades som instans fÃ¶r att bÃ¤ra vidare pÃ¥ arbetarrÃ¶relsens principer i det digitala, baserat pÃ¥ arvet frÃ¥n Henry Matthis (Social-Demokraten, kulturskriben) organisation med samma namn som bildades 1935.

Delar av den hÃ¤r sidan vÃ¤xlar mellan svenska och engelska fÃ¶r att underlÃ¤tta fÃ¶r vÃ¥ra anvÃ¤ndare men Ã¤ven fÃ¶r moderatÃ¶rer och administratÃ¶rer frÃ¥n andra servrar utifall att det uppstÃ¥r dispyter.

Code of Conduct

Prior art

  • Mastodon.social guidelines

The short version

  • Don't harass anyone
  • If someone is harassing you, report it to a moderator
  • Have fun
  • Pay it forward
  • Be excellent to each other


Administrator

Current

  • Coeur66

Moderators


Handling harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "â€¦" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM a moderator.

If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion.

The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.


Privacy policy

What will we do with your data? Nothing. How will you be influenced by advertisers? You won't; brands and non-humans (other than fun/useful bots) are banned. How will we aggregate your data in order to improve your serviceâ€¦ none of that.

We will never share your data with anyone else, except in the case of valid legal requests if it comes to that. (Hopefully it won't come to that!)

More privacy measures on Kulturfront:

  • EXIF data (GPS location, date, camera type, etc. etc.) is stripped from images and never stored.
  • All crawlers are blocked in robots.txt for accounts.
  • HTTPS is used everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
  • No ads or trackers.
  • Links are direct URLs rather than tracking redirects.

Understand though that this instance is run by me and my friends, and (as is the case with all Mastodon servers) we potentially have access to your data, including DMs. The back-end is also not encrypted. If this is not okay with you, this might not be the instance for you.

Also, for truly private data sent between two people, Mastodon offers no E2E encryption. So use Signal or Wire for the things you really want to be private.

Description:
This is the BookWyrm sub-domain for the `gender.systems` Mastodon instance. Users of `gender.systems` are provided registration links on Mastodon.

Please find a cozy spot with your favorite tea or coffee, and do mind the dolls.

This instance if for all those guys that love a great pair of underwear, be it wearing them and showing them off or to simply admire those who do. We are LGBT friendly and inclusive to all.

==Underwear brands== Underwear brands are welcome to join and promote themselves, we encourage you are friendly and interact with your fans and be respectful to your potential customers. We also as that you self verify your accounts using the rel="me" as shown in your profile.

Content warnings

We fully understand you are here to share your underwear collection and anything that can be seen on a public beach or catwalk is allowed on this instance, marking your media as sensitive is your choice.

As we wish to Federate with others, should your toots be lewd, include nudity, or sexual depictions, content warning should be used.

Profile & header images

All public facing images that are displayed in our profile directory and shared with other instances should be appropriate, therefore kindly refrain from nudity or sexually explicit imagery.

Connected relays

  • https://relay.gay/
  • https://relay.gayfr.social/
Short: Instance dedicated to those who love underwear or admire those that wear them, from brief to boxers, jockstraps to something a little more titillating.

Description:
Purpose

This server is intended from human scientists for human scientists of all disciplines. The intention is to provide a professional and structured platform to present & discuss research and scientific views.

This server is new and started on Nov. 25th 2022

Registration

Individuals

This server is open for publishing scientists. We warmly invite you to join. Please sign up with the

  • email address you are using as corresponding author
  • link to your publication list to get approved - the email in corresponding authors section of at least one publication should match the email address you are signing up with.

Organizations

This server is open for scientific organizations.

  • you have to register from an email address of your organization.

We will get in touch which officials from your organization before approval. Therefore please allow a time span of at least 4 working days until your account will be approved and online.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behavior, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment.

Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

Persistence of this server

We will announce a possible shutdown of this server 3 months in advance. A full transfer to other administrators will be announced 3 months in advance.

Storing data on this service

Please do not intend to use this service for storing your data. This server is aiming at timely public communication for scientists. However, we cannot and will not guarantee that whatever you post will stay online forever.
Short:
The server mainly for human scientists of all disciplines to discuss their views & latest findings.
This server is also open to scientific organisations.

Description: Heretic (from the Greek hairetikÃ³s meaning "able to choose") is a Mastodon instance started by some old elementary school friends to provide a place for the various communities they've accumulated in the last several decades â€” largely, but not exclusively, people pushing to dismantle and reimagine the systems and structures that govern our everyday life. No specific topics are the focus, but we hope that conversations naturally evolve from the personalities we're able to gather.
Short: A place for activists, organizers, educators, technologists, and anyone else working inside or outside the system to make it better.

Description:
SEE ALSO
LEMMY: https://lem.clinicians-exchange.org
EMAIL LIST: https://www.clinicians-exchange.org

WHO WE ARE
Clinicians Exchange provides a forum for mental health professionals to exchange ideas, resources and expertise including but not limited to ethics, politics, practice building, and clinical issues. It is designed to be a place where practitioners of many disciplines and settings can receive camaraderie and support in our rewarding but challenging work.

PLEASE JOIN OUR EMAIL LIST DISCUSSION
We also have an email listserv with slightly higher confidentiality where professional emails are presumably not subject to being read by the world. Please consider joining us there too at clinicians-exchange.org.

STAFF
@admin -- Michael Reeder LCPC: Owner
@jason -- Jason Hobbs LCSW, M.Div: Owner

CODE OF CONDUCT
Also note SERVER RULES below.

This is a place for professional conversations not for personal psychological help or referrals.

Posts should be related to the practices of professional psychology, counseling, social work, neuroscience, and allied professions. Peer support is allowed.

We intend to protect all members of our community from harassment and to ensure that our community is as welcoming and inclusive as possible regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality, political affiliation, or other similar characteristics.

We wish to create a supportive community where people freely share their passions and are excited and optimistic about each other's successes.

We also work to protect our community from harassment, malicious or illegal content, and individual members whose goals are to disrupt our community and promote their own self-interest at the expense of the community.
Short: This is a Mastodon instance for mental health professionals of all professions, graduate students, and retirees.  See also https://lem.clinicians-exchange.org and https://www.clinicians-exchange.org .

Description:
Welcome

Welcome to the PHP community on Mastodon! We provide a place for PHP programmers & friends to discuss topics related to the PHP programming language, frameworks, packages, tools, open source, tech, life, and more. First and foremost, we're about building community, and that doesn't always involve technical discussion, so feel free to go off-topic and have fun.

Who's Behind This?

phparch.social is an official Mastodon instance for PHP Architect LLC, the great team behind php[architect] Magazine, php[tek] Conference, and many other efforts within the greater PHP Community.

Code of Conduct

If you believe anyone is in physical danger or doing something that is against the law, please notify appropriate emergency services first by calling the relevant local authorities.

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of phparch.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

  1. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
    1. Excessive advertising
    2. Flooding the public timeline with excessive automated posts
    3. Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
    4. Untagged nudity, pornography, and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
    5. Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  2. The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
    1. Racism or advocation of racism
    2. Sexism or advocation of sexism
    3. Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
    4. Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
  3. The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
    1. Sexual depictions of children
    2. Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
    3. Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  4. Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
    1. Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed
    2. Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox)
    3. Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling)

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Reporting Harassment

To report harassment, click the three vertical dots (â‹®) on a user's profile and select "Report @user." For urgent concerns, you may contact us at hello@phparch.com.

Policies

Your continued used of phparch.social implies your agreement with our policies. If you disagree with our policies, please discontinue the use of our services.

We fully subscribe to and comply with the Mastodon Server Covenant. A number of instance blocks are implemented to comply with the principles of the covenant and to prevent our users from being exposed to content that does not comply with our instance rules.
Short: Mastodon server for PHP Architect LLC

ğŸ‘‹ Hello and welcome to DORSET.social

The place for News, Events and anything else related to Dorset.

Please keep it clean, polite(ish). If you must look down on someone, only do it with the intention of helping them back up.

ğŸ¤— How to Join

DORSET.social is for anyone living in Dorset (UK) or for any Groups, Businesses, Services and Charities that operate in Dorset.

Signup is currently invite-only at the moment, if you would like to join or for more information, please send an email to contact@dorset.social briefly explaining who you are and what you do and we'll get back to ASAP

ğŸ Funding and Support

Can you help? We are looking for sponsors, big or small â€” if you would like to help support dorset.social, please email funding@dorset.social ğŸ™

ğŸš¨ Reporting and Moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please bear in mind that you are not normally notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offences, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offences.
Short: A Mastodon community for people and businesses in Dorset, UK.

Description:
spartanburg.social is a social media site based on Mastodon designed for the use of current and former residents in and around Spartanburg, S.C. It's part of the Sparkle City Media Hub, an effort to establish nonprofit local media in Spartanburg, including local social media, a website for long-form journalism, a daily newsletter, podcasts, videos, etc.

Keeping the lights on

There's no advertising on spartanburg.social. Neither is your activity tracked and sold to Big Data. But of course there's no such thing as a free lunch. Those who can afford it are encouraged to contribute at the spartanburg.social Patreon site. Your money will support this site as well as our effort to establish other forms of local media in Spartanburg. Our purpose is to establish a place for conversations by and about Spartanburg.

What is Mastodon?

Mastodon is a micro-blogging site similar to Twitter or Tumblr. The difference is that it's based on an open standard called ActivityPub that anyone can use. Mastodon is developed by a German non-profit, Mastodon gGmbH, and it is used by hundreds of instances (servers) around the globe. These sites each set up their own rules, moderate the posts of their own users, and decide which other sites they will exchange posts with.

No one person in control of Mastodon as a whole, just people or groups who run individual instances. There are no ads nor algorithms that determine what you see. Unlike Twitter, Facebook, or Tik-Tok, there is no corporate surveillance of what you do. Data stored on spartanburg.social is kept on servers within the United States, and is only available to law enforement with a subpoena.

You can access Mastodon from any web browser or from dedicated phone apps from Mastodon and other developers.

Moving from another server?

This guide may be helpful.

A note about direct messaging on Mastodon

Just as with Twitter, any DMs you send on Mastodon are unencrypted and potentially visible to server administrators. We recommend you always use an encrypted messaging service like WhatsApp or Signal. Even then, your messages are available to anyone with access to your phone.

Who the heck are you?

The co-founders of the Sparkle City Media Project are Walt Wooton and Chandra L. Pierce.

@waltwooton was the systems editor at the Herald-Journal from 1995 â€“ 2013. Prior to that he was the operations manager at the The Independent Florida Alligator (Gainesville, FL). He has also been a freelance magazine writer published in The Floridian (former Sunday magazine of the St. Petersburg Times) Florida Trend, Florida Sportsman, Florida Audubon, and elsewhere. He was involved in the startup of online news sites both at the Herald-Journal and at the Alligator. In 2005, he won first place in enterprise reporting from the South Carolina Press Association.

@chanlp was the news research manager at the Herald-Journal, from 2000 to 2006. In 2004, she won the Judson Chapman award from the South Carolina Press Association for uncovering failings in the state sex offender registry. She has an M.L.I.S. from the University of South Carolina and is the Director of Learning Resources at Sherman College of Chiropractic.

How you can help

Want to help? We need writers, activists, business gurus, coders, and others. Email us at Walt Wooton or Chandra L. Pierce.
Short: A Mastodon instance maintained by @waltwooton for residents of Spartanburg, South Carolina, and the surrounding area. With enough support, it will become part of a nonprofit local media cooperative.

Description:
It's a collective of Northwest web builders, artists, developers, producers and writers allied to create a community of respected, highly skilled web professionals. Our aim, goal, mission, purpose, and calling stems from our original manifesto: mousecontrol = web geeks talking shop and talking shit.

A couple of years before the turn of the century, a statup group of non-conformists in Seattle launched mousecontrol. Although they were embracing electronic media to its fullest and being paid handsomely by some of the busiest corporate web houses around, the artists and develpers at mousctontrol were searching for something "more".

What was develpoped was mousecontrol.
Short: We are mousecontrol.  A global group of cyberati, founded in the mid-early 90s
