Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

While this instance is here to stay and is committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant (https://joinmastodon.org/covenant), some final tweaks and modifications are being applied.

About BoldCity.Social

BoldCity.Social is a Fediverse instance running Mastodon (Glitch-Soc, to be exact). While this instance is primarily intended for anyone in Jacksonville Florida & North Florida and it's surrounding areas, we welcome anyone else who wants to join. Ties to Duval are not required, but expect to see lots of Jax content on the local timeline.

Contact us

We encourage you to follow @support@boldcity.social where we will post any relevant instance-related news and info. You can reach out to @support@boldcity.social and/or @hmhackmaster@boldcity.social with any concerns or issues. You may also reach out to the owner via @hmhackmaster@mastodon.social (if the instance itself is having issues, for example) or via email: support@boldcity.social

New to Mastodon and the Fediverse?

While some components of Mastodon may look like other social networks, there are many core components that work differently.

  • This server is just an instance on the broader Fediverse. You can think of the Fediverse like email, where you can always email people on your same server (gmail.com, for example) and you can email anyone else (@hotmail.com or @aol.com for example). When you follow a user on a remote instance, our server reaches out and tells that remote server which then tells that remote server to let us know when that user makes a new post. We receive that post and drop it on your timeline, in near realtime!
  • You ( "exampleuser@boldcity.social" ) can follow other users from this instance AND on pretty much any other instance on the Fediverse regardless of what server they are on or what software their server uses. Just search for their entire username, formatted like "@username@instance.social"!
  • There is no search on the text of posts. This is like old-school Twitter where you use "#Hashtags" for discovery!
  • There are dozens and dozens of clients for Mastodon on mobile devices and on the web. You don't have to use the "build in" web interface here and, if you want, this can be your last visit to the BoldCity.Social web site! These other clients query the BoldCity.Social API just like this web interface and can present your timeline in many different ways. (3rd party clients will never ask for your password and will instead request API access via your account. While you should be careful what clients and apps you connect to your account, you can revoke the client's access at any time!)
  • Along with your Home timeline, you can also browse the Local and Federated timelines
    • The Local timeline is a raw feed of all posts by any other user on this server, ordered newest first.
    • The Federated timeline is a raw feed of all posts that this instance receives from other instances on the Fediverse. We usually only get posts when a local user follows the user on the remote instance, so this feed can be all over the place.

We encourage you to check out this website that has a bunch more non-technical information about the Fediverse: https://fedi.tips/

Rules, detailed

  1. Be respectful and courteous to all users.
    • This is a basic policy for life, kindness helps make the world a better place
  2. Hate speech, discrimination, harassment, bullying and abusive/threating behavior will not be tolerated, specifically that which is directed at any race, color, religion, sex (including sexual orientation or gender identity), nationality, age, or disability.
    • Bulling others isn't acceptable just because you are not communicating with someone in person. We will review any reports (and proactively monitor public posts) for violations and issue warnings or bans as appropriate. You may appeal a decision and have your situation reviewed by a small committee, provided the appeal isn't made in bad faith.
  3. Do not post illegal content or content that promotes illegal activities. This includes but is not limited to piracy, hacking, and drug use. It is your responsibility to ensure that the content you post is legal.
    • Our servers are hosted in Jacksonville, Florida USA and we are bound by the laws applicable to Florida and the United States of America. Please don't get yourself or anyone associated with the management and administration of the server in trouble!
  4. Posting or sending spam is not permitted. This includes creating spam accounts that only serve to provide profile links or advertise products and services and utilizing direct message and tagging to send spam.
    • No one like spam! You are unlikely to violate this rule if you create an account to promote your local business and you make posts around how cool your stuff is while responding to people and interacting with the community. You will violate this rule if you make repeated posts with the same content just so you show up on the top of timelines and especially if you tag people to increase the chances of them seeing it. Your org should be able to exist on it's own and not just because you force people to see your content.
  5. Respect the privacy of other users. Do not post personal information about others without their consent.
    • "Doxxing", or the posting of peoples private info without their approval is unacceptable. Even information that's technically public record (such as voter registration information) comes with an assumed expectation of privacy and shouldn't be shared with ill intent. The weaponization of private information (such as posting someone's phone number or address because they said or did something you disagree with) is never acceptable and will result in the removal of the content and the suspension of your account
  6. Use content warnings when appropriate. This includes sensitive content and topics such as violence, graphic content, and NSFW material. Accounts that are dedicated to posting sensitive content are not permitted. Repeat violations of this rule will result in suspension.
    • Our Mastodon instance, like other Mastodon instances and other social networks, permit the posting of content that others my find upsetting or triggering. Mastodon includes functionality to hide the content of a post behind a Content Warning: please use this functionality to hide these types of content behind a warning (for those who have their accounts and clients set to hide Content Warnings by default).
    • More information is available here: https://fedi.tips/how-to-use-content-warnings-cws-on-mastodon-and-the-fediverse/
  7. Accounts that impersonate a person, brand, or entity are not permitted, unless they clearly indicate in their bio AND account display name that the account is unofficial and/or parody. Accounts that cause confusion from other users may be disabled at the discretion of the admins.
    • Parodying an account or business can be great fun and is certainly acceptable, but significant confusion can come from fake accounts on a new platform and instance, especially across the broader Fediverse. Please help keep things less confusing by identifying parody, unofficial, and bot accounts
  8. Brand and entity accounts are permitted but are required to follow all rules. As it can be challenging to confirm the legitimacy of brand and entity accounts, it is suggested that you contact the admins prior to creating such accounts.
    • The Fediverse has a varied relationship with corporate or band accounts. While some don't want to see any companies or organizations on their feed or in their network, it's ultimately up to the server rules to decide what each server allows. We permit non-human entity accounts, like brand or organizational accounts as long as the account follows the other rules (particularly the rule about spam not being permitted). While we have no rules about entity size, because of how the Fediverse works it's usually a good idea for a bigger brand or organization to have their own server instance which allows them to post whatever they want and control the way their band is shown. If you need help or want to talk through this, please feel free to reach out and I am happy to share what I know.
  9. Do not create multiple accounts for the purposes of ban or suspension evasion. Please tag bot or alt accounts with your primary account.
    • In almost all situations, if your account is banned we are asking you (as the person) not to return to this server. There are plenty of other Fediverse instances that you can join and it's likely that you will be able to follow any accounts that you previously followed and interacted with. Please do not create another account to avoid the ban and return. If you feel the ban or suspension was made in error, please feel free to reach out (via email, don't create another account) to appeal the moderator action.
    • Even if you are banned, you can still export your data (for 30 days) and import it to another instance.
  10. Violation of the rules (or any action that is determined by the moderation team to be not permitted) will result in suspension or ban, potentially without notice or warning. You may appeal a moderator action but decisions by admins are final.
    • We are human and not perfect so mistakes will be made, but we act in good faith and do our best to review each situation in context and decide accordingly. We may identify a situation that does not violate a specific rule but is not the kind of content we want on this server. Please remember that this instance is not a public space where your presence is guaranteed and we may ask (demand) that you leave. The beauty of the Feiverse is that you can always create an account on another instance that has rules and policies better aligned to you.
  11. Please see the About page for a more detailed list of policies, rules, and information about this instance.
    • Hey look, you found it!
Last Updated: 2023-04-07

Description:
What is this server for?

  • The warmth of sharing poetry. Feeling seen, and seeing others.
  • Public posts should be poems you wrote that are over one week old and the inspirations behind them.
  • Except for Community Saturdays when it's open to anything related to poetry: questions, polls, event announcements etc.

Why am I building it?

  • I've experienced the joy of sharing poems in a small group, as opposed to sharing on general social media. The vibe is just different in poetry only spaces.

Why should you trust me?

  • I've been writing and performing poetry for as long as I can remember. I understand the whole range of emotions that come about from sharing bits of your spirit in a performance or post.
  • I've helped build IRL safe spaces for writing communities
  • I started Giant Heart Poetry Co. to do larger poetry projects in a sustainable way. This Mastodon is one of them. We're independent and will grow slowly to help ensure that the community remains kind.

How does it work?

  1. Apply through this form
  2. You will be emailed an invite link to sign up
  3. Share your poems and memories
  4. Favourite and Reply to other posts
  5. Follow other poets
Short: A safe space to share your poems and the stories behind them.

Description: Eine kleine Mastodon-Instanz fÃ¼r Menschen aus Dortmund und aller Welt.

Demonhaus is the personal domain of the eldritch monstrosity, Lyric von Seydlitz. It is primarily dedicated to queer-themed fiction and art, especially by transgender creators, although not limited in scope to only those topics.

This server is invite-only. Existing members are allowed to invite trusted friends and acquaintances. Invite links are also included in the Author Notes of Lyric's writing and on her personal Discord server. In this fashion, Demonhaus is meant to complement Lyric's existing online community.

Here is the Core Rule: DON'T BE AN ASSHOLE

Here are the Sub-Rules:

Prohibited content on this server includes the following:

  1. Any form of bigotry, including racism, sexism, transphobia or xenophobia. Discrimination or hatred directed against anyone because of religion, skin color, race, sex, gender, gender identity, sexuality, culture or disability is a fast ticket to banishment.

  2. Any association, formal or informal, with a fascistic, bigoted or right-wing political movement. We do not welcome Nazis, Tories or Republicans here.

  3. Any content which is illegal under the laws of the United States of America, or the Federal Republic of Germany.

  4. Any content which involves or depicts the sexualization of minors under 18 years of age. This applies to both photoreal and cartoon content. 'Lolicon,' 'shotacon' and any variation thereof are strongly forbidden.

  5. Gratuitous depictions of photoreal gore, when outside of a fictional narrative context.

  6. Any promotion of non-consensual sexual activities such as rape, bestiality or pedophilia. While discussion of topics is permitted, any toot that can be interpreted as arguing in favor of these behaviors is strongly forbidden.

  7. Art theft. If you repost visual art that is not publicly available on Mastodon, you must attribute it by linking back to the artists' original profile, be it on Pixiv, Tumblr or even Twitter. Un-attributed reposting of art will be deleted, as will any reposting which violates the wishes of the original creator. Artists, please send takedown requests to Lyric.

  8. Any mockery of neopronouns or nonbinary topics.

  9. Any mockery of furry subculture.

Content which is NOT prohibited on this server, but requires content warnings, includes the following:

  1. Discussion of national or international politics. Mastodon is a global community, so please indicate in your content warning what nation or region's politics you are discussing.

  2. Permitted NSFW content. A simple NSFW content warning will do, although additional description may be useful.

  3. Aside from the above two, please use content warning as you see fit. Simply remember common courtesy.

Moderation requests, including #Fediblock, will be handled by Lyric. Please be patient when submitting requests. Personal concerns can be DMed to pynkbites@demon.haus, or send via Discord to pynkbites#6969, and she will make every effort to ensure everyone on this server feels comfortable and safe.

Our federation policy is still evolving. Any instances which lend themselves to harassment, bigotry, pedophilia, abuse, hatred, right-wing politics will be blocked. Similarly, any instances which manifest such content due to poor moderation will also be blocked. Others may be silenced at the discretion of Lyric.
Short: Demonhaus is the personal domain of the eldritch monstrosity, Lyric von Seydlitz. It is a trans-centric space dedicated to her community and queer creators.
Mastodon-Server der Verbraucherzentralen in Deutschland

Description:
This is a server for Tejatiers.

  • What is a Tejatier?
    Any definition would be circular.

  • How do I become a Tejatier?
    I'm still not sure how it keeps happening.

  • I want to sign up for this Mastodon server and it won't let me, why are you being mean?
    I'm sorry! If you really do feel that this server is the best fit for you, then that's really weird, but I assume it means you have some method of contacting Solra or Nemo and badgering them into letting you sign up. So do that.
Short: If you are a Tejatier, you might have a Mastodon account here.

Description: Pleroma: An efficient and flexible fediverse server

What is SolarSystem.social?

solarsystem.social is a Mastodon server for the planetary science community.

Who can join?

Any professional working in the field of planetary science can join, including:

  • students, postdocs, researchers, professors, engineers, and administrators,

  • institutions, societies, communities, academic journals and publishers,

  • journalists, science educators, science promoters, and the occassional well-behaved bot.

When creating an account, please let the moderator know who you are and how you fit the above criteria. If we can not verify that you are an active planetary scientist, your account will not be approved. If this server is not for you, please consider joining one of the other great communities on Mastodon, such as those listed on Academics on Mastodon.

What can you talk about?

You can post on any subject that interests you, personal or professional, including (but not limited to) planetary science!

How can I find accounts to follow?

First, check out the opt-in list of planetary science accounts on Mastodon.

Second, you can use Followgraph for Mastodon. This returns a list of accounts that are followed by the people you follow.

How is this server funded?

The administrators of this site pay for both the domain name and the hosting at masto.host. The base operating cost for a small instance of a hundred users is about two hundred dollars per year, but as the number of accounts grows, so will the cost of maintaining it. If this mastodon instance is to serve the entire planetary science community, it will require donations from its members.

How to donate?

There is no requirement to donate to create an account, but if you would like to see this community thrive, please consider setting up an appropriate donation. Break even costs for running this server would be about 1-2 dollars per year if every user contributed. We accept several types of donations:

  • Liberapay.com (recurring donations)
  • ko-fi (one-time or recurring donations)
  • PayPal (one-time donation)
  • crypto, bank transfers, other (contact admin)

All donations will be used exclusively for maintaining solarsystem.social activities. Excess funds will either be used to fund future operations or to develop additional services (such as a peertube instance, a pixelfed instance, or a matrix server, for example).

Privacy statement

We will never provide or sell any information about any of our users to any party. We do not require you to use your real name, and we encourage you to use single-use email addresses. Nevertheless, please be aware that all your posts are public, and that private messages are not end-to-end encrypted. You should expect that anything you post here will eventually be consumed by data scrapers and search engines. We host this server using masto.host, but even though they also respect your privacy, data breaches can occur. If you need to communicate with someone privately, please use an end-to-end encrypted messenger.
Short: A Mastodon server for the planetary science community.

Welcome welcome new members! This instance is run by Kabi services to give users in Algeria the opportunity to explore the Fediverse and be part of it! Enjoy the microblogging experience, invite your friends and build your own community.

KABI.tk along with DZ.social is run and funded privately. We might relay on donations in the future. We have years of experience with web applications.

Description:
This server is operated by NodeSpace Hosting (aka NodeSpace Technologies, LLC). Systems, programming, open source, and more! We like to have fun and this isn't just a place for work - this is our public community!

Follow @status for the latest maintenance, planned downtimes, outage reports, and more related to the nodespace.social server.

Want to support this server? Buy hosting from us! Since we are a for-profit company, we don't accept donations. Instead, purchasing our products and services will help us cover our costs. If you don't need hosting, we also offer SSL certificates, domain names, email hosting, and more.

Please follow the rules and have a great time!
Short: This is a server is ran by NodeSpace Hosting. Systems, programming, open source, and more!

Description:
Diese Mastodon-Instanz (smartcity.social) wird vom gemeinnÃ¼tzigen Bundesverband Smart City e.V. (auch BVSC genannt) fÃ¼r seine Mitglieder und Partner-Organisationen betrieben.

Der BVSC ist die ganzheitliche, interdisziplinÃ¤re Forschungs- und Bildungsplattform fÃ¼r die intelligente Stadt der Zukunft, genannt Smart City, welche sich insbesondere durch die Verschmelzung von Versorgungsnetzen (Energie, Kommunikation, MobilitÃ¤t, Transport, usw.) in einer intelligenten und hochgradig vernetzen, d.h. interoperablen Infrastruktur auszeichnet.

Bereits seit 2011 denkt der BVSC Nachhaltigkeit und Digitalisierung zusammen, mittlerweile auch Ã¼ber die Stadtgrenzen hinaus - in die sogenannten Smart Regions.

Inhaltliche Schwerpunkte des BVSC sind
â€¢ die rationale Ressourcenerzeugung und -verteilung mit einem Schwerpunkt auf nachhaltiger und regenerativer Energieerzeugung, -speicherung, -verteilung und -nutzung
â€¢ neue MobilitÃ¤tskonzepte
â€¢ eine innovative GesundheitsprÃ¤vention und -versorgung
â€¢ intelligentes Wohnen, Leben, Lernen und Arbeiten in einer Ã¤lter werdenden Gesellschaft (Demografischer Wandel)
â€¢ Datenschutz und -sicherheit unter der BerÃ¼cksichtigung von PrivatsphÃ¤re und PersÃ¶nlichkeitsrechten

Von entscheidender Bedeutung ist die Einbindung aller gesellschaftlichen Akteure, d.h. Politik, Verwaltung, Forschungseinrichtungen, Wirtschaft und vor allem die Bewohner:innen der Smart City/Region, in diesen Forschungs- und Entwicklungsprozess.

This Mastodon instance (smartcity.social) is operated by the charitable non-profit German Smart City Association (a.k.a. Bundesverband Smart City e.V. a.k.a. BVSC) for its members and partner organisations.

The BVSC is the holistic, interdisciplinary research and education platform for the intelligent city of the future, called Smart City, which is characterised in particular by the fusion of supply networks (energy, communication, mobility, transport, etc.) in an intelligent and highly networked thus interoperable infrastructure.

The BVSC has been thinking about sustainability and digitalisation together since 2011, and now also beyond the city limits - in the so-called smart regions.

The BVSC focuses on the following topics

â€¢ rational resource generation and distribution with a focus on sustainable and regenerative energy generation, storage, distribution and use
â€¢ new mobility concepts
â€¢ innovative health prevention and care
â€¢ intelligent housing, living, learning and working in an ageing society (demographic change)
â€¢ data protection and security, taking privacy and personal rights into account.

It is of crucial importance to involve all social actors, i.e. politics, administration, research institutions, business and above all the residents of the smart city/region, in this research and development process.

Angaben gemÃ¤ÃŸ Â§ 5 TMG / Information in accordance with the German Telemedia Act:
Bundesverband Smart City e.V.
Alte GÃ¤rtnerei 2
55128 Mainz
als gemeinnÃ¼tzig anerkannt durch das Finanzamt Mainz-Mitte (Steuernummer 26/674/12881)

Vertreten durch / represented by:
Mirko de Paoli (Vorstandsvorsitzender), Andrea Geyer-Scholz (stellvertretende Vorstandsvorsitzende) und Stefan Slembrouck (stellvertretender Vorstandsvorsitzender)

Description: 0rb.it Mastodon is a decentralized and open-source server hosting the Mastodon social networking platform. It offers a refreshing alternative to centralized social media, allowing users to connect, share, and interact within a federated network. With a focus on privacy, users have control over their data and can engage in meaningful conversations. Join 0rb.it Mastodon for an empowering social media experience that respects user autonomy and values open-source collaboration.
Short: 0rb.it: A decentralized and open-source social networking server where users can connect, share, and interact within a federated network. Join for privacy, freedom, and meaningful conversations.

Defederates on the basis of user and instance safety- this largely only includes instances hosting reactionary or illicit content, but will occasionally include others, the reasons for which are listed below to logged-in users.

Donations are not currently accepted.

Description:
Trout Garden is a small instance for friends to hang out; somewhere we can talk about our interests, lives, projects, and more. Registrations require an invitation from an administrator.

Trans rights; Black Lives Matter; ACAB.

Information

â€œThe administratorsâ€ refers to the administrators of this organization; a list will be made available soon.

Trout is dedicated to providing a safe and harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

Some Trout spaces may have additional rules in place, which will be made clearly available to participants. Participants are responsible for knowing and abiding by these rules. Any use of â€œTroutâ€/â€TROUTâ€ or â€œTrout spacesâ€ includes Trout Garden and the Lets Get Baked Trout Discord.

Trout prioritizes marginalized peopleâ€™s safety and well-being over privileged peopleâ€™s feelings and comfort.

Code of Conduct

  • Speak with kindness and truthfulness; be proactive in doing good.
  • No harassment.
  • No questioning or challenging someoneâ€™s stated self-identity or chosen labels, even if they conflict with your own views. For example, discussions about bi vs pan, trans vs trans*, or whether gray/demisexual people are asexual, even if well-intentioned.
  • No incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
  • No deliberate â€œoutingâ€ of any aspect of a personâ€™s identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse.
  • No publication of non-harassing private communication.
  • No unwelcome comments regarding a personâ€™s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, relationships, drugs, and employment.
  • No gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behavior in spaces where theyâ€™re not appropriate. These must be accompanied by a content warning in spaces where they are appropriate.
  • No offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, age, race, national origin, ethnic origin, nationality, immigration status, language, religion or lack thereof, or other identity marker.
  • No use or abuse of â€œReverseâ€-isms, including â€œreverse racism,â€ â€œreverse sexism,â€ and â€œcisphobiaâ€ against marginalized members. â€œReverseâ€-isms and any concept that uphold and bulwark white and privileged supremacies out of the context of challenging it will be shut down.
  • No debating the rights and lived experiences of marginalized people in the community.
  • No racist, sexist, cissexist, ableist or otherwise oppressive behavior is allowed, casual or explicit. This includes any harmful language, behavior, or action toward people of color, trans folks, disabled and other marginalized identities.

Harassment includes:

  • Deliberate misgendering or use of â€œdeadâ€ or rejected names
  • Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like â€œhugâ€ or â€œbackrubâ€) without consent or after a request to stop
  • Threats of violence
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Stalking or following
  • Unwanted photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease

Reporting

If you see a violation or have any other concerns, please report via the built-in Mastodon functions, or via email to Jack at jackalune@gmail.com. If the violator is on the team, they will recuse themselves from handling your incident and will be investigated further by the rest of the team. We will respond as promptly as we can.

This code of conduct applies to all Trout spaces, including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both online and off. This code of conduct also applies to non Trout spaces when a Trout member is involved. If you are being harassed by a member of Trout outside our spaces, we want to know about it. We will take all good-faith reports of harassment by Trout members, especially the administrators, seriously. This includes harassment outside our spaces and harassment that took place at any point in time. The admin team reserves the right to exclude people from Trout based on their past behavior, including behavior outside Trout spaces and behavior towards people who are not in Trout.

In order to protect volunteers from abuse and burnout, we reserve the right to reject any report we believe to have been made in bad faith. Reports intended to silence legitimate criticism may be deleted without response.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom weâ€™ve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them, if we believe that doing so will increase the safety of Trout members or the general public. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harmful behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harmful behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from all Trout spaces and identification of the participant as a harasser to other Trout members or the general public.

Joining

Membership in Trout is reserved for individuals 18 years of age or older.

Trout is an invite-only space. Any member can recommend a new individual to the community, but invitations may only be sent by the administrative team. We want to maintain a small and well moderated piece of the internet where we can comfortably hang out.

When first joining, consider posting an introduction and pinning it to your profile! Use the #introduction hashtag so others can say hello.

Content Warnings

Please utilize content warnings when posting NSFW content, and include within the warning that the content is NSFW. Do not post any content which is illegal in the United States or Europe.

Credits

  • Server thumbnail art by Remy (tumblr, twitter).
  • Code of Conduct text edited from that provided by LGBTQ in Technology
Short: Trout Garden is a small instance for friends to hang out; somewhere we can talk about our interests, lives, projects, and more. Registrations require an invitation from an existing member.

Description:
pigeon.place is a very small-scale server for myself and a few friends. currently running glitch-soc via fedi.monster. owned by @zero with @art as an admin

used oliphant's tier 0 blocklist as a base with many alterations made (last updated 10/15/2023). going forward, recommendations will be sourced from seirdy's tier 0 list as needed. you are welcome to contact us (in good faith) if you are on a server that is blocked and you don't think it should be.

if any users spot an instance that needs to be defederated/limited for not following our rules please tell me @zero

HARD INSTANCE RULES:

(if you don't follow these you will get suspended/deleted)

  • no sexual content involving minors (including artistic depictions)
  • no gore or extremely graphic violence (including artistic depictions)
  • no bigotry (e.g . racism, homophobia, transphobia, misogyny, nazi shit). critical discussion of these topics is welcome but be mindful of others and use content warnings (CWs) liberally
  • no trolling, dangerous misinformation (e.g. antivax garbage or conspiracy theories), or blatantly inciting violence. as above critical discussion is welcome
  • no bot accounts or automated mass following/content aggregation to be hosted here

SOFT INSTANCE RULES:

(if you don't follow these you will receive a warning)

  • all images posted with Public visibility must contain an accurate image description to ensure accessibility. descriptions are also encouraged for Unlisted and Private posts but won't be enforced
  • no targeted harassment (e.g. repeated hostile replies, block evasion, instigating dogpiling/brigading) even if you feel it's justified
  • no nudity/sexual content without a very obvious CW. also try not to host pornography on here please i don't want to get in legal trouble
  • no photos of blatant drug use/paraphernalia for the same reasons as above
  • no paid advertising (it's fine to promote stuff you personally like though)

PWEASE NO STEPPY:

  • don't upload gigantic videos/audios/image files on here, hosting is expensive
  • you can make jokey death threats to your friends/about oppressors or whatever ("punching up") but don't let it get out of hand. remember that mastodon is not secure or private
  • if you need to DM someone and it's important that it stays private, for the love of god take it offsite

header picture from imageafter
Short: very small-scale instance for myself and a few friends

Description:
Welcome to the Axle.social Mastodon Server

Greetings, technophiles! Axle.social is a decentralized social media server hosted on Mastodon for those who eat, breathe, and live technology. Whether you're a software developer, entrepreneur, SaaS enthusiast, mobile app developer, or simply a tech aficionado, this is your haven to engage, collaborate, and innovate.

Join our thriving community to:

  • Discover the latest trends in software development, applications, and digital entrepreneurship. Get your daily dose of tech news from our highly engaged, like-minded community members. The decentralized nature of Mastodon ensures that our timeline is free from algorithmic interference, making it a reliable source of information.

  • Engage with other tech enthusiasts, share ideas, solve problems, or engage in intellectually stimulating discussions. Whether youâ€™re stuck with a code or debating the ethics of AI, thereâ€™s always someone here to lend an ear and offer their perspective.

  • Learn from the collective wisdom of our community. From exploring the intricacies of a programming language to decoding the mysteries of successful entrepreneurship, our community is a treasure trove of knowledge.

  • Collaborate on projects or kickstart your entrepreneurial journey by finding a co-founder for your startup idea. Our community is filled with diverse skill sets and potential partnerships waiting to be discovered.

  • Promote your latest SaaS application, mobile app, or tech service. Share your journey, gather feedback, and find early adopters among our members. Remember, a successful product often begins with a supportive community.

Key Features:

  • Decentralized and Open-Source: We believe in the power of open source, and our server is completely decentralized, ensuring that your data is in your control.

  • Privacy-focused: Our server is built to respect your privacy. You can engage freely without worrying about data surveillance or intrusive ads.

  • Inclusive and Respectful: Axle.social fosters an inclusive environment for everyone, irrespective of their background, skill level, or area of interest. We enforce a strict code of conduct to ensure respect and safety within our digital space.

Join Axle.social today to become part of our dynamic and diverse Mastodon community. Together, let's shape the future of technology and entrepreneurship. Welcome aboard!
Short: Welcome technophiles. Whether you're a software developer, entrepreneur, SaaS enthusiast, mobile app developer, or simply a tech aficionado, this is your haven to engage, collaborate, and innovate.

Description: TAKE YOUR HEART

We are building a decentralized social hub for anyone from around the world. We welcome you to post about your interests and anything you like to talk about! Our team is excited to have you join us and we look forward to seeing your posts on the Fediverse!

Sign-ups to this instance are by application only to help prevent bot account creation and to foster a healthy community. For these reasons, please provide a detailed reason you want to join, in English, on your application. It is our top priority that this is a safe and friendly space for all our users.

If this server is ever to shut down, we agree to follow the Mastodon Server Covenant and give you 3 months' notice so you have time to transfer.
Short: A LGBTQIA+ Owned Mastodon Instance!

Description:
niagara.social is a Mastodon+Hometown instance that hopes to be a social hub for the region of Niagara, Ontario, Canada. The hope is that we will build a safe, inclusive, fun and useful place for those in the region who want to still be social online without being forced to use private software that makes them feel bad.

This instance aims to be an anti-racist, anti-fascist, anti-colonial space and will not tolerate behaviours that are flatly racist, sexist, transphobic, homophobic, ableist, misogynistic, or otherwise bigoted.

Additionally, do not post any illegal content, or talk about illegal acts, or otherwise post anything that could cause legal trouble for the server (where your images and posts live).

niagara.social is always a work-in-progress (but right now it's really a work-in-progress).

Here's where we are: [-] get instance online [ ] consult with organizers and members on rules, a code of conduct, blocklists, new members, etc.. [ ] figure out governance/decision-making [ ] figure out long-term funding (currently paid for by Kostyn, but it's very affordable) [ ] figure out "hit-by-a-bus plan" (get other folks involved in the technical maintance of the site)

Three blocklists have been imported (26/06/2023): 1. Recommended â€œBare Minimumâ€ List, 2. Birdsite Live Blocks, 3. Meta Domains Blocklist from https://writer.oliphant.social/oliphant/the-oliphant-social-blocklist

-Kostyn
Short:
niagara.social is a Mastodon+Hometown instance that hopes to be a social hub for the region of Niagara, Ontario, Canada.

Art by @squirrelsnest@niagara.social

Description:
Auf social.medienzentrum.rocks lautet unsere wichtigste Richtlinie: "Seid nett zueinander!"

Wir sind das Medienzentrum Frankfurt e.V.

Richtlinien

Bitte denke daran, dass es auf der anderen Seite des Bildschirms echte Menschen gibt, die vielleicht andere GefÃ¼hle, Meinungen und Erfahrungen haben als du. Manche von ihnen sind vielleicht mÃ¼de oder haben einen schlechten Tag. Oder du vielleicht.

Du musst nicht mit jemandem einer Meinung sein, um hÃ¶flich zu sein. Wenn du nicht hÃ¶flich zu jemandem sein kannst, lass ihn in Ruhe.

Wenn du mit jemandem nicht interagieren oder seine BeitrÃ¤ge nicht sehen mÃ¶chtest, stehen dir die Funktionen â€Stummschaltenâ€œ und â€Blockierenâ€œ zur VerfÃ¼gung.

Wenn dich die BeitrÃ¤ge einer Person wÃ¼tend oder verÃ¤rgert machen, nimm dir etwas Zeit, um dich zu beruhigen, bevor du antwortest. Du kannst auch versuchen, dich einfach aus dem GesprÃ¤ch zu verabschieden und die Person bitten, dich aus der Diskussion zu entfernen, wenn du ein Thema nicht mehr diskutieren mÃ¶chtest.

Wenn dich jemand bittet, ihn oder sie in Ruhe zu lassen, lass ihn oder sie in Ruhe. Wenn du das GefÃ¼hl hast, dass du deinen Drang, dieser Person zu antworten, nicht kontrollieren kannst, benutze die Blockier- oder Stummschaltungsfunktion, damit du ihre BeitrÃ¤ge nicht siehst und nicht in Versuchung kommst.

Denke daran, dass du das Verhalten anderer zwar nicht kontrollieren kannst, aber trotzdem fÃ¼r dein eigenes Verhalten verantwortlich bist, auch wenn du das GefÃ¼hl hast, dass jemand unhÃ¶flich zu dir oder jemand anderem war.

Wir dulden kein beleidigendes oder stÃ¶rendes Verhalten von oder gegenÃ¼ber Nutzern auf social.medienzentrum.rocks. Dazu gehÃ¶rt, dass du dich weiter mit jemandem unterhÃ¤ltst, der dich ausdrÃ¼cklich darum gebeten hat, ihn in Ruhe zu lassen, dass du andere Nutzer dazu aufforderst, sich in deinem Namen mit dieser Person zu unterhalten, dass du die persÃ¶nlichen Daten einer anderen Person ohne deren Zustimmung sammelst und postest und dass du andere dazu aufforderst, sich mit dieser Person auf anderen Plattformen zu unterhalten. Jemanden zu blockieren und dann auf der anderen Seite der Blockade zu sitzen und weiter Ã¼ber diese Person zu sprechen, ist ebenfalls ein provozierendes Verhalten.

Bevor du etwas postest, solltest du dir Ã¼berlegen, ob du diese Dinge in der Ã¶ffentlichen Timeline sehen mÃ¶chtest (oder ob du mÃ¶chtest, dass deine Mutter oder deine Kinder sie sehen). Es gibt Einstellungen fÃ¼r die Sichtbarkeit von BeitrÃ¤gen, mit denen du steuern kannst, in welchen Timelines dein Beitrag erscheint, sowie CW- und NSFW-Buttons, mit denen du bestimmte Texte und Bilder in deinem Beitrag ausblenden kannst. Sei ein guter Nachbar in den sozialen Medien und nutze diese Funktionen, wenn es angebracht ist.

Nicht erlaubte Inhalte auf social.medienzentrum.rocks

  • Sexuelle Darstellungen von Kindern
  • Inhalte, die in Deutschland und verboten sind, wie Holocaust-Leugnung oder Nazi-Symbolik; Antisemitismus, Antiziganismus oder Ã¤hnliches.
  • Verhaltensweisen, die die Ideologie des Nationalsozialismus fÃ¶rdern
  • Inhalte, die als Fehlinformation/VerschwÃ¶rung angesehen werden

Inhalte, die aus der Ã¶ffentlichen Timeline entfernt werden:

  • BelÃ¤stigung, Stalking und Doxing
  • Ãœbertriebene Werbung
  • Ungekennzeichnete pornografische und sexuell eindeutige Inhalte
  • Ungekennzeichnete Grausamkeiten und extreme grafische Gewalt

Wir werden auÃŸerdem alle Inhalte aus der Ã¶ffentlichen Timeline entfernen, die wir als hasserfÃ¼llt gegenÃ¼ber bestimmten Personen oder Gruppen erachten oder die darauf abzielen, Schaden zu verursachen oder dazu aufzurufen. Dazu gehÃ¶rt auch Ableismus.

Diese Richtlinie ist absichtlich allgemein gehalten, weil wir nicht die Absicht haben, "Anwalt der Regeln" zu spielen, wenn es darum geht, was man Ã¼ber Menschen sagen darf und was nicht. Als Faustregel gilt: Wenn du etwas sagen willst, von dem du glaubst, dass es gegen diese Regel verstÃ¶ÃŸt, solltest du es nicht sagen.

Timeline Flooding

Um das beste Nutzererlebnis zu gewÃ¤hrleisten, bitten wir dich, keine zwanzig Nachrichten in zwei Minuten zu verschicken (Beispiel), da die Leute mehr als nur einen Nutzer in ihren Timelines sehen wollen. Wenn du mit einer hohen Frequenz posten willst, stelle bitte deine BeitrÃ¤ge auf nicht aufgelistet ein, um die lokale Zeitleiste lesbar zu halten. NatÃ¼rlich haben wir dafÃ¼r VerstÃ¤ndnis und kÃ¶nnen bei kritischen GrÃ¼nden, wie z. B. einer ernsten Notsituation, eine Ausnahme machen.

Crossposting

Dein Account darf nicht als alleiniger Spiegel einer anderen Plattform verwendet werden: Wenn du einen Account auf diesem Server hast, erwarten das Team und die anderen Nutzer, dass du mit einer echten und authentischen Person interagierst - und von ihr liest. Wir verstehen, dass du vielleicht auch Crossposts von anderen Plattformen machen mÃ¶chtest, aber wir bitten dich auch, das nicht ausschlieÃŸlich zu tun.

Hinweise zum Melden / Moderieren

Wenn du Inhalte siehst, von denen du glaubst, dass sie gegen diese Regeln verstoÃŸen, melde sie bitte zur ÃœberprÃ¼fung. Wenn du einen Account meldest, fÃ¼ge bitte ein paar BeitrÃ¤ge hinzu, die einen RegelverstoÃŸ zeigen, falls zutreffend. Wenn es zusÃ¤tzliche Informationen gibt, die bei der Entscheidungsfindung helfen kÃ¶nnten, fÃ¼ge sie bitte ebenfalls dem Kommentar bei. Das ist besonders wichtig, wenn der Inhalt in einer Sprache verfasst ist, die niemand im Moderationsteam spricht. Bitte beachte jedoch, dass wiederholte Falschmeldungen von Benutzern nicht erwÃ¼nscht sind und als Missbrauch von Funktionen behandelt werden.

Solltest du versehentlich gegen unsere Regeln verstoÃŸen haben, kÃ¶nnen wir versuchen, dich zu erreichen, also achte bitte darauf, das Team von social.medienzentrum.rocks nicht zu blockieren.

Diese Richtlinien sind kein rechtliches Dokument, sondern sollen dir einen Einblick in unsere Moderationsrichtlinien geben. Die endgÃ¼ltige Auslegung obliegt der Administration von social.medienzentrum.rocks, und die Administration behÃ¤lt sich das Recht vor, die Zugangsberechtigung eines Nutzers jederzeit und aus jedem Grund zu widerrufen, sofern dies nicht gesetzlich vorgeschrieben ist.

Status der FÃ¶deration

social.medienzentrum.rocks glaubt nicht an Zensur. FÃ¶deration ist ein Netzwerkdienst, und die Aussetzung der FÃ¶deration mit einem anderen Server wird nur als letztes Mittel eingesetzt, wenn Inhalte von einem anderen Server nach deutschem Recht Probleme verursachen kÃ¶nnten, oder in FÃ¤llen von technischen Schwierigkeiten oder feindlichen oder bÃ¶sartigen AktivitÃ¤ten. Wenn wir aus einem dieser GrÃ¼nde die FÃ¶deration aussetzen oder eine andere Instanz zum Schweigen bringen mÃ¼ssen, wird dies weiter unten vermerkt. Haben wir deiner Meinung nach eine falsche Entscheidung getroffen? Ping uns an!

(Hinweis: Du kannst weiterhin mit Nutzern auf stillgelegten Instanzen kommunizieren; ihre BeitrÃ¤ge erscheinen jedoch nicht in unseren Ã¶ffentlichen Timelines. Du kannst keine BeitrÃ¤ge von Nutzern auf suspendierten Instanzen sehen).

Ein Problem melden

Bei technischen Problemen verwende die Kontaktinformationen des Administrators, die unter "Kontakt" aufgefÃ¼hrt sind:

  • Wenn du ein Nutzer auf social.medienzentrum.rocks bist, kannst du die Funktion "Missbrauch melden" auf dem Beitrag verwenden, den du melden mÃ¶chtest;
  • Wenn du kein Nutzer von social.medienzentrum.rocks bist oder ein Administrator eines anderen Servers, der eine Missbrauchsmeldung Ã¼ber einen unserer Nutzer besprechen mÃ¶chte, verwende bitte die unter "Kontakt" angegebene Administrator-E-Mail

Description:
About Kiddush.social

Kiddush.social is a Mastodon server meant to be a home in the Fediverse for frum, Orthodox, traditional, and other observant Jews. Of course, all are welcome, but the server rules and culture are designed with this target audience in mind. Grab some kugel, make a l'chayim, and share a d'var Torah or just schmooze with us here on Kiddush.social!

Server Rules

1. What is hateful to you, do not do to your fellow; the rest is commentary

2. No harassment, trolling, brigading, dogpiling, or doxxing

When encountering someone with a bad opinion, your options are to engage kindly and constructively with them or to ignore, block, and/or report them. There is never an excuse for online harassment, and Kiddush.social cannot be used as a platform for such behavior, nor will it tolerate it from other instances. "Harassment" includes continuing to engage with someone after they have asked you to stop.

3. No antisemitism or promotion of antisemitic tropes

While we don't believe that antisemitism is worse than other hateful ideologies, as a Jewish instance, Kiddush.social can easily become a target of antisemitism. We must be especially vigilant against antisemitism in order to protect our users.

4. No promotion of discriminatory or supremacist ideologies of any kind

While we are particularly sensitive to antisemitism, it is far from the only hateful ideology, and none of them are tolerated here.

5. No use of slurs or other hateful language

No matter the context, slurs are never allowed.

6. No pornographic, erotic, or â€œshockâ€ content

Kiddush.social is not the place for sharing any pornographic content nor any kind of gore or "shock" content. This is true whether or not a content warning is used.

7. No threats of, or incitement to, violence

While we recognize that there are situations where violence is justified, Kiddush.social nonetheless does not tolerate threats of violence or attempting to incite others to violence under any circumstances.

8. No spam

Business and bot accounts are allowed with admin approval if they are relevant. Even when such accounts are allowed, spamming and other annoying or manipulative methods of advertising are not.

Content Warnings

We strongly encourage the use of content warnings when posting about disturbing or upsetting topics. There are no comprehensive guidelines for what posts do and do not require content warnings, but at a minimum, posts describing or depicting violence, especially sexual violence, should include one.

Alt Text

Kiddush.social does not require alt text to be added to posted media, but does encourage it when possible. Alt text helps those with visual disabilities and others (such as those with poor internet connections) to know what is being depicted in images and videos without viewing them directly.

Federation Policy

We primarily see suspension of other instances or "fediblocking" as a way to prevent harassment of our users and as a way to insulate Kiddush.social from instances in which violations of our server's rules are not only allowed but extremely prevalent. We will generally suspend individual users or consider limiting an instance before suspending an entire instance. We use Seirdy's Fedinuke list as a basis for our instance's blocklist in order to ensure that most of the obvious malicious instances are blocked. However, we are open to appeals if the inclusion of any of these instances is inconsistent with our general federation guidelines.
Short: Grab some kugel, make a l'chayim, and share a d'var Torah or just schmooze with us here on Kiddush.social!

Description:
Hello!

Welcome to chaos.futbol, a Mastodon server for women's soccer fans. Everyone who loves women's soccer (and follows the Code of Conduct) is welcome here.

Other social media sites push clickbait and ads the second you sign up, so they can monetize your attention. Mastodon is different. If you want to know why, see "Why is Mastodon so weird?", but tl;dr if you want to have a good time, you need to follow people.

Getting Started

If you want to immediately get some #WoSo in your feed, you can start by following some groups. These groups are moderated accounts that automatically boost posts that mention them. Three groups I run are:

  • USWNT
  • NWSL
  • WWC - for the Women's World Cup, only really active during the WWC

The next thing to do is fill out your bio and add a custom avatar. You don't have to share personal details, but customizing your bio/avatar means when you follow people, they are much more likely to follow you back. If you don't care about that feel free to ignore this step.

Now, it's time to follow people with wild abandon! If you end up not liking them you can always drop them like Lindsay Horan dropping A-Rod.

(Actually please be polite and just quietly click "unfollow". Be more like Emily Sonnett dropping Christen Press.)

Anyway. There's a bunch of different options for finding people to follow. You can...

Browse your timelines. You have three timelines - "home" shows you all the posts/boosts from people and hashtags you follow, "local" shows you all posts/boosts from people on chaos.futbol, and "federated" shows even more posts from the wider network. The federated timeline will have more content than your home timeline when you're starting out so I recommend taking a look.

Three timelines! Wow!

Browse hashtags. Some good woso hashtags are #NWSL, #WoSo, #MastodonFC (includes woso & broso) and team hashtags like #USWNT, #CanWNT, #WashingtonSpirit, #BAONPDX, #DashOn, etc. Plus there's a whole world of non-soccer hashtags.

I also recommend checking out #Introduction to find people to follow. Make your own post and tag it #Introduction so people can follow you! #NewHere works similarly.

Fun fact: if you like a hashtag, you can follow it! On a hashtag search page, look near the top right for a follow button. Click it, and any posts with that hashtag will automatically show up in your feed.

Browse the public timelines and directories of other sports-related servers like nwsl.club, mastodon.skrimmage.com, SportsBots, and mastodonsports.social.

Add people from my curated follow list.

FAQ

I hate the Mastodon user interface...are there any alternatives?

For an alternative web interface, try Elk.

For iOS, try Mammoth (free) or Ivory (paid - made by the same folks who made Tweetbot).

For Android, try Tusky (free).

More app options can be found here.

I'm trying to follow someone on another server and it's giving me this complicated prompt. Why can't I just click follow?

This difficulty is one of the downsides of federation. But there are extensions you can install to make it easier! On Firefox, check out Mastodon Simplified and on Chrime, try FediAct.

(I'm sorry this is so annoying right now. Mastodon was a labor of love by a small group of people for years - now that money and resources are flowing into the community, hopefully we'll see some big UX improvements soon.)

I'm watching a game on delay and don't want to be spoiled, but want to keep using Mastodon. What should I do?

You can mute keywords permanently or have them expire after a period of time. These are called "filters" and you can find them as an option under Preferences.

I have other interests besides sports, you know! Where can I find other people to follow?

There's tons of curated lists of academics to follow - check them out!

There's also a list of lawyers and legal scholars and a list of journalists.

I follow someone I like but they boost too much stuff/stuff I don't like.

You can choose to hide a person's boosts and only see their original content. To do this, go to their profile, click the three little dots next to their follow/unfollow button, and select "hide boosts".

List of accounts to follow

  • mirror of the official NWSL twitter feed
  • mirror of the official NWSL Players Association twitter feed
  • mirror of Angel City twitter feed
  • USWNT group account
  • NWSL group account
  • WWC group account

Why is Mastodon so weird???

Mastodon is unlike any other social media site you've used before. Instead of being owned by one giant for-profit company (or one cool startup that will eventually sell the platform to a giant for-profit company) it is decentralized. The community is made up of tens of thousands of independent people and organizations who all share posts with each other. This decentralized model is often called federation.

Federation has a lot of benefits and just as many drawbacks. On the plus side, Elon Musk or Mark Zuckerberg is never going to buy up Mastodon and destroy it. And if you don't like how your current server is being moderated, you can pick up and move somewhere else.

Mastodon also interoperates with lots of other platforms. It's part of a federated universe (us nerds call it the Fediverse). There's Lemmy (a federated Reddit/Hackernews), Pixelfed (a federated Flickr), Bookwyrm (a federated Goodreads) and many others. You can follow Lemmy, Pixelfed, Bookwyrm, etc accounts from your Mastodon account and their posts will show up in your feed! You can reply in Mastodon and your replies will show up on the original post as comments!

One of the coolest things about the Fediverse is how anyone can build platforms for it and share those services without having to convince a whole bunch of people to sign up for new accounts. Mastodon is the biggest and best developed hub in the Fediverse, but over time more and more services will be added, and Mastodon itself will continue to grow and improve. We're just getting started!

Now, onto the downsides...

Because the Fediverse is decentralized, and there's no big money-making algorithm pushing ads and trending content in front of you, it takes a bit of work to get started. You need to be proactive in finding and following people, hence the Getting Started section above.

A lot of things are more annoying because they're happening across servers instead of in one giant centralized space. For example, when you follow someone on a different server you need to take an extra step to add them, because their server doesn't automatically know who you are like your server does. Also, you often can't see all the replies to a post by someone you follow unless you go to the other server.

Developers are working on making all of these things less frustrating and confusing, but it'll take time to improve them. Until November 2022 most of the Fediverse was made by volunteers. We're now getting lots more resources in the community, but it takes time to build and improve. (And by "lots more" I don't mean, like, VC money. Venture capitalists want nothing to do with a free and open community they can't monetize.)

If you ever get confused or frustrated, try asking questions using the hashtags #FediHelp or #AskFedi, or send a message to your admin, @shauna. It is totally normal to be confused, and I want to help you get comfortable here!
Short: This is a server for fans of all things #WoSo, with a particular focus on the #NWSL and #USWNT.

Description:
Skyhoppers.Club

This instance exists first to give my buddies that listen to my podcast The Skyhoppers Podcast place to make their home in the Fediverse. Some patrons had made comments about not quite understanding how Mastodon works, so I took it upon myself to create a space for them and to be their guiding hand through the Fediverse (even though I'm kind of a n00b myself). I'm just starting out on my admin journey, so I'm very open to feedback/helpful tips!

This isn't just an instance for my podcast, though. I've been a huge fan of Star Wars all my life and after I left the internet at large at some point in the last few years, I was really missing a place to talk/post about it and discuss it with other like-minded people. So we'll call that reason Nummer zwei that this instance exists: for Star Wars fans! Hopefully the URL is ambiguous enough to maybe drag in a few stragglers from out there amongst the stars.

Once the podcast Patreon gets started back up (I've had it paused while we've been on break, so our coffers are a little light), I'll be using money from there that doesn't go into hosting the show to host this instance. We had a website for a while, but wouldn't you know that having a website requires a lot of unfun work that I never wanted to do. So hopefully this sticks a little better :)

The rules basically come down to "don't be a dick." I'm not going to tolerate hate of any kind here, and you'll get booted right quick if you start talking shit like that. There's a little more detail in the Rules section below if needed. If you enjoy your time spent here, take a second to consider subbing to our Patreon and supporting my efforts that way. Otherwise, just hang out, be cool, and have fun!
Short: Created as a place for fans of the Star Wars podcast The Skyhoppers Podcast to convene, but any general Star Wars fans or other cool people are also welcome!

Le Conseil fÃ©dÃ©ral et les dÃ©partements peuvent utiliser cette instance pour des comptes officiels. La Cancelleria federale svizzera gestisce questa istanza di Mastodon nell'ambito di un test pilota. L'obiettivo Ã¨ quello di fare esperienza con la comunicazione in una rete organizzata in modo decentralizzato e basata su un software aperto.

Il Consiglio federale e i dipartimenti possono utilizzare questa istanza per gli account ufficiali. Description:
Esper.lol

Esper.lol is a Generalised Anime Mastodon instance which means you can talk about whatever. Other languages are allowed but we ask for Mostly English.

The instance is themed on Mob Psycho 100 but it is not pinned to just the topic of Anime, I just thought the domain would be cool and like the show ğŸ“º.

Esper.lol updates and website

You can follow @Esper for instance updates and information.

OH! I also made a website for the Instance: spiritsandsuch.lol

Rules and such

Rules on Esper.lol are pretty light. The only time servers will be de-federated will be due to either being a bot-spammed mess or breaking our small list of rules on a wide scale. Please read the rules section below for a complete list of the server rules!

Moderated servers are only available to logged-in users due to blocked servers attempting to harass esper.lol after being blocked.

Staff

At the moment I, @Arataka am the only staff member.

Learning Mastodon

  • What is Mastodon (Video): Link

  • How to use Mastodon (Video): Link

  • How to move to another Mastodon instance (video): Link

  • Mastodon mobile apps: If you are looking for other ways to access Mastodon this page should help you: Link

  • Mastodon on GitHub: Link

Why does this instance look different than vanilla Mastodon?

Esper.lol uses Bird-like UI as its theme. This instance is 100% vanilla Mastodon directly from the official git repo. If you are interested in the Bird-like UI theme the source code can be found here: Github

DMCA Takedown Requests

Only content posted by users with "@esper.lol" in their username is managed by this server. If you find infringing material from a user on our server, make sure it is not covered by Fair Use, then send your takedown request to this instance's admin email ([hello] @ [spiritsandsuch.lol]).

Instance hosting information

This instance is hosted on Hetzner cloud with 4vCPU and 16GB of RAM.

  • Daily backups of all services

  • Media CDN

  • Status page for uptime tracking

Funding

Hetzner Refferal Link: Ref

Using this link gives you â‚¬â 20 credit on Hetzner! If you spend â‚¬â 10 I get â‚¬â 10 credited for Esper.lol hosting costs!

No other funding source is currently available

Alternative instances!

I also host the instances aincrad.lol and vrparty.social, Aincrad is another anime based instance but running Sharkey instead of Mastodon. VRParty is another Mastodon instance but is instead centered around VR content.

  • Aincrad: Link
  • VRParty: Link

All instances have a shared block list.

More information

You can find more information about Esper.lol on the spiritsandsuch Esper hub. This includes the full block list for Esper.lol: Link

Credit

Emojis:

Neocat: Link

catgirl/distrowos/senko/showbyrock/skil: Link

SAO: Link

Partial credit to urusai.social for some parts of this instances about section/rules.

Banner credit: IMDB

Esper.lol was created on 7/4/23.
Short: Generalized Mastodon instance. Have any evil spirit issues lately?

Description: Akkoma: The cooler fediverse server

The purpose of this server is to give myself and a handful of others a place where we can safely post standard NSFW content without our instance shutting us down without cause. The majority of large Mastodon instances state they tolerate NSFW content when the rules are followed, but in my experience this isn't really true. They may find the occasional NSFW post perfectly acceptable, but NSFW-focused accounts are merely tolerated until one day they aren't. Making my own instance has ensured that we can get content out without bogus reports or shadow admin practices keeping us locked down. - neomobius
Short: This instance is run by NeoMobius for NeoMobius. I got tired of getting limited by other instances and being forced to bounce around, so I made my own home!

Weiteren BehÃ¶rden, Institutionen und Vertretern der unmittelbaren und mittelbaren Landesverwaltung und weiteren Organisationen des Landes Sachsen-Anhalt steht es offen, die Instanz fÃ¼r das Betreiben eines eigenen offiziellen Accounts zu nutzen.

Falls Sie Interesse an einer Nutzung der Mastodon-Instanz haben, wenden Sie sich bitte an mastodon-redaktion@sachsen-anhalt.de. Bitte nutzen Sie die Adresse auch fÃ¼r Fragen oder Meldungen zu Inhalten.

Description:
Author Help

This Mastodon instance is provided by Author Help for the benefit of the indie author community.

We adhere to the Mastodon Server Covenant.

We may change the rules occasionally. Any such changes will be announced.

Statement of Principles

This server is operated according to our statement of principles, given below and also at our website

We at Author Help believe that:

  • Every authorâ€™s words are their own, and they should retain creative and financial control of their books
  • Free speech and freedom of expression are important
  • Our freedoms are also important. We are not obligated to work with authors whose works contravene laws on hate speech or go against our principles

Further, we believe that:

  • Black lives matter
  • Disabilities do not reduce or negate a personâ€™s validity or value
  • Trans rights are human rights
  • All love based on respect and consent is good
  • Voices of all ages deserve to be heard
  • Freedom of belief is important, but does not extend to oppression of others
  • Human rights apply to all, regardless of a personâ€™s place of birth or the circumstances they find themselves in
  • Caring for the environment is everyoneâ€™s responsibility
Short: This Mastodon instance is provided by Author Help for the benefit of the indie author community. All indie authors are welcome to join.

Description: BLAHAJ.ovh is a delightful Mastodon server for BLAHAJ owners and more. Treat this as a friendly community where everyone is welcome. Description:
Share your travel memories on Pixel@AlDi-Server, a self-hosted non profit service by a networking and server enthusiast from Germany.
Pixel@AlDi-Server is being hosted on private servers in Germany outside any cloud. The name was original derived from my initials.
I try to keep this service running, as i have fun with networks and servers. And of course without any profit orientation.

Have fun and a great time.

Alex
Short: Share your favourite travel memories on Pixel@AlDi-Server, a self-hosted non profit service by a networking and server enthusiast ;)

Description:
Named after the black rocks at Peggy's Cove, this is a Mastodon instance for rad folk in Mi'kma'ki.

A breakdown of the meaning behind the flag by its designer, Christy Ã“ Ceallaigh-Bisson (@GarlicBreath@blackrocks.social):

"The bisected flag with a black half is the classical anarchist form. The sky blue symbolizes the South Shore of Mi'kma'ki, and evokes a solar punk orientation to our post-capitalist vision. The red star represents socialism. Most germane to our instance, the blue juxtaposing black represents the dreaded black rocks of our coast line."
Short: Named after the black rocks at Peggy's Cove, this is a Mastodon instance for rad folk in Mi'kma'ki.

Description:
What is Natestodon.social?

It is a decentralized social hub for people that know correct Nate. Do you know the correct Nate? Well, if you do then he probably invited you here.

Signups for this instances are by application only. Please let us know how you know Nate when you sign up. This is a friendly place where people can share what they are doing, music they like, things they are eating, and cute animal pictures.

This server agree to follow the Mastodon Server Covenant and give you 3 months notice before this server shuts down so you can transfer to another server.

admin/owner: [@Nate](https://natestodon.social/@nate
Short: A little Mastodon instance for people that know Nate

Description: you come into MY house, use MY server, and call ME GAY??

Welcome to phx.pub!

This is a regional Mastodon instance for people in the greater Phoenix (Arizona) area. We aim to be a pleasant place in the fediverse for fellow friendly denizens of the desert. Join up and roast with us!

I recommend following Peccary, the phx.pub bot for morning/evening weather and more.

Server Info

This server is backed up daily.

In the event I can no longer run the instance, I will transfer control to someone able/willing.

This instance abides by the Mastodon Server Covenant

Status page
Short: Hi, phx.pub is a Mastodon instance for the greater Phoenix area. It's run by me, jensen, an IT guy born and raised here, roasting since day 1.

Description:
This is a semi-private Mastodon instance for Minecraft fans who do other things, too!

We are seeded from the Existence Community, but don't be afraid to ask to join!

Attributions

Pride flags by ZoÃ« Bijl.

Pride Minecraft bees by moon.

Original text emoji set by SugarCaney.

Other emoji may be dubiously unattributed; please contact hey@igalaxy.dev if there are any issues.

Code of Conduct

In the future, this instance will follow the updated Existence Community Code of Conduct. Until then, it will follow the terms of service/code of conduct of the flagship Mastodon instance. Please read and follow them while participating in this community.

Additional Guidelines

  • Posts containing a piece of art must be credited, ideally with a link back to the source.
  • Provide appropriate content warnings on potentially sensitive posts and use NSFW tags liberally on adult images, spoilers, and other content that not everyone may want to see.
  • Current event discussion is permitted but you are highly encouraged to use a current event or politics content-warning.
  • Far Lands Cafe is a primarily English-speaking instance, but posts in other languages are allowed.

Operations

Far Lands Cafe is run on a VPS located in Central USA. Media is stored on Cloudflare R2.

Donations

You may support operating costs via Ko-fi.
Short: Semi-private Mastodon instance for Minecraft fans who do other things, too!

Description: The Anthropomorphic Writer's Outreach Organization (AWOO)â€™s mission is to promote and support furry writing. AWOO accomplishes this through providing resources to these writers such as: knowledge banks, articles, links, and media covering a gamut of subjects endemic to success as a writer. AWOO also provides opportunities for social networking with experienced furry writers both at conventions and on collaboration platforms such as this one. AWOO performs outreach to the greater community through panels conducted at multiple conventions open to all registered attendees.
Short: This server is the home to the Anthropomorphic Writer's Outreach Organization, or AWOO for short.

Description:
By signing up to this server you agree to partake actively in the quest for world domination to smash the patriarchy, and free the proletariat. This may involve working with the Robot Monkey Army, Cyborg Werewolf Ninjas, Algebraic Velociraptors, and/or a Necromanced Kung Fu Audrey Hepburn.

Time travel may not have already become a part of your day-to-day experience here; #DontPanic, you have just not got to that part yet.
Short:
Express yourself freely.

Optional: Join the Robot Monkey Army, Cyborg Werewolf Ninjas, and Algebraic Velociraptors, in an epic war for the emancipation of the intergalactic proletariat.

Short: Invite-only private server. A home for role play and fan-fiction writing. All accounts portray fictional characters. All content is fictional.
Ukraine-supporting, LGBTQ-friendly, Mastodon server.

Description:
chtn.uk is a network for cross-institutional collaboration on inclusive description issues, including sharing resources, tools, and examples of good praxis across and beyond the UK cultural heritage/GLAM sector.

Formally, you are encouraged to:

  • Introduce yourselves (you can use the hashtag #introduction)
  • Share any resources that you're working on related to inclusive description work (use hashtags like #critcat #metadata #GLAM #UKheritage #inclusivedescription)
  • Share any heritage projects that might be of interest to others
  • Share your thoughts on any resources or projects related to inclusive description work and DEI issues across the heritage sector
  • Ask others for help/advice regarding inclusive description projects
  • Share your queries about terminology choices within the heritage sector (use the hashtag #inclusiveterminologyquery)
  • Share reading suggestions that might be of interest to others, including your own blog posts, articles, books etc.
  • Cite your sources, use Mastodon's "Content Warning" feature as necessary, and add alternative text to any images that you share

    • Informally, you are encouraged to:

  • Use this platform as your personal social media page such as you would use Twitter (you can change the privacy of individual toots if you wish)
  • Share what you're up to
  • Share what you're reading/watching
  • Share photos of yourself/ recent trips /your pets / your friends & family
  • Post or retoot relatable/funny or political content, as long as it is respectful of all peoples and does not violate the server rules

    • Support chtn.uk

    The @chtn.uk Mastodon server is currently self-funded. Any small donations are greatly appreciated. The running costs are currently $20/month, but expected to increase as the server gets larger.
Short: Network for cross-institutional collaboration on inclusive description issues, including sharing resources, tools, and examples of good praxis across and beyond the UK cultural heritage/GLAM sector.
An awesome server ran by alton.cloud.

Description:
The team at BBC Research & Development are researching social technologies and exploring possibilities for the BBC. One part of our work is to establish a BBC presence in the Fediverse.

This is an experiment - we will run it for 6 months, and then look at how much value it has provided, how much work it requires to maintain and then decide whether and how to continue. We're learning as we go, and we'll write about what we discover in the hope that it might be useful for others. The BBC will continue its normal social media activity in the usual places.

We're starting off small with just a handful of accounts from R&D and our colleagues at BBC Radio, but we hope to be adding more accounts from other areas of the BBC soon:

  • @BBCRD
  • @BBC5Live
  • @BBCRadio4
  • @BBC_News_Labs
  • @BBCTaster
  • @Connected_Studio
Short: This is an experimental Mastodon instance run by BBC Research and Development.

Description: Pixelfed is an image sharing platform, an ethical alternative to centralized platforms.
Short: Pixelfed is an image sharing platform, an ethical alternative to centralized platforms.

Description:
FOSS Place is a community of open-source advocates and enthusiasts who are passionate about sharing their knowledge and skills with others. We are completely user-funded, which means that we rely on the contributions of our members to keep our community running.

We are a welcoming community that invites everyone to see the power of open-source. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced developer, we have something for you. We offer a variety of services, including tutorials, forums, and social platforms to help you learn and grow.

We believe that open-source software is the future, and we are committed to making it accessible to everyone. We are a diverse community, and we celebrate our differences. We believe that everyone has something to contribute, and we welcome your participation.

Here are some of the things you can do in the FOSS Place community:
* Learn about open-source software
* Find help with open-source projects
* Share your knowledge and skills with others
* Collaborate on open-source projects
* Meet other open-source enthusiasts

If you are interested in learning more about the FOSS Place community, please visit our website. We would be happy to welcome you to our community.

Here are some additional things to mention about the FOSS Place community:
* We are a global community with members from all over the world.
* We are always looking for new ways to improve our community.
* We are committed to making open-source software accessible for everyone.

We hope you will join us in the FOSS Place community!

Quick Links

  • Website

Rules and Policies

  • Community Guidelines
Short: FOSS Place is an open-source community that welcomes new users and advocates, engages, and collaborates with other open-source projects and developers around the globe.

Description: This is the Mastodon instance for the Notre Dame Linux Users Group.
Short: Notre Dame Linux Users Group
Hacker&Makerspace im Emsland / Sustrum Moor

Description:
Welkom bij ANNADON, het ANNACON clubhuis op MASTODON.

ANNACON VZW heeft als doel de kennisdeling omtrent cybersecurity te bevorderen.

Via deze weg willen we een Nederlandstalig kanaal opzetten dat de ANNACON community kan ondersteunen in het uitwisselen van nieuwsfeiten en gedachten.

Wees welkom!

Meer info op https://www.annacon.be.

Volg ons ook via https://www.linkedin.com/company/89255386/.
Short: Welkom bij ANNADON, het clubhuis van ANNACON op Mastodon. Wij zijn een Nederlandstalige community rond informatiebeveiliging.

Description:
bynight.cafe - a Fediverse instance for those who are looking for a cozy and safe space. Imagine a rainy evening, a hot drink, people you like and stories both real and fictional.

Language

People are diverse and speak diverse languages, as is to be expected, but we also want to build a shared community. You are invited to use either English or German as our shared language. All official communications will be handled in English.

Attribution

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 International License.
Short: bynight.cafe - a Fediverse instance for those who are looking for a cozy and safe space. Imagine a rainy evening, a hot drink, people you like and stories both real and fictional.

Description: Offroad Town is a federated decentralized social media instance. Meant to host photos and videos much like mainstream social platforms. Without the data mining and suggestion algorithms.
Short: Offroad Town is a pixelfed instance for the off-road community.

Description:
This is a mastodon instance created to give nonprofit organizations a voice in the fediverse. This is a professional oriented instance and all posts or other content originating from this instance must be appropriate to a casually professional environment. Hateful, lude, overly vulgar, abusive, misleading or threatening content is not permitted here, even when content warned.

Be sure to read the rules for more info on some of this. Moderation will be handled based on both the list of rules and this description.

At the time of this writing, I am the sole owner and administrator of the server, handling all costs involved. I do this in my free time and have a full time job, so responses may be delayed. If the server becomes large enough to justify it, I may ask for moderation assistance, and possibly financial though that is unlikely. I run this instance as a service to nonprofits who may wish to have a presence on Mastodon, but are daunted by the number of possible instances and/or the rules regarding organizations, advertisement, and things like that.

To avoid the need for personally keeping up with technical maintenance, I have chosen to run this instance through masto.host, which is itself a one person owned company. There are pros and cons to such an arrangement, and it is quite different from large social media. Should there be any lengthy interruption to the instance for any reason, I will do my best to contact users with what information I have. Decentralization has its risks, but it also has the advantage of more control. Should your organization at any point decide to move instances, including setting up your own, there are migration tools available.
Short: This is a mastodon instance created to give nonprofit organizations a voice in the fediverse. This is a professional oriented instance.
